loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
I sell soft drinks, juice, candy, churros, and fruit to people who walk past my small food cart on the street. Right now I need to buy more supplies to fill my cart so that I can increase my revenue and be better able to help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo una pequeña carreta en la que vendo refrescos, jugos, dulces, churros y frutas a todas las personas que pasan por esta calle. Ahora necesito abastecer mi carreta para poder mejorar mis ingresos y poder ayudar mas a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy candy, churros, water, soft drinks, fruit, and other food

loans.name: Khumara

texts.en:
Khumara is 33 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the  Fizuli region , Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.  She is married and has a child. She has been in this business for 5 years. She sells agricultural produce in her own car. 
 Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy spare parts for her car. This business allows her family to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: La

texts.en: Mr. S. La was married in 1990 and has 4 children. He is currently in the business of building boats. He started this business more than 13 years ago. He finished primary school but his wife has never attended school. His wife, Mrs. Choeurn Noeurn, is a housewife. All of his children are studying at the local school except the oldest daughter who is weaving silk at home. He has borrowed loans from MAXIMA  three times. The current loan amount is $1,000. He will use this loan to purchase some materials for building boats and buy silk material and sewing thread for his daughter as well. Since the first loan, he never had any problem repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase some materials for building the boat and purchase silk material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Baba

texts.en: Baba is 45 years old and married with seven children.  He runs a small business selling groceries in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. Although Baba’s shop looks well stocked, most of the goods are taken on credit and it is more expensive than when the goods are purchased in cash.  In addition he pays his installments on a daily basis. With seven children Baba spend most of his profit on school fees.  He is planning to increase his stock and build his own capital and for these reasons, he is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Purchase inventory with cash to avoid losing profits by taking credit.

loans.name: Xuan Vu

texts.vi:
Mr Vũ is a simple man and honest. He likes raising poultry very much. This is why in his home there are a few hundreds ducks that lay eggs. His wife sells pork at the market. His family income is good. He's applying for a loan to buy duck feed. The revenue generated by his poultry business would permit him to repay back the loan without problem.

Translated frm Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chú Vũ là người đàn ông chất phác thật thà.Chú rất thích nghề chăn nuôi, vì vậy trong nhà chú lúc nào cũng có vài trăm vịt đẻ trứng và ngan thịt... Vợ chú thường xuyên đi chợ bán thịt lợn. Thu nhập gia đình cũng khá giả. Chú vay vốn đợt này để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi. V ới khoản thu nhập này chú có thể hoàn trả được số tiền này một cách dễ dàng.

loans.use: to buy duck feed

loans.name: Savali

texts.en: Savli is 39 years old and lives in the village of Leusoalii, where she runs a business selling bananas and taro at the town market every Friday.  She has two children, both of whom are in school.  Her banana and taro plantation has done well, and is the sole means of support for her family. Sales generate a profit of $80 a day, which Savli uses to pay the bills, run her business and make donations to her church. She plans to use this new loan (her second)  to expand her business and help renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her banana plantation

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en: Azimjon I. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children.  He has a MicroInvest client since 2006 because he heard many successful stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan circle.  He started his business selling small ware selling but now he has improved his business markedly permitting him to open his own shop selling food products.  He has a wide-side assortment (the meat products, the milk-sour products, flour products and oil) that he purchases straight from suppliers.  Now he is requesting a loan for business development and the purchasing of noodles.

loans.use: for business development and purchasing ingredients

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O., 40-years-old, has two children and lives in  Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She owns a food market and has been in business since 2004. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of  $450 to enable her to increase her inventory of food products.

loans.use: To purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a 45 year-old married woman with 4 children, ages 26, 23, 20 and 18, is a timber seller. She started the business in 2005, and she works daily from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

Mariam previously had a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and now hopes for a loan of $600 to buy more timber for her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Just a few months ago, I finished building a room in my house which is currently only missing the installation of a tile floor. My husband and I have worked very hard to be able to expand our house, given that we started with the purchase of the land and have to date been able to build two rooms which can now be lived in. We will continue to work for a better quality of life. I seek $900USD to be able to install a tile floor in my home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace algunos meses termine la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda ahora solo me falta poner el vitropiso, mi esposo y yo hemos trabajado mucho para poder hacer nuestra casa más grande, ya que empezamos comprando un terreno y hasta ahora hemos logrado hacer 2 cuartos los cuales ya podemos habitar, seguiremos trabajando para tener una mejor calidad de vida”. Solicito $ 900.00 dlls para poner vitropiso en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Install tile flooring.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin C. and his wife, Mrs. Poe Dany were married  this year. The couple is living with their parents. His wife has been factory worker for four years. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chin has been a construction worker for three years. Now he wants to create another business is running motor taxi when free from construction work. Chin is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for running a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for running a motor taxi.

loans.name: Luis Reynaldo

texts.es:
The city of Managua is known for having many beaches and beautiful places to visit; such beautiful places provide many opportunities for various economic activities. Such is the case for the Pochomil spa where Luis G. purchases seafood to sell in the area around the spa, in his home, and occasionally in the streets of his city.

He sells all types of seafood, from fish to conch to lobster, etc. This is the only income Luis has which he uses to support himself and his family—consisting of his wife, his small son, and his elderly mother.

He is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to purchase more seafood to sell. Through the loan, both he and his family will benefit greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La ciudad de Managua se caracteriza por tener muchas playas y hermosos lugares donde visitar y también donde se puede llevar a cabo una actividad económica como lo es en el caso del balneario Pochomil que es el lugar donde el señor Luis G. compra sus mariscos para luego comercializarlos en dicho lugar, en su casa y a veces en las calles de su municipio.

Vende todo tipo de mariscos desde pescados, punches, conchas, langostas, etc. Es de importancia destacar que este es su único ingreso por el que se sustenta él y su amada familia compuesta por su cónyuge, su pequeño hijo y su querida madre ya en edad avanzada.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los mariscos para su comercializacion. Por medio de este crédito se benefician tanto el como su familia la cual tiene la necesidad de mantener.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
I have a small business in my home in which I provide necessary items, such as water, soft drinks, bread, and cleaning products, to name a few, for the residents of my area. For this reason, I would like to provide my customers with greater ease in obtaining what they need for their home, while at the same time boosting my sales. My offering more products would be easier for my customers to find what they need close to home, thus they can avoid having to travel too far. I am requesting a loan of $300.00 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio en mi vivienda donde brindo a la comunidad de mi colonia servicios necesarios para su hogar, como puede ser agua, refrescos, pan y algunos artículos de limpieza por mencionar algunos, por esto me gustaría darles mayor facilidad de conseguir lo necesario en su hogar y así también aumentar mis ventas, contando con mas cosas seria mas fácil para las personas encontrar cerca de su domicilio lo que solicitan y no tener que trasladarse a una tienda mas lejos. Solicito la cantidad de $300.00 dlls.

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Tiessiri (Le Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Tiessiri is a group of five women, mostly single, with an average age of 30 and on average 2 children, who live in traditional extended families in the Sogomougou district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

They have varied businesses: selling firewood, brooms, incense, costume jewelry, guinea-fowl eggs, etc. United by relationships of neighborhood, by friendship and professional ties, these women decided, in their search for complementary financing, to join the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. They are on their second group loan, and the first was reimbursed without difficulty.

They intend to use this new loan to buy a truckload of firewood, guinea-fowl eggs, and various other items (such as earrings and necklaces guaranteed to last). They purchase their firewood from rural people from the villages surrounding the town of Koutiala who have permits to cut wood. As for costume jewelry, that comes from Abidjan (the capital of Côte d’ Ivoire).

The products are sold (often raw, or ready-to-eat as are the guinea-fowl eggs) in the surrounding markets, or out of their homes, for cash or often on credit, to a mostly female clientele. As for the firewood, that is sold to men as well as to women, but also to enterprises (bakeries, restaurants, etc.)

They expect to make on average 75,000 FCFA which will serve to pay off the loan and to help to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Tiessiri est un regroupement de cinq femmes à majorité célibataires qui a une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Siikasso République du Mali).

Elles exercent differentes activités: le commerce du bois de chauffe, de balais, d’encense, de parures, des oeufs de pindade etc. Unies par des relations de voisinage d’amitié et professionnelle ces femmes ont décidé dans leurs recherches de ressources complémentaires, d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans. Elles sont à leurs deuxième prêt de groupe et le premier a été remboursé sans difficulté.

Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter un chargement de camion en bois de chauffe, des oeufs de pintade et divers articles ( tels les boucles d’oreilles et de chaînes garanties). Elles s’approvisionnent en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans des villages environnants de la ville de Koutiala ayant une autorisation de coupe de bois. Quant aux parures elles proviennent d’Abidjan (capitale de la république de la Côte d’ ivoire).

Les produits sont vendus (souvant crues ou préparés comme les oeufs de pintades ) dans les marchés environnants, à domicile au comptant en détail et souvant à crédit à une clientèle généralement féminine. Quant au bois de chauffe il est vendu aussi bien aux hommes qu’aux femmes mais aussi à des entreprises (Boulangerie, restaurant etc....).

Elles espèrent réaliser en moyenne 75 000 CFA. qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of firewood and costume jewelry for re-sale

Achat de bois de chauffe et parures

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato tiene 38 años, en la actualidad vive con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, sembrando papa, maíz y arveja, actividad que hace para vender y para consumo propio. Todos los días sale a ver sus campos de cultivo; en el caso del maíz, lo hace secar y luego lo desgrana para ponerlo en sacos y almacenarlo para futuras ventas.El proceso para cultivar sus tierras es prepararlas echando abono, luego utiliza sus arados para la siembra, después viene la época de riego  y  echar fertilizante e insecticidas, si necesita de aplicarlos, de esa manera asegura una buen cosecha.Durante los últimos años, las variaciones climáticas han afectado seriamente sus cosechas por lo cual, desde ahora decidido cultivar para su propio consumo y producir alfalfa para la alimentación de sus animales, durante los próximos meses irá inclinando su labor mayormente a la ganadería.
Fortunato invertirá el préstamo que pide en la compra de abono para preparar su terreno, cultivar alfalfa y otros productos más.
texts.en:
Furtunato is 38 years old and lives with his 3 children. For the past 18 years he has been farming, planting potatos, corn and peas which he does to sell as well as for his own consumption. Every day he tends to his fields. In the case of corn, he dries it and later threshes it, puts it in sacks and stores it for future sales. The process for planting his fields is first to prepare them with organic fertilizer, later using his plough he sows them, and afterwards is the period when he irrigates and applies fertilizer and insecticides, if necessary. All this is to insure a good harvest. Over the past few years, climate changes have seriously affected his harvest and for this reason he has decided from now on to plant for his own consumption and to produce alfalfa for feediing his animals. During the next months, he will shift his work to mostly livestock farming. Fortunato will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of organic fertilizers to prepare his land to raise alfalfa and other crops.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizers to prepare his fields for planting.

loans.name: Guzalhon

texts.en: S. Guzalhon lives in the Spitamen region and is 24 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is a dressmaker. She works in the local bazaar and trades in dry goods for making national dresses. She faces strong competition so she has to attract customers with a good assortment. She is also a polite and kind woman. Mrs. S. Guzalhon applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ (USD $775) for 3 months to import new goods.

loans.use: To import new goods

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 35 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Oke Aro, Abulegba area of Lagos state Nigeria. Joy sells yams and garri. She has been in this business for the past four years. She buys the food from villages surrounding Lagos and she brings the food to Lagos to sell. She needs the loan to purchase more food to sell. She says "thank you" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri and yams to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. A. is 35 years old. She is widowed and the mother of five children. Through her business, Patience supported two of her children through senior high school and continues to support the others who are still in school.

She is a food vendor who sells kenkey, as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and then taken with hot peppers and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch, and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

Patience O. A. belongs to the community group called "Abrabopa" (meaning Good Life) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She does not sell on the days the group meets. Her picture was taken during one of the group meetings.

loans.use: Buy ingredients like maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El señor Virgilio M. M. esta agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron con su anterior crédito.
Su negocio ya esta establecido en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad por su edad ya no puede andar ofreciendo sus productos por las calles; el desea recibir nuevamente el apoyo para surtir su negocio con mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Señor Virgilio M. M. is thankful for the great support you provided him with his previous credit. His business is established in a central location in the city since he can no longer walk through the streets offering his products because of his age. He hopes to receive your support again to supply his business with more variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Mr. Miguel A. J.., 33 years old, is married and lives in Katipunan, Zamboanga Del Norte. He has 2 children. He has a “carenderia” (a small restaurant) where that he and his wife run. His restaurant started small and but has rapidly grown. His customers include people in his neighborhood and passers-by such as truck drivers and pedestrians. Miguel is requesting 20,000PHP to renovate his carenderia and to buy meat and spices as well. He hopes to provide a comfortable life to his family by continuing to grow his restaurant to make more money.

loans.use: Renovation of Carenderia and buy meats & spices

loans.name: Masuda

texts.ru: Масуда женщина в возрасте  37 лет , мать троих детей, муж работает водителем маршрутного городского  такси.Масуда продаёт на рынке канцелярскими товарами для учёбы.Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 8 лет.Раньше она работала медсестрой в детской поликлинике,но из-за того что её заработная плата не хватала для проживания семьи, она решила открыть свой бизнес.Для начала ей помог её муж,дав ей небольшую сумму денег.Вначале у неё был маленький оборот , но со временем она его стала увеличивать.Узнав о кредитах Масума решила взяв кредит закупить ещё товар.
texts.en:
Masuda is a woman of 37 years of age, she is a mother of three children. Her husband works as a driver of a shuttle city taxi. Masuda sells school supplies on the market. She has been in this business for eight years. Before that she was working as a nurse in a children's hospital, but her salary was not enough to support the family and she decided to start her own business. In the beginning her husband was helping her and gave her a small amount of money. When she started her turnover was very small, but with time she started increasing it. When she heard about MicroInvest loan program Masuda decided to apply for a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies merchandise

loans.name: Laiy

texts.en:
Laiy R., 54, sells rice noodles in the local market of her Siem Reap province. She is married with four children. Two of her children are in school while two others work as mechanics with their father.

She typically makes about $2.50 each day, and would like a loan to invest in a new business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for $1,000 to start a new groceR. business and to purchase mechanic tools for her children.

(Mrs. Laiy R.'s husband is pictured at home.)

loans.use: To start a grocery business and purchase mechanic tools

loans.name: Mrs. Tara Duch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group. They will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Tara D. is the 29-year-old village bank president. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Pech Buntha, is a hard working man. Mrs. Tara D. has two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Manale

texts.en:
Manale is a 31-year-old married woman with two children living in Jeb Jenine in Bekaa Valley. She has been working as a food vendor from her house since 2008.

Today, Manale wants to borrow $1,000 to buy new materials to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy new materials to increase her sales

loans.name: Sadriniso

texts.ru:
Садринисо Азизова добрая трудолюбивая женщина, проживает в городе Истаравшане с мужем Юсуфджоном и 4 детьми. 
 Садринисо занимается животноводством уже 5 лет. Хочет увеличить домашний скот, и с этой целью обратилась в "Микроинвест".
 Кроме этого, она выращивает деревья грецкого ореха у себя дома, перебирает его, после чего муж Юсуфджон продает орехи на рынке. Но ассортимент их товара не состоит только из грецкого ореха, муж Садринисо привозит другие виды сухофруктов из городов Канибадама и Исфары и продаёт их на рынке своего города. 
 Еще один доход в их семью приносит исскуство вышивания. Садринисо вместе со своей дочкой Мехрангиз вышивает национальные тюбитейки,спрос на которых возрастает в сезон свадеб.
texts.en:
Sadriniso A. is a kind and hardworking woman, living in the city of Istaravshan with her husband Usufdjon and four children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 5 years. She wants to increase her livestock headcount and reached out to MicroInvest for this purpose. Besides this business, Sadriniso also grows walnut trees at home, sorts the walnuts, and then her husband Usufdjon sells them at a market. However, their goods assortment does not only include walnuts, but also dried fruits that Usufdjon brings from the cities of Kanibadam and Isfara and sells at their city market. Embroidery also brings in an additional income for the family. Together with her daughter Mehrangiz, Sadriniso embroiders tubeteikas (traditional hats) that are in high demand especially during a wedding season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 39 years old and has operated a general store for almost 3 years. The business has become the sole source of income for her family. Eulalia is married to Orlando F. Sr. who he is 41 years old. She has 5 children; Regan is 20 years of age and a farmer, Regan Angelo is 17 years of age, Melvin is 14 years old Angel is the forth child and is in the first year high school and the youngest is Orlando F. Jr. who is 6 years old and is in grade school. 

Eulalia earns a weekly net income of PHP 1,000 from her general store. She is asking for a  loan amounting to PHP 25,000 as additional working capital. She believes that “if you work hard you should incorporate a lot of patience” you can become successful someday. She hopes that the loan she is requesting will pave the way to progress in their only livelihood.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Stanley

texts.fr:
Ce jeune célibataire pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins a eu la bonne idée d’entamer le commerce de mèches et de perruques. Cette  activité est très souvent exercée par les  femmes, il a une façon très attirante d’accueillir ses clients. Afin de réaliser une plus grosse marge bénéficiaire sur ses marchandises, il s’approvisionne au GHANA et au NIGERIA.
Il est en rupture de stock et veut  se réapprovisionner, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 40 cartons de mèches et 40 cartons de perruques.
texts.en:
This young, single gentleman, in order to support himself, had the good idea to begin selling hair extensions and wigs. This is mostly a business run by women, but he has a very attractive way of welcoming his customers. So that he can have a bigger profit margin on his merchandise, he buys his wares in Ghana and in Nigeria.

He is presently out of certain items and wants to replenish his inventory, so he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 40 cases of hair extensions and 40 cartons of wigs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions and wigs for resale

loans.name: Norma Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casada.  Está embarazada, este sería su primer hijo.  Ella  tiene estudios de educación superior (técnica en computación), vive en el Cercado.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio de molinera (moler granos). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio de molinera, comprará granos al por mayor.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para así solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los encuentros de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Ms. Norma Nelida M. is a member of the “Nueva Generación 2000” Microfinance Institute, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, department of Puno. She is a 32-year-old married woman who is currently expecting her first child. She earned a diploma as a computer technician, and she lives in El Cercado.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 9 years. She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan in a grain mill.

At this time, she needs a 2,000.00 PEN loan to invest in her mill by purchasing wholesale grains.

Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can cover the family expenses.

She really likes the meetings that take place at the microfinance institutes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris originally comes from an indigenous Shipibo community and speaks Spanish as her second language. Doris and her husband run an auto parts shop on the main road that connects Pucallpa with the faraway capital Lima. The couple’s shop is located a few miles outside of Pucallpa. The family business is in Doris's name but is called “Autopartes Villa” (after the last name of Doris’s husband).

Doris is a member of the communal bank, “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women) and has been working with Manuela Ramos for two-and-a-half years. She was one of the five founding members of her communal bank. Doris plans to use this loan of 2500 soles to buy more parts for the shop. Doris and her husband told me that their business is doing well. They are building up bit by bit. Although more capital would be useful to expand the amount of merchandise offered by the shop, Doris must be careful to only borrow as much as she can pay back. She has always been punctual with her loan payments.

Doris has one child, a five-year-old daughter who is in kindergarten. In this short video clip, Doris talks about her goal of expanding her business and increasing the variety of products available to customers.

loans.use: To augment the products available in the spare parts shop.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
CHERYL G. is 40 years old, married with 4 school-age children and lives in Brgy. Canjusa, Pulupandan Negros Occidental.

Ten years ago, Cheryl started making Ginamos - salted and fermented krill - to sell in the local market. But she found that it was not easy if you don't have sufficient capital. So when she was invited to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, she immediately got her husband's consent to join, and that was how her life changed for the better for her and her family.

Now her 4 children are all going to school, and the income from the ginamos is a big help to her family's financial stability and security. Her current operations nets PHP 7,000 per month.

For her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cheryl wants to borrow PHP 28,000.00 as additional capital so that she could increase her production capacity and improve her income potential.

What is Ginamos
Ginamos is a generic Hiligaynon (the local dialect in Western Visayas) term for anything that is salted and aged to ferment - in Tagalog it is known as Bagoong. Ginamos can also refer to fermented salted fish, mussels, oysters, etc. but in general, the term Ginamos refers to mashed salted fermented krill - all the others must be qualified - e.g. Ginamos na isda (fermented salted fish) or Ginamos na Tahong (fermented salted mussels).

Ginamos is prepared by mashing sea salt and krill together until the salt is well mixed into the finely ground krill, then it is kept in containers to age until ready. Ginamos in Negros Island is usually moist but firm and sold by the block or smaller bricks. Vendors usually pre-cut the blocks into different sizes to offer the buyers a selection. People usually buy Ginamos either as a flavor enhancer to dishes like Pinakbet (a vegetable stew) or as a dish by itself. When cooked as a dish, it is usually mixed with vinegar and sauteed with lots of garlic and sometimes with fried pork rind, and is served with rice as a meal or with green mangoes as an appetizer. 

Cheryl is shown in the picture cutting up a block of Ginamos to sell on retail.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: additional capital to expand the borrower's business operations

loans.name: Lili

texts.fr: Lili est née le 15/12/1979 à Agoné. Lili est mariée à Christian. Ils ont un seul enfant qui est scolarisé. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis vingt cinq ans. C’est le mari de Lili qui assure les dépenses de la famille. Lili vend à manger devant chez elle à la maison. Lili est dans cette activité depuis dix ans. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Lili achète ses provisions. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et faire ses provisions en gros, Lili sollicite ce premier crédit d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, riz, de causette d’igname, de paniers de tomates fraîches, d’oignons, des épices et de l’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 35-year-old married man and he has one child. He lives in Bint Jbiel, southern Lebanon, where he works as a carpenter. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new tools and material, such as wood and metal, for his work. Mohamad has been working as a carpenter for ten years now.

He is known for his commitment and determination to finish the job right. His clients are his neighbors and friends. Mohamad faced some difficulties starting off, but now that all is well he hopes to gain more experience and receive better and bigger deals.

loans.use: To buy new tools and material (wood, metal) for his work.

loans.name: Mejara

texts.en:
Mejara C. is from the village of  Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay Gingoog city. She is 39 years old. Mejara is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. Mejara owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mejara has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mejara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Mejara is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her product inventory. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mejara from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product inventory.

loans.name: Omolabaka

texts.en:
Omolabake is 47 years old and she is married with 5 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells bags of charcoal in wholesale and retail. 
Omolabake hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zenny Aiza

texts.en:
Zenny Aiza A. is from the village of Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Zenny Aiza is single. To make a living, Zenny Aiza operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. 

In 2009, Zenny Aiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenny Aiza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Zenny Aiza from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fifteen sheep and five goats

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca S. is 30 years old and owns a top-ranking beauty salon. She offers manicures, pedicures, weaving, and other treatments to her customers. She has been doing this for the last five years. She has one employee and does face challenges like a lack of stock of accessories and strong competition from similar businesses. Apart from this business, she also sells old and new clothes. She is using her 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a flat iron, hair curling tongs, and chemicals. She is looking forward to opening a hairdressing training school at which she will be the beauty instructor. Prisca is single with an eleven year old daughter and describes herself as hardworking and talented.

loans.use: To buy a flat iron, hair curling tongs, and treatment chemicals

loans.name: Nhoeum

texts.en:
Nhoeum K. is a 41-year-old married woman who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She sells fish and vegetables in the market. She started selling more than eight years ago. 

Nhoeum K. is blessed with three children. One of her daughters works in the garment factory, while the other two attend school. Her husband is a fisherman and also a construction worker. 

Nhoeum K. requested a loan of $1,000 for her husband to use as capital to buy more gear for fishing and to buy small fish to raise. She and her husband are pictured here.

loans.use: To buy more gear for fishing and to buy small fish to raise

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 62 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Junto a sus adorados animales Lucia pasa sus días, ella alimenta y cuida con mucho cariño a sus vacas, para que le brinden mucha leche y pueda elaborar así más quesos. Su lugar principal de ventas es la feria dominical de su pueblo, donde sus quesos son muy demandados y comprados rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es puede elaborar sus quesos en la comodidad de su hogar, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar la alimentación de su ganado, ya que si comen algo indebido su producción de leche puede disminuir. 
Con el tiempo, espera comprará más vacas lecheras, ya que desea incrementar su producción. 

Este es el primer préstamo de Lucia con MFP y está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que de su buena alimentación depende el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 62. She has worked very hard her whole life to get ahead.. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to have a peaceful old age. She spends her days together with her beloved animals,feeding and caring for her cows with great tenderness so that they produce a lot of milk and she can make more cheese. Her main sales are in the Sunday market in her village where her cheese is very much in demand and sells quickly. What she most likes about her work is to make the cheese in the comfort of her home. For the last 35 years she has been working in this and what she considers the most difficult aspect is the feeding of the cows. If they eat something they shouldn't, it can lower their milk production. This is the first loan that Lucia has with MFP and she is very happy with the opportunity to obtain one. In her communal bank she is one of the most solid members among her companions. With the thousand new sols that she is requesting, she will buy more feed (hay) for her animals since the progress of her business depends on how well her animals eat.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for her cows

loans.name: Corazon's Group

texts.en:
Corazon S. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 49 years old. Corazon is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Corazon S.'s Group.

Corazon is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Lucena is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as coffee, milo (a brand of malted milk), toothpaste and noodles in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately $330 a month from these activities.

In 2005, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 8th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Milagros Fiorella

texts.es: La Sra. H. C. Milagros Fiorella tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo menor, se encuentra domiciliada en casa propia ubicada en el Caserío de Santa Dominguita. Trabaja como docente desde hace 2 años y su cónyuge labora como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial. Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo ha logrado adquirir sus bienes, brindar mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y reconstruir su vivienda. Requiere el crédito para mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que en el terremoto del año 2007  se vió afectada. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
H. C. Milagros Fiorella is 24, in a common law marriage, and has a young child. She lives in her own house, which is located in the Santa Dominguita neighborhood. She has worked as a teacher for two years. Her life partner is a field worker for an agricultural business. Thanks to her hard work and effort she has been able to get their possessions, give her child a better quality of life, and rebuild her house. She needs the loan to improve her house because it was affected by the earthquake in 2007. Her dream is to finish building her house in order to obtain a better quality of life for her family. She is very grateful for the support we can offer through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Нелмуродов Курбонали проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 54 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, детский врачь. Один сын занимается починкой автомашины а другой военнослужиший. Сам Курбонали имеет высшее образование, но по специональности не работает. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. Перевозит людей с одного места на другое. В этой деятельности более 10 лет. Кредит берет для пакупки автомашины. Курбонали хочет продать свою старую автомашину и купить новую, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en:
Kurbonali N. lives in Dushanbe. He is 54 years old; married with 3 children. His wife is a pediatrician. One of his sons is an auto mechanic, the other is in the military. Kurbonali has a higher education, but he does not work in his field. He is a taxi driver, offering the service of transporting people from one place to another. He has been in this business for over 10 years. He is requesting the loan to purchase a car. Kurbonali wants to sell his old car and buy a new one, in order to make his service safer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a car

loans.name: Los Centralistas Group

texts.es: El grupo los centralistas está compuesto de 10 personas, es un grupo que está empezando a trabajar con Agrocapital, la característica de este grupo es  que son socias que se dedican a reparar y  venta de  zapatos, Hilda Vanessa que es la presidenta del grupo tiene tres hijos pequeños, su actividad principal es compra y venta de zapatos usados americanos, ella los vende por las noches en la calle y algunas veces viaja a provincias a las ferias, Hilda Vanessa realiza esta actividad desde hace 7 años atrás. El resto de las socias tiene negocios casi de las mismas características como reparación de zapatos, confección de zapatos para los grupos de baile, entre otras cosas también se dedican a la repostería, venta de ropa americana, venta de jugos, venta de refrescos, fotógrafos, filmador de videos. Hilda Vanessa utilizara el préstamo actual como capital de operación, incluso manifestó que quiere aumentar a su negocio venta de Cds, negocio que lo maneja paralelo al de los zapatos usados. El resto de las socias también utilizarán el préstamo como capital de operación ya sea para hacer crecer sus negocios o bien para uso personal. En el banco Centralitas existe bastante experiencia ya que las socias trabajan con bancas comunales en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
The Centralistas group is made up of 10 people and is a group that is beginning to work with Agrocapital. The characteristics of this group is that they are members who work repairing and selling shoes. Hilda Vanessa is the president of the group. She has 3 small children. Her main work is to buy and sell used American shoes. She sells them at night in the street and sometimes travels to markets in the provinces. Hilda Vanessa has done this work for the past 7 years. The rest of the members have very similar businesses such as repairing shoes, making shoes for dance groups, and they also work with baked goods, selling American clothes, juices, soft drinks, photographs, and video filming. Hilda Vanessa will use the current loan as working capital, including her idea of starting a business selling Cds along with selling used shoes. The rest of the group will also use the loan for working capital for either growing their businesses or for personal use. In the Centralistas bank there is plenty of experience since the members have worked with communal banks in other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Yadira

texts.es:
La  Señora Maria Yadira P. O. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 22 años, ella vende ropa interior, ropita de niño y de adulto vende en la acera a dos cuadra aledañas del mercado. Su financiamiento lo solicito par comprar más mercadería al contado y no agarrarle a los proveedores que dan al crédito más cara y aveces ni le logra sacar loe esperado en ganancias.
La señora P. Oliva  anteriormente vendía al lado del el Mayoreo  el Bisne  ropa pero no tenia una ubicación estable su negocio lo inicio con C$3,000.00 ahorro propio de ella tiene dos hijos que mantener los cuales se encuentran en colegios y hay que sacarlos adelante.
Tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel y de los cuales se siente muy bien con nosotros ya que le hemos servido para que su negocio mejore para incrementar su inventario y al suave ha venido mejorando su calidad de vida tambien
texts.en:
Señora Maria Yadira P. O. has been a merchant for 22 years. She sells underwear and clothing for children and adults. She sells on the sidewalk 2 blocks from the market. She requests a loan to buy more merchandise on a cash basis. This way she can avoid the other lenders who give very expensive credit, so that at times she does not manage to have the expected earnings. Señora P. Oliva previously sold clothing near the Bisne wholesale market, but she did not have a fixed location for her business. She started the business with 3,000 Nicaraguan cordobas of her own savings. She has 2 children to support; they are in school and she wants them to get ahead. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 10 years, and she feels very good about working with us, since we have served her to increase the inventory of her business and improved her quality of life as well.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business: clothing for children and adults, socks, lingerie, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla R. is from the village of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Perla is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Perla sells charcoal products in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Perla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Perla is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional charcoal products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Perla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal products to sell

loans.name: Aida Lizeidi

texts.es:
Aida Lizeidi P. F., tiene la edad de 35 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos de 17,16 y 14 años de edad respectivamente, ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, de comprar algunos cerdos para la cría. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Aida tiene varios años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Aida Lizeidi P. F., age 35, is married and has three children who are 17, 16, and 14 years old; they are her first priority. Aida is asking for a loan to buy materials for remodeling the pigsty as well as to purchase pigs for raising. She would like to give her livestock the right maintenance so that they could bring good income when they are sold. This is the first time she has approached FUDECOSUR for a loan, and she is very pleased with the credit terms they offer. Aida has several years of experience in the livestock business. In the future, she hopes to bring a better quality of life and a greater financial stability to her family; she also hopes to continue to grow as a person and as a livestock farmer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of the pigsty and purchase of pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Mr. Tim H. is 41 years old and a married man. His wife, who appears in the photo, is a local cultivator. This couple has seven children, four of whom are now married and have already established their own family homes, while the other three are single. Tim H. is currently able to generate a great income by raising pigs and crops. Since he doesn’t have a vehicle for his transportation needs, he normally travels to anywhere by hiring a taxi. Because he wants to cut down this expense, Tim H. has requested a loan of $700 to be used to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Eusebio Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Eusebio es un hombre trabajador, de 55 años de edad, es padre de familia de  seis hijos, y de pocos recursos económicos, pues a la fecha no ha logrado construir su casa de concreto ya que los trabajos que ha tenido han sido con sueldos bajos que solo ajusta para la alimentación. Trabaja como guarda de seguridad en un local de tragamonedas,  desde hace un año, ya que el recibe una pensión de su trabajo anterior en la policía nacional. 

Su esposa también trabaja en lavado y planchado para lograr ingresos para ajustar con los gastos básicos de agua, luz, y gastos de los niños. Parte de la pensión que recibe don Eusebio, da a su hijo mayor el pago de universidad para que pueda lograr una mejor educación, como lograr ayudar  a sus hermanos en el futuro.
Su objetivo es comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a levantar las paredes de concreto poco a poco hasta poder terminar su casa y lograr un mejor techo. 
Para esto comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro. Y comenzara la obra.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a hard-working man who's 55 years old and the father of 6. He has little money and to date, has not been able to construct a concrete home. Most of his jobs have had very low pay so he has only been able to afford food. He has worked as a security guard in a local casino for the past year and he receives a pension from his prior job as a policeman. His wife also works doing laundry in order to help with basic expenses like water, electricity and basics for the children. Eusebio gives part of his pension to his oldest son to support his university studies so he can get a better education which will hopefully help the other children in the future. He would like to buy constuction materials to start to put up concrete walls little by little for his home and put up a better roof. He will buy bricks, sand, cement, and steel and he will start the work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials like bricks, sand, cement, and steel to put up concrete walls for his home and put up a better roof

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
Chu  Thị H. (20201030044) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Chu  owns & operates a cloth business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing new cloth to local community members.  Chu  has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Chu  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Chu  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  Chu  is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Chu  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Chu  Thị H. (20201030044) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Chu  Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo mới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Chu  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Chu  kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, Chu  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Chu  đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Chu  dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Pariken Ole

texts.en:
Pariken Ole P. is 38 years old. He is a farmer and supports seven people in his family. His spouse is Nalamai P. and they have six school-going children. Nalamai is a housewife and she helps Pariken in his farming activity.

Pariken does wheat farming, which he has been doing for the last 13 years successfully. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy chemicals to spray his wheat farm.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by renting a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

His hope and dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer, owning farm machinery and being financially stable to support his family.

loans.use: He is planning to buy chemicals to spray his wheat farm

loans.name: Jamji Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JAMJI  est né le 30 décembre 2009. Il regroupe 13 femmes courageuses et travailleuses. Et comme le nom du groupe l’indique « JAMJI » LA PAIX en français, elles ont des relations au beau fixe et elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA COKI1 

Awa Y., debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est la doyenne du groupe, elle est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 7 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 5 autres enfants. 

Elle achète des tissus pour les revendre dans son quartier et au marché. C’est une activité rentable au lendemain des fêtes religieuses (Korité et Tabaski) et aux cérémonies familières (baptêmes, mariages etc.) 

Avec son crédit de 65.000 francs CFA elle va acheter en quantité plus importante des tissus pour plus de clients et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.

Son objectif est de soutenir ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group JAMJI was born on December 30, 2009. It brings together thirteen courageous and hardworking women. The group's name JAMJI means "peace". The women of the group have a fine relationship and are united by community ties. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA COKI1 Ms. Awa Y. is the group's leader (standing at the right in the photo). She is the most senior of the group. She is 66 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children. She also has five other children in her care. Awa purchases cloth to resell in her district and at the market. It's a profitable business just before religious holidays (Korité and Tabaski) and family events (baptisms, marriages, etc.). With her loan of 65,000 francs CFA, Awa is going to buy larger quantities of cloth for more customers and to increase her profit margin. Her goal is to support her children and to provide for herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Cruz Luciano

texts.es:
Don Cruz Luciano es padre de familia de dos hermosos hijos, casado y con su propio negocio una vulcanización que puso hace varios años con ayuda de sus padres. 
Es un trabajo duro ya que se utiliza mucha fuerza, y un poco peligroso, lo que le fortalece es  que es su propio negocio.
Y que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución, pues ha logrado poner también un puesto de venta de lubricantes aceites, pequeños repuestos, aprovechando su esposa a vender refrescos, gaseosas, repostería y galletas y a si lograr apoyar a que no falte la alimentación a nuestro hijos.
Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de lubricantes, aceites, repuestos y otros para seguir ofertando al cliente un mejor servicio. Logrando a si poder vender más y obtener mejores beneficios. 
Como objetivo es seguir aumentando su inventario para lograr un mejor equilibrio.
texts.en:
Cruz Luciano is married and has two beautiful children. He has his own business, a tire repair shop that he started several years ago with help from his parents. It is hard work because it takes a lot of strength, and it is a little bit dangerous. It fortifies him because it is his own business. It has grown thanks to his tenacity and help from the institution. He has also managed to set up a place to sell oil and small replacement parts. His wife takes the opportunity to sell snacks, soft drinks, pastries, and cookies. That is the way they help to make sure that their children do not go without food. He will use this loan to buy lubricants, oil, replacement parts, and other things in order to continue offering his customers better service. Then he will be able to sell more and get better benefits. His objective is to continue increasing his inventory in order to achieve better stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials like lubricants, oil, replacment parts, and materials to keep working in his tire repair business and achieve greater sales

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna, de 46 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos mayores y de su pequeña nieta, juntos desean salir adelante, habitan en un populoso barrio del norte de la ciudad. Esta trabajadora mujer, a pesar de su incapacidad física, se desempeña en varios oficios, pues siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, y sabe que en la vida no hay impedimento, por eso  todos los días sube y baja con mucho empeño del cerro donde vive, para esto se apoya en su muleta. Se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado que trae de otras ciudades a la capital, ella vende a sus conocidos y clientes fijos que le sacan la mercadería a crédito, ya que ofrece modernas prendas a buenos precios, y considera que este es un negocio bastante rentable, pues aunque demora un poco si percibe buenas ganancias. También  compra leche fresca que adquiere a buenos precios por la zona donde vive, y luego la vende en la ciudad, de esta manera se genera también ganancias extras; y como si fuera poco prepara dulce de melocotón que comercializa en botellas a sus conocidos que saben de la garantía de su preparación. Para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su mercadería en ropa y zapatos, además de comprarse una maquina para empezar a hacer realidad su sueño, como instalar una pequeña fábrica donde se prepare  dulces y néctares de melocotón. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues desea seguir sacando créditos para salir adelante y concretar todos sus planes, también afirma que le gusta trabajar con su compañera de grupo porque entre las 2 cumplen con responsabilidad y puntualidad. Johanna tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de zapatos, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir y espera generarse mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Johanna is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her two adult children and her young granddaughter. They want to get ahead together. Johanna and her family live in a populous neighborhood north of the city. She is a woman who works hard despite having a physical disability.

Johanna has worked in different jobs in order to get ahead and tries to live life as if she did not have an impediment. Every day she must walk up and down the hill where she lives with the help of a crutch. Johanna sells clothing and shoes that she brings in from other cities. She sells to her acquaintances and established customers who purchase the merchandise on credit. The products she offers are modern and come with affordable prices. Johanna also buys fresh milk in her neighborhood at a good price and then sells it in the city so that she can generate extra income. In addition, she prepares peach preserves and sells them in bottles to her acquaintances who are familiar with how she makes this product. She has future plans to increase her inventory of clothing and shoes, so she will buy a sewing machine to begin making this dream a reality. Johanna also wants to establish a small workspace where she can prepare sweets and peach nectar.

This is her third loan with MFP. Johanna promises to submit her payments on time because she wants to continue taking loans to help her move forward and follow through with all of her plans. She also says she likes working with her fellow group members because they have demonstrated responsibility and punctuality. Johanna plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of shoes since she has several orders to fulfill. She hopes to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more shoes to sell

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur cheikh D. habite a Bambilor.il est âgé de 29 ans.il est marie sans enfant.
Il  s’active dans le secteur de la mécanique. C’est après avoir interrompu ses études qu’il a commencé  l’apprentissage de la mécanique. Ici ses principales activités sont la réparation et l’installation de moteurs. Parallèlement il exerce l’activité d’agriculteur en pratiquant le maraichage c’est à dire la culture de poivron de concombre etc.Il  a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce métier. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son métier c’est l’aspect lucratif qui lui donne l’opportunité de satisfaire ses besoins. Monsieur D. est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis décembre   2009.Il  sollicite un prêt de 400 000fcfa .Le but du prêt est l’achat d’un moteur pour réfectionner  sa voiture. Le crédit lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de disposer d’une certaine  stabilité financière
texts.en:
Cheikh D. lives in Bambilor. He is 29 years, married and without children. He is a car mechanic. After having stopped his schooling, he started learning how to repair cars. His main activities are the repair and installation of engines. In parallel, he also does small scale truck farming, where he grows peppers, cucumbers, etc. He has been doing this for more than 5 years. What he likes about his trade is the opportunity to make money to meet his needs. Mr. D. has been a member of the Bambilor fund since December 2009. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 CFA. The loan will be used to purchase a motor to repair his vehicle. The loan will help him increase his revenues and gain some financial stability.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina Y. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Celestina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Celestina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Celestina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Celestina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celestina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Celestina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Celestina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business and to gain more income for providing their daily expenditures. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is from the village of Bulwa, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Rebecca is married and has 12 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothes and also dealing Natasha and Avon in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S., age 47, is a fish vendor. She sells fish and rice. Marites has been a member in very good standing of ASHI Antique South Branch since 1999. She is also one of the trusted members of the branch who is approved to obtain a bigger loan.

Marites and her husband, William S., have three children: Marwill, age 26, Willmar, age 22, and William, age 20. The youngest is still engaged in his studies. Marites's husband is employed as a government employee. While they both earn an income, Marites is concerned about challenges in her own business, specifically because there are times when she has a smaller income due to fluctuations in capital and the availability of supplies of fish. Despite these challenges, she maintains a 100% credit rating in ASHI because she wants to achieve greater working capital and, above all, she wants to prove that poor individuals such as herself have dignity and are worthy of trust.

For her next loan she is requesting Php 47,000, to be utilized as additional capital for her fish vending and rice retail business.

Her greatest dreams in life are for her youngest to finish his studies and for the resources to build and reside in a decent house, through the help of ASHI and Kiva. She aspires toward becoming financially stable so that they can also help their neighbors and relatives.

loans.use: To be utilized as additional capital for her fish vending and rice retail business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna T. is from the village of Poblacion, Concepcion. She is 39 years old, married, and blessed with one school-aged child. Myrna is engaged in the food sector, specifically in food vending (carenderia). From this activity, she's able to earn a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. She has been in her business for 2 years.

In 2010, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting her 1st loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital for the business.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital for the business.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine A. is from the village of Bunawan in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Josephine is the leader of a 3-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Blueberry.

Josephine is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products, such as sugar, canned goods, milk, coffee, pancit, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Josephine's first loan taken from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 46-year-old widow with six children. She runs a food kiosk in the Kamali area. She has been in the business for the last two years with an income of 4,000 KES a month.

She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD to buy more stock of tea leaves, milk, flour, maize and beans in order to increase her food production. She hopes that the increase will also enable her to prepare more ethnic dishes, which are her customer’s favorites.
