She hopes to educate her children to the highest level, expand her business, and improve the living standard of her children.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, milk, flour, maize and beans

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica al negocio de transporte turístico el socio trabaja con turismo, el trabaja con diferentes agencias que le solicitan sus servicios de diferentes tours, lleva años en este negocio y le va muy bien, de esta forma el socio saca a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su carro y para algunos gastos personales. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Chikon community bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province in the Cusco department. The member is Mr. Edgar. He is 29, lives with his partner, and has 2 children. He has a tourist transportation business. He works in tourism, with different agencies who request his services for different tours. He has had this business for years and it is going very well. This is how he gets his family ahead. The member is requesting this loan for the maintenance of his car and for various personal costs. He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: He is requesting this loan for the maintenance of his care and for various personal expenses.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar is 24 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in his in-laws’ small house, in the outer ger districts of the city. His wife studied at university with a concentration in tourism. 

Otgonbaatar has been supporting his family by operating a taxi business for the past three years. In 2008, he started his taxi business using a car which he bought on a leasing contract from another person. He repaid the leasing contract over 16 months. During the past three years, he has been able to gradually improve his living conditions and has gained a lot of experience. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another secondhand car, due to safety regulations for transportation. He is requesting a 2,750,000 MNT loan to purchase the secondhand car. His goal is to improve his living conditions by buying an apartment, and then he wants to have children and a happy life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Олимов Акрам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 33 года. Он Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование у него среднее. Он более 15 лет занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает стройматериалы. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Akram O. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He has a high school education. He has been working in sales for more than fifteen years.  He has a shop where he sells building materials.  He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. ANA  es nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra el 13 de septiembre de 1983, estado civil soltera no tiene hijo, su objetivo de la señora es llegar a tener una tienda grande de alquiler de disfraz. La señora lleva trabajando en el alquiler de disfraz 2 años  llevo como iniciativa su actividad debido a que la señora vive cerca de varios colegios de la urbanización Patuju, solicito el crédito a emprender  el cual se la esta brindando un apoyo necesario, para que pueda salir adelante que tiene como destino comprarse mas disfraces de distintos tipos de danzas de nuestros país, es una persona joven  y trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Ana was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra on the 13 on September, 1983. She is single and has no children. Her goal is to have a large store where she will rent costumes. She began the business of renting costumes 2 years ago. She began this business because she lives close to several schools in the city of Patuju. She is applying to Emprender for the loan since they offer her the support that she needs. She needs the loan so that she can succeed at her goal, which is to buy more costumes for the different types of dances of her country. She is a young, hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support that they offer.

loans.use: Buy costumes for her rental shop

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov C. (in the photo) is 39 years old and his wife, Mrs. Yem Suy, is 40 years old. They have one married daughter. They live in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Mr. Pov C. and his wife sell fish. They buy fish from the fisherman in the village and transport them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Pov is requesting his first loan of $500 to expand his business by buying additional fish for resale.

loans.use: To expand his business of selling fish

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He sells shoes and clothes to earn a living. He has employed two people to help him run the business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business. He hopes that one day he will expand his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy more shoes and clothes.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Mamerto is 58 years old, married, and has 4 children. His oldest child is 32 years old and the youngest is only 8.

Mamerto is a farmer and tills some land in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice then sells his harvest to the market. Mamerto wants to improve his business and he is working hard to achieve it.

Mamerto's loan will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie V. is from the town of Qurino, Calamagui 1st, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Rosemarie is married and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a general store. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50. She is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 25. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been farming for 7 years. She earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to live an abundant life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business from her home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Alice faces a major challenge of competition from other tailoring business operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth materials and Lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and Lesos for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother, niece and nephew).    

Margaret has a business of selling paper. She has been in this business for 8 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of paper and paper glue. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of paper. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land on which to build rental houses and also to get a permanent business premise.   

Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of paper and paper glue.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 60 años y solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio D. agricultura. Ella venD. verduras y cría cuyes. Está casada y tiene cinco hijos, uno D. ellos ha estudiado en la universidad. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. FINCA Perú Juana amplio su negocio. Con su crédito D. ahora ella va a invertir en tractoreo, peones, mantenimiento y en galpones D. cuy.  Juana empezó el negocio hace 10 años, junto a su esposo.  Gracias a la ayuda D. FINCA Perú ella siempre este contenta porque le va bien en su negocio.  D. las capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido D. autoestima.  Sus sueños son siempre poder mejorar y aumentarle a su negocio, le gustaría empezar a criar chanchos y ovinos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the community bank Fortaleza.  She is 60 years old and is requesting a loan to invest in her farming business.  She sells vegetables and raises guinea pigs.  She is married and has five children, one of them has attended the university.
She used the first loan from FINCA Peru to enlarge her business.  The current loan will be used to buy tractors, hire laborers, do maintenance and get sheds for guinea pigs.  Juana started her business 10 years ago with her husband.  Thanks to the help from FINCA Peru, she is always happy because her business is doing well.  The training that FINCA Peru offers has given her self esteem.  Her dreams are always to be able to grow and improve her business.  She would like to start raising hogs and sheep.

loans.use: to invest in tractors, laborers, maintenance and guinea pig sheds.

loans.name: Etsa Agossi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits congelés, depuis 2010, Etsa a 02 enfants et son conjoint est comptable. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des ailes de poule, de dinde…  elle achète à Lomé et revend à son domicile. Elle a 26ans.
texts.en: A retailer of frozen goods since 2010, Etsa has two children and her husband is an accountant. She is seeking her first loan to buy chicken wings, turkey wings, etc. She buys her goods in Lomé and re-sells them at home. She is 26 years old.

loans.use: To buy frozen goods and various other items.

loans.name: Mkutano

texts.en: Mkutano, 32 years old, married, and the father of two children aged five and one, runs a restaurant business selling food to people in the nearby industrial area. In business for 13 years and employing three people, Mkutano is requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator to keep food and beverages fresh. He hopes to grow his business and eventually open other restaurants in Mombasa. He describes himself as welcoming.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Samporn

texts.en: Samporn sells sweets. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $12 per day. She has one child who is one year old. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $15 on rent, $10 on electricity, and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy materials to make sweets to sell. She has been doing this career for a long time so she has a lot of customers to buy her sweets. She plans to extend her sweet shop when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make sweets

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos al señor Rosendo que nació en la provincia de Quispicanchis(Cusco, Perú), tiene 63 años de edad y tiene un hijo, y nos cuenta:

“Vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades económicas que es la venta de verduras, Yo compro verduras de los proveedores del valle sagrado y después los productos llevo a vender a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado”. 

Ya son 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Este crédito es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo maíz, papa, coliflor, lechuga, cebolla, etc.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Vamos Juntas" ("We Come Together") meets monthly in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for being a popular tourist area, a business center, and for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven new wonders of the world.

In this place, we get to know Señor Rosendo, who was born in the province of Quispicanchis (in Cusco, Peru).  He is 63 years old and has one child, and he tells us:

"I live in the city of Cusco, where I conduct my business, which is selling vegetables.  I buy vegetables from suppliers in the Sacred Valley and then take the products for sale to the city of Puerto Maldonado."

He has been working in this business for five years already, and doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. This loan is to buy merchandise such as corn, potatoes, cauliflower, lettuce, onions, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as corn, potatoes, cauliflower, lettuce, onions, etc.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico, age 28, operates a buy-and-sell business. What he basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sells these items at a small profit. His products are children’s clothes, shorts, and other RTW (ready-to-wear) products. Customers are attracted to buy his wares due to the low selling prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Rico is an unmarried man and lives in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. He manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Rico dreams of having a permanent store in the marketplace and also of being able to provide support for his family. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, none of whom is in school. Margaret has a business selling goats. She has been in this business for five years and she works one day out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale.  Margaret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more goats. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease the transportation of goats and to build rental rooms. Margaret lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Mercilenda

texts.en:
Mercilenda is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mercilenda has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional stocks of used clothing to sell.

Mercilenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercilenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a businesswoman aged 34. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last nine years, she has been selling fish to earn a living. She also sell clothes for more income generation. She has been able to improve her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Yila Waleska

texts.es: Yila de 37 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 21, el segundo de 18 y el menor de 9 añitos.  Tiene 15 años de tener su propio negocio de comideria ubicado en Santo Domingo, donde atiende clientela variada.  Esta solicitando su 10mo credito con el objetivo de ampliar su casa para el negocio de comedor que tiene, ya que actualmente tiene mas demanda y quiere brindarles una mejor comodidad para que se sientan mejor atendidos, ademas desea comprar productos para el negocio como viveres y otras cositas que necesita en su dispensa.
texts.en: Yila, 37, is single.  She has three children.  The oldest is 21, the second one is 18 and the youngest is 9 years old.  She’s had her own eatery in Santo Domingo for the last 15 years where she tends to a varied clientele.  She’s asking for her 10th loan to enlarge her house for the eatery business she has because she currently has more demand and she wants to provide comfort so that they will feel better taken care of.  In addition, she wants to buy products for the business like foodstuffs and some other things she needs for her pantry.

loans.use: to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Luz Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive por la parroquia del Valle (Cuenca), este lugar se encuentra rodeado por montañas las que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Luz tiene 47 años, es casada y su esposo labora fabricando cielos rasos, con el trabajo conyugal han realizado su casa propia.
 
Ella labora conjuntamente con su esposo en la fabricación de cielos rasos hace 22 años, trabajan de lunes a sábados y cuando tienen que entregar alguna obra hasta el domingo, sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio como cabuya, yeso, aluminio y pintura. 

Su  meta es engrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the communal bank Corazon de Maria. She lives in the Parish Del Valle (Cuenca). This is an area that is surrounded by mountains that give us beautiful scenery. The people are dedicated to commerce, livestock farming, and agriculture. Many work in the city in various types of work. They maintain their culture and the traditions of their villages.

Luz is 47 years old and she is married. Her husband works in constructing roofing. Through their combined work they have managed to have a house of their own.

She has been working together with her husband in constructing roofing for the past 22 years. They work from Monday to Saturday, and when they need to deliver a project they work even on Sundays, on an unfixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for the past 5 years and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of materials for her business such as rope, plaster, aluminum sheeting, and paint.

Her goal is to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase rope, plaster, aluminum sheeting, and paint.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

Milagros has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from the retail selling of feeds.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Manuel José

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad Manuel José es un emprendedor dedicado a la recolección de empaques, específicamente costales, esta labor la desempeña en su moto, logrando una mejor cobertura y optimizando los tiempos de transporte y comercialización.

Actualmente genera 2 empleos, y con la ilusión de seguir progresando quiere comprar otra moto que le permita tener mas capacidad de recolección y comercialización, igualmente podrá generar otro empleo, ayudar más con los gastos del hogar, y mejorar la difícil situación económica. Sin embardo Manuel José no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de la moto por lo que solicita un préstamo, que le ayude a su negocio a mejorar el transporte de los empaques, recolectarlos, y posteriormente comercializarlos, mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida proporcionalmente.
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Manuel José is an entrepreneur who works collecting packing materials, specifically sacks.  He carries out this work on his motorbike which allows him to cover a larger area and optimize his transportation and sales times.

Manuel José currently creates two jobs and, with the hope of continuing to make progress, he would like to buy another motorbike which would allow him to enjoy a greater collection and sales capacity.  He will also be able to create another job, help more with his household expenses and improve his difficult economic situation.  However, Manuel José does not have the capital he needs to buy a motorbike and so he is requesting a loan which will help his business to improve in the transportation, collection and later sale of packing materials.  This will improve his income and his quality of life proportionally.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for transporting sacks

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, 38, is a seamstress. She lives with her husband, and they have no children.  For the past 3 years she has been running a sewing shop in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, called “Khatan Goo”. Her shop already has many permanent customers and they all say that Tuya is a skillful and hard-working seamstress.  

Lately there have been a great many orders coming in from her customers for national and casual clothes for the coming holiday, “Tsagaan sar”, which is a major, respectful, traditional Mongolian celebration. Mrs. Tuya needs a large amount of working capital to purchase textiles and draperies to fulfill the orders. Her loan will be dedicated to this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and draperies to fulfill her orders

loans.name: Eliecer Gerardo

texts.es:
Eliecer  tiene 45 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, la cual pertenece a la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace varios años que Eliecer quiere hacer unos cambios en su casa.

Actualmente Eliecer está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para  poder comprar materiales de construcción (cerámica, cemento y zinc), para asi arreglar la infraestructura de su hogar. Con esto el espera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que quiere estar más tranquilo, que sus hijos vivan más cómodos y tengan un techo digno.

Eliecer es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Eliecer is 45 years old and he lives with his wife and children in San Carlos, a community located in Alajuela, the second major province of Costa Rica. This area holds first place nationally for the production of coffee and sugar cane; basic grains (rice, beans, maize), fruit, pulses, tubers, and vegetables are also produced. Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important of the country, is also located here.

Eliecer has desired making a few changes to his house for a few years.

Eliecer is currently asking for a loan of ¢500.000 (five-hundred thousand colones) to buy construction materials (ceramics, cement and zinc) to fix the structure of his house. He hopes that this will allow him to provide his family with a better standard of living: he wants to feel more at ease, and he wants his children to live more comfortably and have a proper roof on their heads.

Eliecer is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of San Francisco, one of the 150 member organization that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. He will keep on growing on a personal and economic level, and he will also keep on being an active participant in his local credit organization.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 24, is a married man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a food market for his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.


With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to business to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, aged 31 years, is married to Jennifer and is blessed with one child, who is six years old. He sells automobile spare parts.

This is his second loan with KADET, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. He will use the funds to buy more spare parts for sale. Benson hopes to open a larger hardware store in the future.

loans.use: To buy automobile spare parts

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 64 years old, married to Sarah and they support one person within the family. He has been in the business of rearing dairy cows for milk production for sale for the last 10 years, from which he earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

He is applying for his fifth loan of 80,000 KES. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer. He plans to use the funds to buy an additional dairy cow. With the anticipated profits, he will improve the cow sheds and his family's welfare.

He hopes to increase the milk output to become the leading producer in his locality and uplift the family living standards.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow for rearing

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Âgée de 36 ans, Cécile a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Cécile est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Rigobert Cécile. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, Cécile vend du maïs, du soja et du haricot dans sa boutique depuis neuf ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien de ces enfants. Cécile s'approvisionne dans un marché et dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Cécile devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Cécile sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du soja et du haricot.

loans.name: Avichaqueñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AVICHAQUEÑAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de leche, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio,  producción de leche.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, hace varios años, ya que este era un negocio familiar y con el pasar del tiempo ella asumió el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará el aumento del capital (compra cebada por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente le dará a sus ganados para la posterior producción de leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank “AVICHAQUEÑAS” will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional hub. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors where señora María is the President. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and among them are: cheese sales, milk sales, transportation service, neighborhood store, and milk production.

The loan that it will take out will benefit small microenterprises where señora María is a member. She indicates that it is the first time she joins Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a promoter of the institution that went to visit her in her home. She currently has a business selling milk. She lets it be known that she learned this business from her mother several years ago, since this was a family business and with the passage of time she took over the business.

The loan she will take out now will increase her capital (purchase of wholesale barley), which will be acquired from the wholesale sellers of her community, and subsequently she will give it to her livestock for the later production of milk. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has a child.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale barley.

loans.name: Chuaxic Group

texts.es:
Miguel (él primero del lado izquierdo de playera  azul) es un padre de familia con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, él lleva varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura, con el apoyo de su crédito logro comprar sus semillas y su cultivo realizo a tiempo, afortunadamente una buena cosecha obtuvo y una bonita ganancia le dejo, con  este avance él está contento pero no conforme pues él quiere seguir cultivando por esa razón acude a un nuevo préstamo para  la compra de semillas de papa, abono químico y orgánico.
Con esta nueva inversión él espera poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos y contar con su propia casa.

loans.use: Compra de semillas de papa, abono químico y orgánico.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
My name is Armando M., and I am a 32-year-old father of 4 and a native of Salamanga, Matutuine district, Maputo province. I had few opportunities to attend school due to the 16-year civil war that affected the country; however, I did attend school up until the 4th grade. With schools paralyzed because of the war, I was obligated to immigrate to South Africa in search of work. There I worked at a woodcutting company for four years. After obtaining my driver’s license I began transporting cargo and passengers from Mozambique to South Africa. With the experience I gained I decided to open my own business; I turned to Hluvuku, the only microfinance institution in the area. The vehicle I acquired was a great fit for my work, but months later I was involved in an accident. Since, the vehicle has required restoration.

Armando is a self-employed driver who transports passengers and goods from Mozambique to South Africa and vice-versa. At this time he employs 2 people. With this loan he intends to repair his vehicle and continue with his work—being that this business helps three families survive, including Armando’s. Due to regional characteristics of the area bordering South Africa, many residents immigrate to Mozambique in search of work. Armando’s business’ impact on the community is great because it offers families in Mozambique the use of transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando M. de 32 anos de idade, natural de Salamanga, distrito de Matutuíne Província de Maputo, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos, teve poucas oportunidades de estudos, devido a Guerra civil dos 16 anos que afectou o pais, tendo escolarizado até 4ª classe. Com a paralisação dos estudos foi obrigado emigrar para África do Sul a procura do emprego como costume da zona, onde trabalhou numa empresa de corte de madeira por um período de quatro anos. Depois de ter a carta de condução passou a trabalhar como motorista de transporte de carga e Passageiros no percurso Moçambique e Africa do sul. Com a experiência ganha decide abrir o seu próprio negocio, tendo recorrido a “Hluvuku” como única instituição Micro financeira na zona. A viatura que adquiriu apresentava condições boas para o trabalho, mas meses depois teve acidente, dai a necessidade de reabilitação desta. Trabalha por conta própria como transportador de pessoas e bens de Moçambique – Africa do sul e vice-versa. Neste momento emprega 2 pessoas. Com este empréstimo perspectiva recuperar a viatura e continuar com os trabalho, pois deste negocio sobrevivem três famílias, incluindo a do Armando. Por características da zona que faz fronteira com África do sul, muitos residentes emigram para este pais vizinho a procura de emprego e, como forma de ajudar suas famílias em Moçambique usam estes transportes para o envio de bens, dai o grande impacto desta actividade.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for transportation

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Born in 1979, Komlan H. is married and the father of two. He works primarily as an engine mechanic of motorbikes. He also takes care of his apprentice younger brother and his wife, who is paralyzed due to a long illness. This situation used to compel him at times to turn to loan sharks, who made his situation worse. He has since benefited from a $350 loan, which he repaid without a problem because the interest rates on it were sharply lower than what the loan sharks were charging.

Mr. H. is requesting a new loan of $800 to set up a new, bigger, and better-equipped workshop. This loan will be very useful for opening his workshop and will have a very positive impact on his income, which will be reflected in his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Né en 1979, Monsieur H. Komlan est marié et père de deux enfants. Son activité principale est la mécanique des engins à deux roues. Il a également à sa charge son petit frère en apprentissage et sa femme paralysée suite à une longue maladie. Cette situation l’obligea à avoir recours de temps à autre aux usuriers qui l’ont ruiné d’avantage. Il bénéficia ainsi d’un crédit de $350 qu’il remboursa sans aucune difficulté puisque le taux d’intérêt était nettement inférieur à celui des usuriers.

Il sollicite de nouveau ce crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir mettre en place un nouvel atelier plus grand et plus équipé. Ce crédit lui sera très utile pour l’ouverture de son atelier et aura un impact très positif sur son revenu, ce qui se répercutera sur les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Opening a better-equipped shop

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is divorced with one son. She lives in Uzhgorod, Ukraine and sells meat (beef, pork, etc.) at one of the local markets in downtown Uzhgorod. Tamara usually purchases big parts of meat from stock-breeders in the villages at good prices and then resells it in the city where she can earn a good profit. She is well-known at the market because the meat she sells is always fresh and good. Tamara has been a market vendor for the past 10 years. She is very cheerful, confident and strong-willed. 

Currently, Tamara has a nice range of meats for sale at her stall. She maintains about $3000 worth of meat on hand. She is requesting a loan of $500 to help purchase more meat for further sale. She is hoping to use her profits to pay for her son’s education in college. One of her long-term plans is to open a meat store and provide more jobs for people. She loves her job a lot and is hoping to grow both professionally and economically.

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Luz and I have a small tire-repair shop. I've had this business for four years. I learned how to repair tires to give my customers a quality service, and they enjoy it when they come to see me because of the personal attention I give them. Demand for my services is high, since vehicles have tire problems every day. I'm very grateful for your support in helping my business grow so I can help my family out even more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola me llamo Luz y tengo un pequeño taller donde reparamos llantas de vehiculos, este lo tengo desde hace 4 años, he aprendido a reparar llantas para dar a mis clientes mejor servicio, ya que ellos se sienten a gusto cuando me visitan y les atiendo personalmente. La demanda del servicio es grande ya que a diario hay vehiculos reparando sus llantas. Les agradecere su ayuda para poder hacer que mi negocio crezca y de esta manera poder ayudar a mi familia un poco mas.

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair tires.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
For the past nineteen years, Florence has operated a retail shop from the location you see in the photo. Her store is well-organized and has an air of having been around for some time. She even seems to blend into the backdrop. She is very comfortable here and has a very pleasant, welcoming personality.

Over the years, she has added a poultry business to her livelihood. She uses the chickens as layers. With her loan, she plans to buy more chicks, chicken feed, and also more sugar, salt, and maize flour for her retail store. She has been in her lending group for the past 8 years and she has no problem making loan payments. She owns a plot of land and she hopes to construct a home.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her egg laying business, chicken feed, and more sugar, salt, and maize flour for her retail store.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mrs. Hom S. M., age 21, is a housewife. Her husband is employed at a private company, earning around $4 each day. They do not have children. She would like to request a loan of $700 in order to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to go to work. This will make his commute less expensive and quicker, as well as provide transportation for the entire family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: New Kabale I (C) Group

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and married with five children. She sells furniture to earn a living. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao E. and his wife, Sophoin Auk, have been married since 1988. They have four children; three sons and one daughter, three of whom are employed full time. The other one studies at local school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mao has been a motor taxi driver for nineteen years. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children.

Mr. Mao is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $700 to replace an old motorbike with a new motorbike for his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is forty two years old and the mother of three children, who are all currently in school. She has sold second (used) clothing for the past five years. Gifty buys her clothes from Accra and resells them in her community. She wants to use her loan to buy more bails of used clothing from Accra.

She is a member of the group called “Awurade Aye” (meaning God has done it). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral in repaying the loan.

loans.use: GIfty would like to buy more bails of second hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Mrs. Phou L. is 56-year-old mother of one child. She owns an at-home stand selling pork/chicken rice and coffee to serve to the people in her community for their breakfast. NormalL., she can earn about $10/day in revenue. Her husband is employed as a policeman, earning $2/day. 
Mrs. Phou L. would like to expand her stand and provide more services to her excellent customers. She needs more utensils and equipment such as chairs, tables cloths, tables, and so on. She is requesting a loan to purchase this additional equipment, and she is very excited about expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for her business.

loans.name: Juana Ruth

texts.es:
Juana lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Sur. She is 47 years old and married. Both have four children, all of whom she cares for with much love and dedication.

Ten years ago, Juana, on her own initiative, started a small business making and selling iron beds. She needs the loan to buy materials like iron and paint to make the beds. She has maintained her business through loans obtained from AFODENIC and they have helped her to get ahead. Her plans are to find a better location to sell her beds where she can have a greater fluidity of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y ambos procrearon 4 hijos, a los cuales mantienen con mucho amor y dedicación. Desde hace 10 años Doña Juana, con esfuerzo propio, puso un pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de camas, las cuales están hechas de hierro. Necesita el préstamo para comprar metria prima cono hierro y pintura para elaborar las camas. Ella ha mantenido su negocio a través de préstamos que ha hecho a AFODENIC y los cuales le han ayudado a salir adelante. Sus planes son encontrar un mejor ubicación para la venta de sus camas donde pueda tener mayor fluidez de clientes.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make iron beds

loans.name: Erika Yamileth

texts.es:
Erika is a small-business owner who runs a small general store in her home. She lives in the El Riguero neighborhood, is married and has a 12-year old son. Her husband works in construction. Erika started selling soft drinks and food, using savings generated from this activity to start buying a variety of products to start her store. The loan would be invested in the purchase of basic grains and cleaning products to augment her enterprise’s inventory, so she can continue to grow it and make her business more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika es una pequeña comerciante que en su casa de habitación tiene una pequeña pulpería. Habita en elbarrio El Riguero, es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años. Su espsos es albañil. Erika empezó vendiendo refrescos y comida, con las ganacias generadas por esta actividad pudo empezar a comprar diversos productos para poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos y productos de limpieza para aumentar el inventario de su negocio, para así continuar con su crecimiento y hacer su negocio más rentable.

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products and basic grains to increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Madeleine B. was born around 1966 in Natitingou, northwestern Benin. She is originally from Dassa. Married to Mr. Philippe Bossou, she is the mother of one child. She has been living in the Sainte Rita neighborhood since 1990. She is on her third loan with Alidé. She is requesting this loan in order to meet the many demands of her clientele, which is increasing on a daily basis.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame B. Madeleine est née vers 1966 à Natitingou dans le Nord-ouest du BENIN. Elle est originaire de DASSA. Mariée au sieur BOSSOU Philippe, elle est mère d'un enfant. Elle réside dans le quartier Sainte Rita depuis 1990. Elle est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le but de satisfaire les nombreuses demandes de la clientèle qui ne fait que s'augmenter de jour en jour.

loans.use: To buy 4 cans of oil, 6 boxes of detergent, 3 bags of rice and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Angel Abad

texts.es:
Angel  es transportista, brinda sus servicios en el Trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa. Dicha actividad es su única fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su esposa y su pequeño de 4 años. Paga el alquiler de una casa ubicada en laa Zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito será invertido en el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (movilidad), puesto que la máquina necesita con urgencia una revisión.


Es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica de manera óptima
texts.en:
Angel is a taxi driver, working through the Trufi 88 section of the Eduard Avaroa syndicate. This is his sole income to maintain his wife and 4-year-old son. He rents a house located in the Pasankeri Zone of the city of La Paz. The loan will be invested in the maintenance of the tool of his trade, since the vehicle urgently needs an inspection. This is his second loan through Impro, his successful loan completion is his best qualification.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Twezimbe Women's Group

texts.en:
K. Jane is a married woman with 3 children because she cares for 2 orphaned children. All the children are in school. Jane is also the chairperson of Twezimbe women's group in Kigunga, Mukono. This is a new group that has just formed to get a loan from Pearl Microfinance; without the loan, the members do not have the capital they need to improve their businesses.

Jane's business is tailoring: she makes school uniforms and ladies' wear. She also owns a gift shop in the same trading centre. She has struggled to pay the rent for her businesses. Many girls approach Jane, wanting to learn the tailoring trade, but Jane has only one sewing machine, which she needs to use to supply her customers' needs, so she is unable to teach them. This is one of the reasons why she joined her group: she dreams of owning as many sewing machines as possible so she can help as many young girls as possible. Jane is positive about this dream.

With this loan, Jane plans to buy more material for her tailoring business and more gifts for her gift shop.

loans.use: To buy more material for her tailoring business and more gifts for her gift shop.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells provisions and drinks to her customers. She needs the loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. Mercy is 42 years old and is married to Mr. O. who is a taxi driver. They have seven children. Mercy hopes to assist her husband in providing for the educational needs of their children. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine A. was born on February 21, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and has 6 children, but the last one at home is Edwige. At 4 years old, she began to live with her father's aunt, whom she helped to sell igname (a hard potato-like vegetable) and bean pastries. She also sold cloth. She began her own business after the death of her aunt and the birth of her first son. She now sells akpan (milky corn soup), ice cream, fruit, and other food. She hasn not stuck with one type of business, but for the last 5 years she has sold charcoal, food, lettuce, fruit, and condiments.

Dame A. Valentine est née le21/02/1966 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin et originaire de Ouidah. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont seule la benjamine Edwige est à sa charge. A l'âge de 04 ans, elle a été placée chez sa tante parternelle, elle aidait celle-ci à vendre d'igname fris et des beignets fait à base d'haricot. Aussi elle vendait pour celle-ci du pagne. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte après la mort de sa tante et la naissance de son premier garçon, elle vendait en ce moment de akpan, de l'eau glacée, les fruits, la nourriture. Elle n'avait pas une activité stable. Depuis plus de 05 ans elle s'est lancée dans la vente de charbons , de nourriture, des laitues de salade et des fruits, elle est aussi gérante de deux moulins à condiments.

loans.use: 2 bags of rice, a half bag of rice, and a basket of lettuce with some vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Sithat Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank. Each of the members will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sithat U. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Seim Oul, are laborers. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their household. 

To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sithat U. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a  breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. 

She is 49 years old and the mother of six children. Two of her children are laborers, three attend the local school, and the youngest is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Abla Emma

texts.fr:
D. Abla Emma est âgée de 39 ans, mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Elle est depuis  des années à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce  crédit consolider son fond de roulement pouvant lui permettre de renouveler dans la mesure du possible son stock de marchandises étant une particulière commerçante d’alimentation générale. C’est un commerce qui marche bien pour lui car les clients ne reviennent  jamais se plaindre.
Les gains issus de l’activité permettront à Madame de  réaliser plus de bénéfice et  de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abla Emma D. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, who are all in school. For some years now, she has been in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this loan to consolidate her working capital, which will enable her to renew to the extent possible her stock of merchandise, she being an individual grocer. This is a business that is doing well for her because customers never come back to complain. The gains from this work will enable her to realize more profit and to cope with the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: abdoulaye a 22 ans il est celibataire .Apres les etudes primaires qui ont été abandonnées tres tot,abdoulaye  pour gagner sa vie s'est lancé dans le commerce de petits objets ( sacs chausures ect)dans la rue .les revenus tirés de l' activité lui permettent d 'envoyer queque chose à ses parents restés au village.Le pret solliciter lui permet d'accroitre et de diversifier ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is 22 years old and unmarried. After primary school, which he abandoned early on, he earned his living by starting off in the commerce of small items (bags, shoes, etc.) on the street. The income derived from his work enables him to send something to his parents, who remain in the village. The loan being requested will allow him to augment and diversify his merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sourm's Group

texts.en: This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader S., 29, has two children; both of them are students. She is a widow and owns a general store selling eggs, sugar, plastic, noodles, sweets, etc in front of her house. She is a manageable mother and a responsible neighbor. She earns a good income because her store is located in the middle of a busy street. To help with her family's expenses, S. plans to increase her income by purchasing more products for her store. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. There are three other members of the group: Y., 38, who owns a number of rental rooms, is applying for a loan to buy a number of ventilation fans for her rental rooms. K., 44, who raises pigs and grows vegetables, is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her business. C., 42, who grows vegetables, is applying for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds for her plantation. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store

loans.name: Ismon

texts.ru: Исмон занимается мелким предпринимательством, ему 39 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Жена работает и еще помогает мужу в его бизнесе. Вместе они выходят по базарным дням и занимаются куплей продажей сухофруктов. Узнав про МикроИнвест, Исмон решил обратиться за займом. Первый займ решил подать на маленькую сумму, чтобы приобрести опыт работы с заемными средствами. Далее собирается увеличивать сумму.
texts.en:
Ismon is a smalltime entrepreneur, he is 39 years old, is married and has three children. His wife works and also helps her husband with his business. Together they go to the market on market days and purchase and sell dried fruits. After finding out about MicroInvest, Ismon turned here for a loan. He decided to initially take out a small loan in order to gain experience with borrowed funds. In the future he plans to increase the loan size.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Msikitu Group

texts.en:
Siti has been a charcoal, firewood, and bites seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $35. She works at her business for 12 hours daily.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, firewood, and wheat flour for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Siti is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Tatu, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, firwood and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is 58 years old and married with 4 children. She sells mattresses, pillows and pillowcases and she started this business twenty-seven years ago. Lola hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more mattresses to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more mattresses to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to utilize this loan toward the improvement of her general store business, located in their peaceful and remote village of Barangay Cambong in Lallo, Cagayan.

She and her husband Cirilo sell a wide variety of items in their general store, including several kinds of vegetables. Much of their income goes toward the education of their five children, who presently attend college, high school, and elementary school. It is Rosalina's and Cirilo's earnest hope that all their children will someday earn college degrees, and they support them in this endeavor not only financially but by providing a great deal of moral support.

The general store business generates enough financial resources to cover their daily household expenses, which is why Rosalina hopes to sustain the business for the sake of supporting her family. By expanding and growing her business, she can continue to do this, as well as to provide for the children's educational goals.

loans.use: To improve her general store business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (803990106) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To earn a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,100,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business

loans.use: used to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Isabel Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Virginia S. C. tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 5 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Isabel se dedica a la venta de desayuno, negocio que ya tenia cuando inicio en Manuela Ramos, en sus ratos libres elaboraba collares y aretes los cuales los ofrecía a sus amistades y al ver que sus modelos si gustaban a la gente empezó con la venta en mayor cantidad vendiendo no solo a sus vecinos si no también a ofrecer en tiendas de su distrito.
Los materiales para la bisutería los obtiene en las tiendas comerciales en el  centro de Trujillo.
Los insumos para preparar alimentos los obtiene del mercado de abastos en el Porvenir.
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de desayunos así mismo compró materiales para la confección de aretes. 
Con el crédito de 800 soles lo invertirá en su negocio de bisutería y medicamentos para su tratamiento.
Isabel tiene como sueño poner su restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Isabel Virginia S. C. is 23 years old and lives in the El Porvenir district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary school education and has 5 children who depend on her financially. Isabel dedicates herself to selling breakfasts, a business that she already had when she started with Manuela Ramos. In her spare time, she makes necklaces and earrings that she offers to her friends. At seeing that people liked her designs, she started making them in larger quantities to sell not only to her neighbors but also to stores in her district. She obtains the materials for her jewelry-making from the supply stores at the market in Porvenir. With the loan of 300 soles that she received from her cooperative bank, Live with Hope, she invested in the purchase of materials for making earrings. With the loan of 800 soles, she will invest further into her jewelry business and in medications. Isabel’s dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for making breakfasts, and also materials for making earrings.

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
A. Lê Thị (440971365) is a 47-year-old womA. living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, A. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting the fruit for sale. A. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, A. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. successfully repaid a previous loA. from TYM Fund, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. A. is now requesting a new loA. of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loA. will be the eighth loA. taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Antonela  está conformado por Lea F., Karla V., María N. y Claudia Agilar todas ellas habitan en el reparto Martin Castellón en la zona urbana de Nindirí.

La coordinadora del grupo es Lea Judit F. V. de 36 años de edad. Esta señora es madre soltera de tres niños menores de edad de cinco, quince y dieciocho años de edad respectivamente. F. comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de plata y oro, pero necesitada de mayor inversión es entonces cuando opta por obtener un préstamo en adim. Con este préstamo  logro tener un  buen inventario y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella desea poder ampliar más su negocio y que sus hijos  se superen.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son señoras quienes tienen un compañero de vida y tres hijos cada una de ellas. Entre estas se encuentra Karla Patricia V. de 28 años de edad quien tiene una pequeña pulpería, María del Carmen N. A. de 52  años de edad que vende tortilla y Claudia María A. de 31 años de edad que vende  cosméticos.

Este grupo de mujeres ya  han tenido dos créditos con Adim con los cuales lograron incrementar su materia prima y sus clientes es por eso que podemos asegurar que son trabajadoras, emprendedoras, perseverantes y con muchos deseos de superarse.

Actualmente ellas necesitan de ingresos para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería, mejorar su inventario con la adquisición de nuevos productos y mejorar los ingresos de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Lea F., Karla V., María N. and Claudia Agilar formed the Antonela group. They all live in the Reparto Martin Castellón in the urban zone of Nindirí. Lea Judit F. V., 36, is the group’s coordinator. She is a single mother. She has three minor children ages five, eleven, and eighteen. F. started with a small business of selling silver and gold. But, she needed a larger investment. That is when she chose to get a loan from ADIM. With this loan she was able to have a good inventory and improve the quality of life for her family. She hopes to expand her business and that her children excel. The other members of the group are women who have life partners, and each of them has three children. One of them is Karla Patricia V., 28. She has a small mini market. Another is María del Carmen N. A., 52. She sells tortillas. Claudia María A., 31, sells cosmetics. This group of women has had two loans with ADIM. With the loans they were able to increase their raw materials and their customers. We can assure you that they are hard working, entrepreneurial, and perseverant; they have a great desire to improve themselves. They currently need income to get a greater quantity of merchandise. They want to improve their inventory with the acquisition of new products. They will then improve their income from their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire silver and gold jewelry

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.en: O. Mahmad is a 44-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children who, today, are working adults thanks to his example. Mahmad runs a business of raising and selling cattle and has sixteen years of experience in this field. Since cattle-raising and selling is a profitable business, he has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding them and pasturing them. Now, Mahmad wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. To do that, he applied for a loan of 825 USD. He thanks all lenders for their support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy J. runs a pharmacy in Mkoroshoni, Mombasa, a short distance from his residence in Shanzu. He has been in the pharmacy industry for three years and mainly serves the residents of Shanzu. He was introduced to KADET by a group member and he is now accessing his first loan to boost his business. He plans to purchase antibiotics, anti-fungals and analgesics for his pharmacy. Kennedy hopes to eventually be able to open a clinic in his home area and offer more services to the area residents.

Kennedy is 45 years old. He is married to Pamela Adhiambo and they are blessed with three children: Stephen, Rodgers and Fred Kennedy.

ABOUT KADET KADET Ltd. is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to rural communities through the microfinance model. KADET is the only MFI in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities served. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, KADET has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on KADET from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To purchase antibiotics, anti-fungals and analgesics for his pharmacy

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Arlene N., 49 years old mother of eight children. Her eldest child is just 22 years old. Though she wanted to send her child to college, their income is not enough to shoulder everyting like books and tuition fees because they are very expensive. 

She would like to request for aloan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventutes Inc. She will use the loan to buy farmong needs and pay the rental for the equipment that she borrowed during land preparation.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane S. est marié, âgé de 30 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques telles les travaux journaliers auprès des maçons, les travaux champêtres et le berger. 
Vu l’âge avançant, il songe  à avoir une activité stable et pérenne. Ainsi il décida de mener l’activité d’achat et de  vente d’articles divers de  boutique,  qu’il appris auprès de son grand frère. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, Monsieur Souleymane S. maîtrise bien son activité qu’il pilote allègrement.
Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt précédent, il est à son deuxième prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter d’importantes  articles divers pour sa boutique afin d’attirer, de satisfaire et de maintenir la clientèle. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle  composée de toute la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Souleymane S. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 87000 FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique et acheter une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane S. is 30 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He lives with his wife and children in theTorakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni town (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having been unschooled, he began very quickly economic activities such as daily masonry work, farm work and herdsman. Given his advancing age, he thinks of having a stable and sustainable business. So, he decided to run the business of buying and selling of various store items that he learned from his elder brother. With a five-year experience, Mr. Souleymane S. controls well his business that he operates cheerfully. After having repaid correctly the previous loan, he is on his second individual loan which he intends to use to buy various important items for his store in order to attract, please and maintain customers. He gets his supplies in Bamako ( the capital of the Republic of Mali) and retails cash down and on credit to his customers comprised of all the local people. With this loan, Mr. Souleymane S. intends to make a monthly profit of 87000FCFA. With this profit, he plans to expand his store and buy a house.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various store items

loans.name: Milagro Esperanza

texts.es: Milagro Esperanza M. R. reside en el departamento de Usulután. Milagro tiene 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Víctor de 8 años y Edgardo de 3 años de edad. Milagro administra de su negocio el que inicio hace ocho años es una venta de productos de consumo diario, hace unos meses Milagro ha surtido su tienda con una pequeña venta de ropa, la cual ha tenido mucha demanda con sus clientes, ahora ella solicita de este crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para surtir su negocio y así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Milagro Esperanza M. R. lives in the department of Usulután. She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and their two sons, Victor (age 8) and Edgardo (age 3). Milagro manages a business that she started 8 years ago in which she sells everyday consumer products. Eight months ago, she expanded her business and added a small clothing shop. Her products are in high demand with her customers.

Today Milagro is requesting a loan to buy clothing in large quantities so that she can increase her inventory and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to add to her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat M. has a successful business selling food at a market in a village in Imishli. He started his business about 10 years ago after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy. 

Nijat purchases products at very low prices and then resells them for a profit. Because he sells in bulk, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Nijat rents a very good location at the market for his business and he has little competition. 

He has requested a loan of 1606 AZN to increase his business capital. This loan will enable him to buy more produce to sell, so he can increase his profits and continue to operate a profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Serikbol

texts.en:
Serikbol S. is 38 years old and lives with his wife, their five children, and his elderly father in the province of Bayan-Olgii, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His wife stays at home in order to take care of her father-in-law and the children, whose ages range from five to 14. Serikhbol supports this large family through his business.

Serikbol is a talented craftsman, following in the footsteps of his father, who was also once a well-known craftsman in the town. Serikbol makes many kinds of items, such as various accessories for horse riding, traditional music instruments, and traditional home furniture. His wife sometimes visits the local market and sells his crafts. She usually offers the instruments and accessories in exchange for livestock and other basic goods that the family needs.

Serikbol dreams of having his own small-scale craftsman production endeavor, where he would like to be able to make instruments and crafts with more efficient technology. He and his wife hope to be financially able to send their eldest son to a university in a few years.

He requests a loan to purchase iron and wood materials for his crafts business.

loans.use: To purchase iron and wood for his crafts business

loans.name: Nyean

texts.en:
The smiling woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Nyean S., 27, a worker in the garment industry. 

Nyean S. is also a good homemaker who cooks delicious food and takes care of the children. She is married with four school-age children.  Her husband helps support the family by providing a taxi service.

Recently, the income of Nyean S.’s husband decreased because his motorbike taxi was damaged. Because of that, Nyean S. decided to seek a loan for her husband to replace his old taxi.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old taxi

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: P. Gerelmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her three children, ages 11-17, all attend a local secondary school. Gerelmaa manages a meat trading business with the help of her husband at a local market in her town. Gerelmaa started her business in 2001 with capital of 600,000 tugrugs (420 USD). She has been operating her business successfully over the years and has built a good reputation amongst her customers and suppliers. Today, her working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (3500 USD). For the future, Gerelmaa is working hard to grow her business and continue her success. She says, "My business goal is to deliver quality products to my customers." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (1400 USD) loan to purchase meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
B., 42, is a modest woman living in Banteay Meanchey province. She is married with three teenage children, all of whom attend school and also earn income by sewing clothes when they are free from studying. B. sells fried banana and potato to the people living in her village, while her husband drives a taxi for a profit.

B.’s husband has been using a very old vehicle to pick up his clients and recently his taxi has often broken down. This problem affects his income. B. is therefore applying for a loan, which will allow her husband to replace his old taxi.

loans.use: To replace an old taxi

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa L., 20 years old is engaged in rice farming.  She and her husband are childless. Elisa works very hard on the farm to be able to raise enough money for their daily needs. They hope that someday they will be able to have a baby. Elisa also hopes for an abundant harvest in the farm. She would like to apply for a loan of hp 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 56 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
