In 2005, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen C. is from the village of Purok Pag-asa, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Aileen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Aileen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing in the local community. Aileen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Aileen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Aileen's second loan taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Silvia Susana

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia realiza trabajos de consultoria y elaboracion de proyectos, ademas de ser profesora universitaria enseñando la materia de publicidad en una universidad de nuestra ciudad, ella solicita el credito para poder comprar materiales para un trabajo que le encargaron realizar. 
La Sra. Silvia es Madre soltera, vive sola con su pequeña hija de cuatro años de edad, es una persona de buen caracter, responsable y trabajadora que saca a su familia adelante sola y desea mejorar su calidad de vida, ella fue recomendada por una amiga que es cliente de Emprender y que tambien obtuvo un financiamiento, la Sra. Silvia esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Silvia works as a consultant and project manager, and also teaches advertising at one of the universities in our city. She is requesting a loan to buy materials for a project she has been given. Silvia is a single mother, and lives alone with her four-year-old daughter. She is a person of good character, responsible and hard working, who supports her family alone and hopes for a better quality of life. A friend of hers, an Emprender client who also obtained financing, recommended her. Silvia is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they show is granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase working materials.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María Leonor tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene a su cargo dos hijos menores, reside en Monsefú, zona bastante conocida dentro del departamento de Lambayeque por sus fiestas religiosas, la mayor parte de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la artesanía.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado San Cristóbal, un mercado situado en una zona marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella tiene mas de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro y es bastante conocida en el sector. La mayor parte de comerciantes de este mercado se dedican a la venta de verduras y abarrotes, carnes y otros productos al publico en general y a las amas de casa. Es un mercadillo que tiene mas de 25 años de instalado y cuenta con bastante afluencia de publico comprador.

Este negocio es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerlo, la calidad de los productos que brinda y el buen trato que ofrece la han hecho conocida y ahora cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren su negocio.

Maria Leonor se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en hacer mejoras en su vivienda, pues debido a las lluvias, se ha filtrado agua, es buscando el bienestar de su familia que realizara las mejoras necesarias.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su trabajo y a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les garantice un próspero porvenir. María Leonor ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Leonor is 40 years old. She is a single mother, and she has two minor children. She lives in Monsefú, a region within the Lambayeque department that is well-known for its religious festivals. Most of the inhabitants work at farming and handicrafts. She sells fish at the San Cristóbal market, which is in the outlying area of the city of Chiclayo. She has over 15 years of experience in this field, and she is well known in the area. Most of the merchants in this market sell vegetables, groceries, meat, and other products to the general public and housewives. The market has been set up for over 25 years, and there are plenty of people who go there to make purchases. This business is the only source of income she has to get her children ahead. Therefore, she tries to give the best of herself to maintain it. The good quality of the products and the good service she provides have made her well known. She now has a group of loyal customers who prefer her business. María Leonar is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 PEN. She plans on investing in making improvements to her house. Due to the rains, water has been leaking. She will make the necessary improvements because she is looking out for the well-being of her family. She is a woman who is devoted to her work and her family. Her greatest wish is to give her children a quality education that guarantees them a prosperous future. María Leonor has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the rain damage to her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Flor Del Bosque Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor del Bosque está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la joven Johana de los Ángeles T. G. quien desde hace dos años junto con su hermana  tiene una pequeña comideria  la cual vende en su casa y distribuye en varias empresas. Ella con el préstamo comprar los insumos para acrecentar su negocio.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Deysi del Rosario G. Rodríguez quien desde hace quince años vende verduras y frutas, Isaura del Carmen C. B.  es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería y Pedro Rolando Gaitán G. quien desde hace dos años y medios tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ellos invertirán el préstamo  en mercadería para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group Flor del Bosque is made up of 3 hard-working women. One of those is the young Johana de los Ángeles T. G. who has had a small food production business with her sister for 2 years. She sells from her home and distributes them to various companies. With this loan Johana wants to purchase the ingredients to grow her business. Her companions in the group are Deysi del Rosario G. Rodríguez, Isaura del Carmen C. B., and Pedro Rolando Gaitán G.. Deysi has been selling fruit and vegetables for 15 years. Isaura is the proprietor of a small grocery store and Pedro has had a small grocery store for 2 1/2 years. They will invest their loan in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of good ingredients such as basic grains, meat, vegetables, spices etc

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: LA SRA. LOLA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN EL BARRIO LAS PALMAS, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE ROPA LOS DIAS DE FERIA EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL DE LA LOCALIDAD, EN LOS DIAS PARTICULARES SU VENTA ES AMBULANTE POR EL PUEBLO, SU ESPOSO ES ENCARGADO DE UNA GRANJA DE POLLOS EN LA LOCALIDAD DE JOROCHITO A UNOS 10 KM DE LA COMUNIDAD, SU DESEO ES PODER TENER SU NEGOCIO ESTABLE EN EL MERCADO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR MERCADERIA DE INVIERNO; SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON LA INSTITUCION POR EL APOYO FINANCIERO BRINDADO."
texts.en:
Lola lives in the town of El Torno, 40 km from the city of Santa Cruz, in the area of Las Palmas. Her main activity is to sell clothes at the town's central market on holidays, and on special days, she moves her business throughout the town. Her husband is in charge of a chicken farm in the town of Jorochito, 10 km from the community. Her wish is to have a stable business in the marketplace. The purpose of the loan is to buy winter clothing merchandise. She is grateful to the institution for the financial support they have offered.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Mrs. Toch L. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Prek Thmey village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. Mrs. Toch L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline to support her farming crops. Her husband, Mr. Sophann Phan, is a laborer in a garment factory where he receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is 7 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline

loans.name: Monica Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora Mónica B. es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive en la ciudadela Calderón en de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la cuna de escritores, por estar bañada por sus cuatro ríos que le hacen una ciudad especial, gracias a sus iglesias, su centro histórico, su gente.
 
Nuestra señora tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 16 años que estudia en un colegio de esta ciudad. El esposo de la señora. Mónica tiene  profesión de policía en los Estados Unidos, emigro y el como conyugue nunca olvidó a su esposa ni tampoco a su hija,  siempre que puede las visita. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia tiene el negocio de elaboración de bufetes (comida para eventos sociales) hace cuatro años, los realiza bajo pedido, también elabora almuerzos hace cuatro meses, trabaja de lunes a viernes, todos sus platos lo aprendió a realizar ella sola, así  gana recursos para su familia.

 Es socia del banco hace dos ciclos, fue invitada por una socia de la banca; con el dinero de su crédito va  a pagar una letra de su automóvil que adquirido. Su meta es  crecer poco a poco hasta llegar tener un negocio muy grande.
texts.en:
Monico B. is a member of the Genesis village bank and lives in the suburb of Calderon in the city of Cuenca. The city is known for being the cradle of authors and for being surrounded by 4 rivers; it is a special city thanks to its churches, its historical center and its people. Monica is 37 years old, married and has a 16 year old daughter that is in the city high school. Monica's husband is a policeman in the US; he emigrated but has not forgotten about his wife and child and visits whenever he can. They don't have their own home so they continue to rent. She has run a catering business for special events for the past 4 years; 4 months ago, she started offering lunches from Monday to Friday. She learned how to prepare all the dishes on her own in order to support the family. She has been a member of the bank for 2 cycles and was invited by a fellow bank member. She will use the money to make a payment on her car she uses for the business. Her goal is to grow her business little by little till it is very large.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make vehicle payment

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado R. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 39 years old. Conrado is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Conrado owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. He also owns a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages. They sell basic food and daily-use products.

Conrado joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Conrado has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Conrado is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Conrado from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
A. Mahbuba is 49 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Since she was very young Mahbuba worked on a small farm, and now, along with her children she works cultivating wheat, corn, and vegetables. When their crop comes in they transport it to the capital for sale. This activity has helped to pay for the expenses of her family and the education of her children. 

Today she needs a loan for preparing his land for upcoming season. With this desire in mind she asks your consideration to receive them in your kind heart. She requests $1000 USD. Mahbuba wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Omar Torrijo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Omar Torrijo está conformado por Luz Marina S. S., Gloria Vanesa Ríos Jiménez y Martha Adelis R. C.. Luz quien es la coordinadora se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y perfumes desde hace 2 años. Ella invertirá el dinero prestado en la compra de más insumos.

Gloria Ríos se dedica a la venta de mercadería general desde hace 2 años, en cambio Martha R. tiene un puesto de tortillas y comercializa productos AVON. Ellas también invertirán en la compra de productos para hacer crecer sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The group named "Omar Torrijo" is made up of Luz Marina S. S., Gloria Vanesa R. J., and Martha Adelis R. C.. Luz is the coordinator of the group and has sold clothing, shoes and perfumes for the past 2 years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more merchandise. Gloria R. has sold general merchandise for the past 2 years, while Martha R. sells tortillas from a stand and she also wells Avon products. She will invest the loan in the purchase of products to stock their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander  es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo menor. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva desde hace mas de 4 años, Alexander desea adquirir inventario para mejorar la calidad de ropa que ofrece, de este modo planea obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a un crédito con cual comprara pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes formales. El es una persona que brinda todo su esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, de modo que pueda sacar a su familia adelante, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 31 year-old father who lives with his wife and their young son. He has had a business buying and selling new clothing for more than 4 years. Alexander wants to acquire inventory to improve the quality of the clothing he offers. In this way he plans to increase his earnings once he sells the clothes. To do this, he has seen the need to request a loan with which he will buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and formal suites. He is a person who puts maximum effort into his business so that he can provide for his family. He has worked previously with our institution, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy clothing

loans.name: Salinoa

texts.es:
La Señora Salinoa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”, ubicado en la provincia D. San Román y departamento D. Puno, tiene 41 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene  08 hijo (01 independiente), la señora estudió hasta 3ro D. secundaria.

La señora Salinoa esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. este ciclo, y nos cuenta que con el préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar su capital para su negocio D.  venta D. pescado,  y al engorD. D. animales menores,  para luego venderlos en las ferias comunales.

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital y  aumentar más ganado.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad D. los préstamos.
texts.en:
Salinoa is a member of the community bank named "The Pearls II". It is located in the province of San Roman in Puno. She is 41 years old, she is married, and she is has 8 children (one is independent). She has a graD. 9 education. Salinoa has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement since the beginning of this loan cycle. The loan she requests of Manuela Ramos is in the amount of 500 nuevos soles and with it she will supplement her business' working capital, selling fish and raising small livestock. She resells her livestock in regional country fairs. Her dreams for the future are to increase her working capital and to purchase more livestock. What she most enjoys about her community bank is being granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish in wholesale and small livestock.

loans.name: Carina

texts.es: Carina tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era muy joven se dedicaba a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas que utilizaban sus padres y cuando se caso, continúo trabajando en la siembra de papa, olluco, maíz y arveja, para sacar adelante a su familia. Han pasado 9 años, desde entonces le gusta mucho cultivar la tierra porque es lo que mejor que sabe hacer, aunque es algo sacrificado levantarse todos los días al amanecer y vigilar con dedicación sus campos. Señala que es gratificante cosechar y vender  todo a los mayoristas de la zona que le pagan regular dinero, que le permite darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Paralelamente a este trabajo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, que comercializa de vez en cuando a productores de la zona. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar la producción y tener mayores ganancias económicas. Es la tercera vez que tiene su crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Carina comprará sacos de abono y semillas de arveja.
texts.en:
Carina is 24 years old and she lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own home. Since she was very young she started working as an agriculturist. She learned the techniques used by her parents and when she married she continued working the fields, cultivating potatoes, fingerling potatoes, corn, and sweet peas. All her efforts to support her family. Nine years have passed and since then she has continued to enjoy working the fields because it is what she knows to do best, although it is difficult to get up at the break of dawn every day and be so vigilant in the care of the plantations. It is very gratifying to harvest and sell the products to wholesalers in the region, giving her payments on a regular basis. This permits her to provide a good quality of life to her children. Along with this business she is also a cattle farmer and she makes her sales whenever producers come to the region. As she is an enterprising person she has plans for the future to have larger plantations to increase production and her earnings. This is the third time she has accessed a loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know that she has this financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments and she enjoys being a member of the community bank. All the members are a team of responsible individuals. She is grateful to all those individuals that will contribute to the loan she has requested; it will be very useful in the development of her business. Carina will purchase sacks of fertilizer and pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 41-year-old man, married with four children aged 14,10, 5 and 2 years old. He has no other dependents and lives with a family of six members. He owns his home and his family goal is to have well educated children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda.

He is into  the motorcycle transport business and has been doing it for 4 years. He bought a motorcycle using his salary and faces a challenge of motorcycle break down, given the terrain of his business area. In future he sees his business having more motorcycles and himself having a private school. He wants the loan to enable him to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and pay repair costs so that he can continue operating his transport business.

loans.use: Buying spare parts for his motorcycle and paying repair costs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla V. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinuguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Perla is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Perla owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from dealing and selling clothing, shoes, lotions & other AVON products in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Perla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
This is Epifania B., 60, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She has five children, two of whom are already enrolled in college, while three stay at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Epifania has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Epifania operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more hardware and software needed for the shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Epifania dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more hardware and software needed for the shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.         

Susan sells food. She has been in this business for 6 years. She works 6 days a week. Susan sells her products door-to-door at retail prices. Susan has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more food, such as bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and yams. In the future, she hopes to own a big hotel and buy a plot of land. 

Susan lives in a home that she rents with electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong N., 45 years-old, is requesting a loan of US$ 900 to purchase shoes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. 

N. sells shoes, earning an income of US$ 3 per day. N. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for the garment factory industry. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of US$ 5 per day to help cover family expenses. The family has to spend US$ 75 on food, US$ 10 on electricity supply, and US$ 20 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra forma parte del banco comunal “Rayito de Sol” perteneciente a la ciudad de Chillán.  Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de dulces, queques, pan amasado y harina tostada, y la venta de ropa de lencería, desde hace 8 años. Su forma de venta es de manera ambulante y también por encargos. Trabaja de jueves a domingo. 
Con este préstamo comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus productos. 
Vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijas, de 10  y 6 años y su bebé de  8 meses. 
Su sueño es tener un carro en su casa para trabajar cerca de sus hijas y así poder cuidarlas. 
Para Sandra, los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido de gran apoyo para salir adelante con su negocio y de esta  manera aportar a la economía de su familia.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the "Rayito de Sol" (Little Ray of Sun) community bank, in the city of Chillán.  Her business is making and selling sweet treats, cakes, hand-made bread and toasted flour.  She also sells lingerie.  She has been in this business for 8 years.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and also accepts orders.  Sandra works from Thursday to Sunday.  She will use this loan to buy supplies for making her products.  

Sandra lives with her husband and 3 daughters who are 10 years old, 6 years old and 8 months old.  Her dream is to have a sales location in her home so that she can work near her daughters and be able to look after them.  For Sandra, loans from Fondo Esperanza have been a great support in getting ahead in her business and have helped her to support her family financially.

Chillán is a town in the southern-central area of Chile.  The name means 'chair of the sun' in Mapundungun, the language of our Mapuche native inhabitants.  Chillán is known as 'Cuna de la Patria” (Birthplace of the Nation) or “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of Artists) owing to the fact that it is the birthplace of a number of prominent characters in Chile's history such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: Kabumba I.  est entrepreneur, trésorière du groupe Maombi, âgée de 35 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous ces enfants étudient confortablement.  Son conjoint est un maitre charpentier, ouvrier  indépendant.  La cliente Kabumba I. est vendeuse des poissons frais au long des rues ambiantes. Elle commença son business  avec son fonds propre. Depuis 1994, elle exerce cette même activité. Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2005. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits  (4 paniers de poissons frais) pour revendre.  En plus, elle ambitionne,  elle-même allé s’approvisionner les poissons en Ouganda-Kisoro sans passer par les intermédiaires. La cliente Kabumba I.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Maombi est constitué de 31 membres.
texts.en: Kabumba Immaculee is an entrepreneur and she is also the treasurer of the group named Maombi. She is 35 years old, she is married, and she is the mother of 6 children. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a master carpenter and an independent tradesman. Kabumba Immaculee sells fresh fish along the locale roads. She started her business with her own money. She has had this same business since 1994. She accessed a loan of $50 in 2005 from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner). This new loan will help her purchase more products (4 baskets of fresh fish) for resale. In addition, she hopes to travel to Ouganda-Kisoro to purchase fish without having to buy from retailers. Kabumba Immaculee is grateful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are otherwise excluded from traditional banks. The Maombi group is made up of 31 members.

loans.use: To purchase 4 baskets of fish.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm, which is located in Kitale town, western Kenya, is currently producing milk which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide the basic needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 41,600Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income that will be generated from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. His primary challenges have been disease and insufficient water for his dairy cows.

David is 44 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine G. owns The Vintage Kitty, a boutique that sells furniture, artwork, antique books, and other eclectic items.  Located with other art and collectible stores in an antique mall, Christine considers The Vintage Kitty a “conscious boutique” both because of the unique artwork she carries and because she uses her store as a venue to raise awareness for animal rescue.

Christine offers consignment for people who don’t have a venue to sell their work. Consignment means that she sells their item at her store without actually buying it from them.  They are compensated if the item sells, but if it does not sell, she is not left with inventory she cannot move.  She says consignment has helped keep her costs and inventory low.  She advertises through Facebook and Craigslist, in addition to her own webpage and blog.  If necessary, she will even go door-to-door to ask people if they have things they want to sell.

As Christine continues to grow and develop The Vintage Kitty, she looks to further hone its image by carrying more selective work.  Christine says that she is not necessarily interested in carrying “exclusive artwork,” but instead focuses on carrying smart, unique pieces that show creativity.  She does not plan to limit her business contacts to professional artists, but also is interested in talented, amateur artists that create for fun.  

Christine heard of ACCION Texas-Louisiana through theredshoes.org, an organization that empowers women through personal and spiritual development.  Christine is using this loan to improve the store’s appearance through new displays, and to grow her inventory.    

Christine strongly believes that with will-power, you can achieve anything.  She was the first person in her family to graduate from high school, and the first to attend and graduate from college.  Christine actively works with the local Baton Rouge animal rescue.  She keeps her store stocked with animal rescue literature, and uses her home as a foster home for rescue cats.

Her long-term goal is to move The Vintage Kitty to its own location.  Having a stand-alone store would provide her the freedom to better create the image she wants for her business, as well as let her use her store as a center for rescue cats.  The rescue cat center would be separate from her business, and would be maintained and supported by the local animal rescue center.

Check out The Vintage Kitty at http://thevintagekitty.com/index.htm.  On her website, she also has links to her blog and a link to The Vintage Kitty’s Facebook page.

loans.use: Increasing inventory, purchasing displays for store

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
In Kompong Chhnang province, Bin S., 32, is married to Sorn Sim, 35. He and his wife are good at making bamboo baskets for the local market. Sometimes they go through the village looking for bamboo and take it home. Then they put the bamboo into water for almost a week, and after that dry it in the sunshine for at least three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces, and then he and his wife start making the pieces into baskets.

Bin S. is requesting a loan and will invest 30 percent of it in his bamboo craft business. With the other 70 percent, he is going to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.use: To invest in his bamboo craft business and purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated an electronics sales shop for the past five years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Kibibi dreams of owning rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she is requesting, she wants to renovate her shop by purchasing blocks and cement and paying for labor. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase blocks and cement and to pay for labor to renovate her shop.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 27-year-old mother to 4 children. She is married and lives in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Her oldest child is 8 years old.

Daisy is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops and sells her harvest to the market. With 4 kids, Daisy finds it a challenge to make ends meet. She decided to open a sari-sari store to help in their daily needs. Daisy hopes for her farm and store to grow.

Daisy's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and store items to sell such as canned goods.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and store items to sell such as canned goods

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto M. is from the village of Insibay, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 44 years old and married, with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ernesto runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where he sells canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ernesto joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Balyejusa Ttikkalu Farmers Group

texts.en: Andrew, 43 years old, has been engaged in a pig sales business for the past eight years in Kampala. Andrew, who is happily married with four kids and is also a teacher, says he started this business with savings from his agro sales business. Pork is a delicacy liked by many people in and around Kampala. As a result, Andrew has many buyers for his pigs. Andrew says he has been able to consolidate on his profit base with sales from this business. The business generates 100,000 shillings profit monthly. Andrew says he will use this loan to purchase more pigs to resell.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to resell.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 37-year-old father of two daughters and two sons. Raed is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He has a small piece of land that he decided to use to plant seasonal vegetables for a second income for the family. Raed took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a greenhouse and start planting vegetables. He is photographed in FATEN's office.

loans.use: to purchase a greenhouse to plant seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en: Sonnie is 27 years old and live in West Point. She is single and has one child, aged five, who lives with her mother. For the past few years, Sonnie has been manufacturing local washing soap in her community; she enjoys it a lot since she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase caustic soda and oil for her business. She plans to build a house and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase caustic soda and oil for her business.

loans.name: Creando Futuro Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Creando Futuro”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago. Todos ellos se dedican al rubro del comercio, vendiendo comida rápida, ropa de segunda mano, lanas, ropa de bebé, artículos escolares, frutas y servicio de costuras. 
Ximena quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, al lado derecho del grupo, se destaca porque usa su cabello corto y su color es castaño claro, en ésta fotografía sólo aparece su rostro. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de sopaipillas, empanadas, arrollados, té y café. Realiza éste oficio desde hace 2 años, vendiendo en una feria libre los días martes y viernes y los fines de semana instala su negocio en un persa (feria libre más grande).
Durante la temporada primavera verano Ximena se dedica a la producción y venta de jugos tropicales, para esto compra frutas dos días a la semana, para abastecerse con insumos. Durante ésta temporada de invierno Ximena compra su mercadería en comercios donde el costo de insumos es más conveniente.
Con el crédito comprará un carro más grande, por lo que necesita renovar la infraestructura y que éste sea más grande. Ésta inversión la realizará junto a su marido, ya que él también necesita de éste para trasladar su mercadería, ya que  trabaja en una feria libre vendiendo otro tipo de productos. Éste nuevo carro además le permitirá acceder a un permiso para vender sus productos sin dificultad. 
Ximena vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas, una de ellas los apoya con las ventas en sus negocios los fines de semana. Sus sueños son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad socioeconómica y a sus hijas en su educación.
Ximena asiste generalmente a cursos de perfeccionamiento, el último de ellos fue un curso de peluquería y en la actualidad realizará un curso de computación. Su motivación de aprender y conocer se debe a que Ximena anhela incursionar en el futuro en un negocio más estable. 
Ximena está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza en cuanto a las capacitaciones y crédito.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Creando Futuro” (Creating the Future) and consists of 18 entrepreneurs. They are from the community of Independencia in the city of Santiago. All of them engage in businesses such as trade, selling fast food, selling used clothing, selling wool, selling baby clothes, selling school supplies, selling fruit, and offering sewing services.

In the photograph, Ximena is one of the women standing on the right side. She has short brown hair, but only her face is visible in the photo. Ximena prepares and sells sopapillas, empanadas, rolls, tea, and coffee. She has been in this business for two years. Ximena sells at an open market on Tuesdays and Thursdays. On the weekends, she has a business set up at a “persa” (a large fair).

During the spring and summer seasons, Ximena makes and sells tropical juices. To do this, she buys fruit twice a week so that she can stock her inventory. In the winter, Ximena buys her merchandise at stores because the cost of supplies is more affordable. With this loan, she will buy a larger cart. She needs to renovate the infrastructure of her business, and this cart will give her more space. Ximena is making this investment with her husband because he plans to use it to move his merchandise. He works at the open market selling other types of products. This new cart will allow her to obtain a permit so that she can sell her products without difficulty.

Ximena lives with her husband and two daughters. One of her daughters helps her on the weekends with generating sales for her business. She dreams of improving her family’s socioeconomic status and providing her daughters with an education.

Ximena has a perfect attendance record at the training seminars. The last course she took was in hairstyling and now she is enrolled in a computer course. Her motivation to learn and expand her knowledge will help her have a more stable business in the future. She is very pleased and grateful for the support that Fondo Esperanza has provided through the training classes and the loans.

Independencia is one of 34 communities that make up the city of Santiago, the Chilean capital. It is located in the north-central section. Independencia emerged in the late nineteenth century as a traditional section of the city. The main thoroughfare is Independencia Avenue, which intersects with the old Inca Trail, the gateway to the north and to the city of Santiago. Given the growing indigenous population, Independencia became the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile. It also has major historical buildings, including six Chilean historical monuments.

loans.use: to purchase a large vending cart.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a peddler in oats, bowls and cooking utensils in Abura. She lives together with her husband and young child. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of bowls and utensils to sell. She desires to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: buy bowls and utensils

loans.name: Natioub Kafane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 mai 2007. Il est  constitué de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce et le maraichage.

Madame Brigitte Bienvenue qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère de deux enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on May 19, 2007.  It is made up of 13 women, all living in the same neighborhood.  Their main business is small-scale sales and farming.

Brigitte Bienvenue, who is raising her hand at right in the photo, is the group leader.  She is 32 years old and a single mother of two. 
 
She works selling vegetables.  She has considerable experience in this field, having worked in it for several years.

This loan will enable her to increase her operating funds and to expand her business.   

The profits will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Since 2000, Mrs. Sorn has been living in Siem Reap province of Cambodia with her family of four, including two children. She and her husband, in trying to find a good job, started fish selling. Mrs. Sorn sells fish in a market near her house.

Her husband catches fish to give his wife for sale at the market. Both of them are able to make a profit of $6 per day. Mrs. Sorn would like to borrow some money to improve the business. She is requesting this loan of $500 to repair her old house, which is broken.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Celia Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia Pilar; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de contadora, ella tiene una oficina donde trabaja independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere que su hijo termine de estudiar la carrera profesional de sistemas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una computadora para su hijo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "SANTO DOMINGO".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Celia Pilar.  She is 48 years old and married with one son.  The member combines her daily activities with her work as an accountant.  She has an office where she works independently from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  Though this work, the member has been to move her son ahead in life.  The member wants her son to finish studying for a professional career in systems

The member is requesting the loan to purchase a computer for her son.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her son.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Mona has a retail shop she she sells blouses, t-shirts, sandals & shoes. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional products like clothing & shoes to sell.

Mona is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products like clothing & shoes to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 30 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is married and has no children.  Robert has a business of a small retail shop, which he has had for 3 years.  He raises poultry as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, Robert hopes to expand his business into a wholesale shop.   Robert is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Phinary

texts.en:
Phinary (who is in the photo) is a weaver. In addition, she also buys some silk and cotton fabrics from her fellow weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces far away from her house.  

Phinary hopes to expand her business by buying additional silk and cotton fabrics to sell, so she is requesting another loan of US $400 to help her capital.

loans.use: To buy additional silk and cotton fabrics to sell

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a clothes shop in the future.

With the Kshs15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Luz Melida

texts.es:
La Señorita. Luz es socia del banco comunal Libertad en Progreso, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió y propicio para la cría de ganado por sus amplias llanuras, su gente es muy amable, cálida y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita. Luz tiene 32 años es soltera, vive con sus padres compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su mamá se dedica a la cría de animales y su papá labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propiedad de sus padres.

Nuestra socia se dedica al bordado hace 8 años, trabaja en su casa y solo bajo pedido. También cría ganado y cuyes.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y otros materiales de bordado para continuar con su trabajo. 

Su meta es tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the “Libertad en Progreso” communal bank.  She lives in a community belonging to Victoria del Portete (Cuenca) Parish.  This is a cold climate place apt for raising livestock on its wide plains.  Its residents are kind, warm and keep the customs and traditions of their peoples.

Luz is 32 years old, single and lives with her parents sharing household expenses.  Her mother raises animals and her father works as a bricklayer.  The house they live in belongs to her parents.

Luz has been embroidering for 8 years.  She works from home and only based on prior orders.  She also raises livestock and guinea pigs.

The communal bank is in its 4th loan and the new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread and other embroidery supplies to continue with her work.  Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 46 years old, is a farmer, earning $1 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairer, earning $5 per day. The couple has 3 children, all of whom work in a garment factory, each earning $2 per day. Each month, Than spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on rent, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

Than would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy motorbike repair materials for her husband's career. The loan will help her husband to run his business well and to provide better service to his customers. Than's husband wants to extend his career when he can save enough money and have more customers.

loans.use: To buy motorbike repair materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Brayson

texts.en:
Brayson is 29 years old, married, and he supports three people in his family. For the past five years, he has been a farmer. Brayson is a good KADET LTD client and was introduced to the organization by a staff member. 

Brayson is requesting a loan to buy maize seed and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers to assist him to plant. In the future, he hopes to see his children prosper.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Son integrantes del comité San Antonio mujeres muy sacrificadas con el deseo de superación.  En total son 13 mujeres que pretenden mejorar su calidad de vida, a través del trabajo,  están motivadas en sus actividades con el deseo y logro de mejorar sus ingresos.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, ella vende empanadas, sandwish, tortillas, etc. Por medio de este trabajo ella logra sacar adelante a su familia y también cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en el trabajo.  Nos comenta que tiene muchos deseos de poder seguir creciendo con esto y es por ello que solicita el crédito, el cual desea invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, panificados y otros ingredientes que pueda necesitar para elaborar sus alimentos.
Ella al igual que sus compañeras está agradecida por la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
These are the members of the San Antonio Group. They are women who make many sacrifices with a desire to improve their lives. In total, there are thirteen women who would like to improve their quality of life through work, and are motivated by their efforts with the desire to realize increased revenues.
Maria sells many kinds of foods. She sells empanadas, sandwiches, tortillas, etc. As a result of this work, she has managed to help her family get ahead, and also to cover the daily costs that her work incurs. She tells us that she hopes very much to be able to continue growing with her business, and it is for this reason that she is requesting the loan. She wishes to invest it by purchasing meat, vegetables, condiments, breads, and other ingredients that she might need while making her foods.
Just like her colleagues, Maria is grateful for the help of the Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, breads, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her decorative embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase beads, thread, and other materials in bulk to allow her to make even more beautiful embroidered clothes and earn more profits.

She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. She is confident that a loan will help her to make her business more profitable. Her husband is also an embroidery expert. Both Farhat and her husband work very hard to put three meals on the table.

Farhat is the mother of two daughters; the elder one is six years old, and the younger is only one year old. With the loan investment, she hopes to earn more profits, allowing her to send her elder daughter to school.

Note: In the picture, the lady holding a passbook (called the Asasah passbook) is Farhat.

loans.use: to buy beads and thread for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 19 años, es una joven muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Edilio de 19 años y su única hija Sully, quien es su principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Reyna abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 01 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar con sus planes de trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando más productos para incrementar su negocio como: conservas, arroz, fideos, gaseosas, galletas, etc.
texts.en:
Reyna, 19, is a very kind, hardworking young woman living in her own house with her spouse, Edilio, 19, and her only daughter, Sully, who is the main motivating factor behind all her efforts.

Reyna opens her grocery store very early every day to take care of her neighbors.  She is a very skilled seller; she knows how to treat her customers and always convinces them to buy something extra.  Her store is very well-stocked because she always focuses on stocking whatever she needs.  What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her customers.  She’s been in business a year and considers the most difficult thing having to stay in the store all day without being able to go out.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store’s installations to sell more products.

This will be MFP loan #1 and she hopes for your support so that she can realize her work plans.  She will use the 1000 new soles to buy merchandise to increase stock inventory like: canned goods, rice, noodles, soft-drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Né le 10 Janvier 1973 à Bamako Monsieur Karim est marié et père de 3 enfants résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Karim  est vétérinaire de formation qui s'est initié à cette activité de divertissement il y a environ 10 ans dont il dispose une salle de jeu devant le domicile, il est beaucoup sollicité, il dispose un téléviseur avec lequel les jeunes viennent se divertir avec le jeu Play-Station.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à un premier prêt individuel pour une diversification de ses services en achetant, deux Play-Station un ordinateur pour le gravage, deux Téléviseurs et deux DVD. 
Il compte acheter ses marchandises au Ghana.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Born January 10, 1973 in Bamako Mr. Karim is married with three children. He lives in a traditional extended family in Wayerma I, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Karim is a veterinarian who started this entertainment activity about 10 years ago. He has a game room at the front of his home which is much in demand since it has a television where young people come to enjoy Play-Station games.

To better serve an ever-increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with which he is on his first individual loan.

He wants to diversify his services by buying two Play-Stations, one computer to burn CD/DVDs, two TVs and two DVD players. He intends to purchase the equipment in Ghana.

He expects this loan will generate monthly profits of 150,000 FCFA to be used primarily to increase his business, contribute towards family expenses and pay interest on the loan.

loans.use: To purchase electronic devices (Play Station, TV, DVD player).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old and married to Agnes. They have six children.

He has been in the business of carpentry for the last 24 years.  He earns a monthly income of Kes 23,000.  He is applying for his second loan of Kes  5,000.  He paid the previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy carpentry materials, timber, glue, nails, paints, and varnish.  He wants to use the profits to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy timber, glue, nails, wood paints and varnish.

loans.name: Fawziye

texts.en:
Fawziye is a 59-year-old married woman, the mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor from home for 31 years. 

Fawziye is good at her work and well known in her area. She lives in a populous neighborhood. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to support her new business with a special range of clothing. She is selling used clothes and needs a small capital to improve that business.

Fawziye will also help her son and buy him a bedroom for his new house.

The new machine that she bought with the previous loan helped a lot in improving her business. Fawziye is still hoping to open a shop in the future and expand her business more.

loans.use: To support her new business with a special range of used clothing.

loans.name: Mery Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Mary es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que gracias a la belleza de su Centro Histórico y su Cultura fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en diciembre de 1999, cuenta con una gran variedad en la gastronomía, su gente es amable y gentil.
 
Doña Mary tiene 32 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y su segunda hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo transportes pesados, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Mary se dedica a  la fabricación y venta de juegos pirotécnicos, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y labora en el negocio desde muy joven, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su prima. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra materiales para la realización de los juegos pirotécnicos como carrizo, piola, pólvora, papel, etc. 

Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of Yanuncay Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which, thanks to the beauty of its historic center and its culture, was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999. The city has a broad variety of gastronomy, and the people there are pleasant and kind.
 
Mery, 32, is married and has two children from this relationship, ages 14 and 9.  Her oldest child is in high school and her second one, a daughter, is in elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a driver by profession and works transporting heavy loads.  The house in which they live is their property.

Mery works making and selling fireworks.  She learned this job from her parents and worked in the business from a young age.  She works Monday through Saturday without a schedule.
 
This is her first loan from the communal bank, to which she was invited by her cousin.  She is going to invest her loan in buying materials to make fireworks, such as reeds, cord, gunpowder, paper, etc.

Her goal is to finish her university studies and get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy reeds, cord, gunpowder, paper, etc.

loans.name: Maria Yenni

texts.es: La Sra. María Yenni actualmente vive y trabaja en la comunidad de Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, quien se dedica a la actividad Agropecuaria que es el único ingreso con el que cuenta por el momento, tiene un hijo que depende de la cliente y ahora requiere de dinero como apoyo para poder iniciar la actividad de apicultura (producción de miel) ya que cuenta con el conocimiento necesario para iniciar esta actividad por la capacitación que recibió de ONG´s. como la Fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda en Acción Bolivia, actualmente vive en domicilio Familiar de propiedad de su Padre; el préstamo que requiere le servirá para implementar su producción apícola para producir miel, mencionar que dicha persona se dedicó desde bien jóven a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único medio que tiene para su sustento diario y otros gastos, con esta nueva actividad podrá obtener a futuro un mejor ingreso económico y de esta manera poder vivir en mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Implementar producción de miel (apicola) y producir mejores productos para sus clientes y de esta manera generar mejores ingresos para su hijo.

loans.name: Dado

texts.en:
Dado A. was born in Tsévié in 1964. She had to quit school in the 10th grade in order to learn hairdressing. After finishing her training, she did not have the money to open a shop. So she set up a table and became a merchant. An energetic woman with an instinct for management, she was able to handle a $350 loan, which she repaid in due course. Ms. A. is married with three children. She is requesting a loan of $800 to stock up on rice, sugar, and tomatoes. She will then be able to enhance her business, make it profitable, and contribute more towards improving the life of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Dado est née en 1964 à Tsévié. Elle a dû abandonné ses études en au niveau secondaire pour apprendre la coiffure. Formation terminée, elle n’a pas eu de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Elle se lança alors dans le petit commerce de table. Dynamique et ayant le sens d’une bonne gestion, elle a su gérer les $350 de crédit obtenu et régulièrement remboursé. Madame A. Dado est mariée et à trois (03) enfants. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 qui servira à s’approvisionner en riz, sucre et tomate. Elle pourra ainsi accroître et rentabiliser ses activités et contribuer plus à l’amélioration de la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell rice

loans.name: Rimigio

texts.en:
Rimigio has been a rice farmer and a cattle herder his entire life. He has a very limited education, but he is a very hard worker. Although he is over 65 years old, he does not intend to stop working the lands that have provided for him and his family for decades. He feels fortunate to have the opportunity to attain some financing for his lands. He plans to invest in seeds and some pesticides. The loan will help him avoid borrowing from informal lenders who charge way too much and take a large part of the profits he makes from his crops.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Rimigio is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in rice harvesting

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Married and the mother of six children, Mrs T. Pauline was born in 1972 and is also responible for the education of her younger brother. The main activity of her husband is farming. Her main activity is selling food in isolated areas where access to public transit is difficult. She is asking for a loan of $600 in order to buy foodstuffs in large quantities and to cover her costs of transportation. The financing of this project will allow her to increase her revenues and better deal with the health, education and nutrition problems faced by her household.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six enfants, Madame T. Pauline est née en 1972 et a à sa charge son petit frère scolarisé. L’activité principale de son mari est l’agriculture. Son activité à elle consiste à acheter des denrées alimentaires et à les revendre dans des zones enclavées où l’accès au véhicule de transport en commun est difficile. Elle sollicite un montant de $600 afin de pouvoir acheter ses denrées en quantité considérable et couvrir ainsi les frais de transport. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter son revenu et de mieux faire face aux problèmes de son foyer tels que la santé, l’éducation et l’alimentation.

loans.use: buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new products

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria Carita Chura lives with her husband. They have a one year old son. She is a member of the association 8 of September de Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto. Maria did not neglect her academic studies, so during the evening she is an assistant in the public school, and in the mornings she sells second hand clothing from America, managing a stall on Figueroa Street in La Paz.

Maria has had her own location for 6 years. In the beginning, she would choose a few garments from wholesalers to resell for her entry into Pro Mujer, and by means of the loan, she began to buy clothing wholesale and sell her merchandise retail, generating her own resources. She will use the capital to increase her merchandise even more, and buy clothing in bundles. In this way she can assure that her profits will meet the needs of her son, and allow him to complete his studies.

María Carita Chura, vive con su pareja y es madre de un niño de un año, socia de la asociación 8 de septiembre de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto. María no descuida su formación académica, pues de noche ella asiste a una escuela pública, y en las mañanas se dedica a la venta de ropa usada americana, atendiendo un puesto en la calle Figueroa de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella posee el puesto, que es propio y que lo tiene hace 6 años. En sus inicios, ella escogía algunas prendas de mayoristas para la reventa a su ingreso a Pro Mujer, y mediante los créditos prestados, María comenzó a comprar ropa al por mayor y vender su mercadería al por menor, generando recursos propios. Precisa de capital para poder incrementar aun mas su mercadería, poder comprar ropa por fardos, de esta manera asegurar sus ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hijo y para poder culminar sus estudios.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy merchandise and clothing in bulk for her business

loans.name: Albino Jose

texts.pt:
José Albino T. was born on March 13, 1974 in the Province of CaT. in Maputo. He was raised by his grandparents and studied until the 6th grade. He is 33 years old, married and father of 4 children. Jose supports a family of 6. To put himself through school, he fished and in 1993 he left for South Africa. There he got sick and was forced to return 5 months later. He returned to fishing and in 2002 he build a small home. He has been working as a photographer for 6 years, despite his lack of formal education. Jose also has a small shop where he employs 2 people.

With this loan he plans on buying pool tables and to increase his inventory. In the summer he is able to sell up to 4.000mt a week in drinks and pool table rental fees. Lately he has had less customers and his monthly income is down to 9,000.00. With the income from the business Jose supports his family and tries to save. In the future, he wants to invest in his business. Jose believes these loan have had a positive impact in his business.
