Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chalí-caT.-Maputo Cliente: José Albino T. Actividade: Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 50.000,mzm ( 2.000 USD) Aplicação: compa e venda de produtos Início: 07-11-07 Fim: 30-04-09 José Albino T. , nasceu aos 13 de Março de 1974 em CaT. Província de Maputo, tem 33 anos de idade, estudou apenas até 6ªclasse , casado maritalmente tem 4 filhos e vive com 6 pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Passou a sua infância junto dos seus avôs devido a problemas sociais envolvendo os seus progenitores. Para sustentar os seus estudos , ia a pesca nos tempos livres em 1993 por influência de amigos , teve que abandonar os estudos e ir a R.S.A ( Republica de Aafrica do Sul) onde foi obrigado a regressar seis meses depois devido a uma doênça que havia contraído lá. E algum tempo depois melhora e volta a dedicar se na pesca tempo depois aprende a fazer o negócio atravez do pai até que em 2002 constroi a sua barraca . Actualmente dedica se no negócio e serviços fotográficos, a faz este negócio a 6 anos e não tem nenhuma formação . Tém duas empregadas uma tem 5 filhos e outra tem 2 filhos. Com este empréstimo, pretende comprar mais uma mesa de bilhares e reforçar a mercadoria na barraca, abre o seu negócio as 7 horas e tem ido a pé, a mercadoria para o negócio tem adiquirido na cidade de Maputo e tem alugado uma carrinha de mão vulgo tchova para transportá-los.

O melhor período para o seu negócio é no verão e a receita diária é de 4,000.00mt. O produto que dá mais lucro são as bebidas e jogos de bilhares e tem feito registos de vendas. A única dificuldade tem surgido quando haver mão tempo baixa o movimento de clientes e a margem de lucro mensal tem sido de 9,000.00mt. Com os rendimentos do negócio paga o crédito , sustenta a família , faz o reinvestimento e uma parte deposita no banco . No futuro pensa ampliar o seu estabelecimento e comprar mais uma Mesa de Bilhares e para tal precisará de um outro empréstimo. Em geral acha que o empréstimo modificou positivamente o seu negócio uma vez que comprou uma mesa de bilhares e está lhe rendendo muito pelo que está satisfeito.

loans.use: To increase stock and buy pool tables for the business

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros T., age 44, is a housewife.  Her husband is employed at a private company, earning around $3 each day.  They have four children.  Two are employed at a hotel and collectively earn around $120 per month, and two are unemployed.  She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to build separate rooms on her house for her grown children to live in.

loans.use: To build additional rooms on her house.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov C. N. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two little children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling various kinds of Khmer foods to the people in her area, making on average of around $3 each day. Her husband works as a tire repairman, making generally about $2 each day. Mrs. Nov C. N. is applying for a loan to enable her to purchase more utensils to expand her business, and with the rest of the loan she would like to reinvest in her growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to expand her business, and to reinvest in her growing business.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a taxi cab driver from the Khoost area in western Ukraine. Married with a little three year old daughter, Roman is able to support his wife and family with his taxi business and a small store he operates. Roman has been driving a taxi for the past three years. He offers good service and low prices to his customers. In a typical month, Roman makes around $750 in profit. 

Roman has requested a loan of $1000 to increase his working capital. His business has benefited from and grown as a result of financial assistance he has received through Nadiya Ukraine. This loan will help him continue to operate a successful and stable enterprise.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is married with 4 children. She is 51 years old and sells firewood. She has been in business for 20 years and comes from Edo State, Nigeria. She spent 8 months learning her trade. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Mrs Jenny is a member of the Las Azucenas 2 Community Bank, located at 132 Jr Mariano Melgar, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 46 years old and has two children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of approximately $110, Jenny opened a small soda fountain counter. She gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children, and then she opens her soda fountain counter and serves customers until 8 pm.

With this loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, Jenny plans to buy 5 crates of soda, one soda gas pump, and also to improve the décor of her premises.

Jenny is very proud of the fact that she works and is an independent woman, thanks to Manuela Ramos support.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Jr Mariano Melgar 132, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Jenny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña fuente de soda. En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego abre su fuente de soda para esperar la llegada de sus clientes, hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 surtidora y también mejorara su local, etc. Jenny esta muy orgullosa, ya que le permite trabajar y ser una mujer independiente gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for soda fountain counter

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Eseosa O. is married and is 32 years old. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells wrappers and has been in this business for past 5 years. She is a LAPO client. She needs a loan $700 to buy more wrappers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers for sale

loans.name: Faasala Leo's Group

texts.en:
This SPBD group is composed of women who plan to work at their families' plantation businesses. This loan is their first because their status as unemployed personnel kept them from traditional loans. However the SPBD has opened the gate to different challenges and a better future.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment and supplies

loans.name: Rosas De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
The Roses of the Andes group is composed of old and new members. It is hoped that their repayment will be good. Groups usually make their first repayments normally and they have full understanding that any delay in one of their payments affects the group. They carry out different activities and are currently up to date. Follow up will be ongoing, especially on payment dates.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

ROSAS D. LOS ANDES este grupo está Conformado por antiguos y nuevas, se espera que el comportamiento sea bueno, los grupos generalmente los primeros pagos efectúan con normalidad, y tienen pleno conocimiento cualquier atraso en sus amortizaciones D. uno D. ellos afecta al grupo, tienen diferentes actividades, actualmente son cumplidas, el seguimiento se hará constante especialmente en las fechas D. pago.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Fatoumata Dioulde

texts.fr:
Fatoumata is a lady who has a shop located close to the Djignabo college. She prepares sandwiches for students and passerbys but she also sells other various items. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her business and to increase her profits so that she can take care of herself.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatoumata, une dame, a une boutique situee pres du lycee djignabo. Elle prepare des sandihw pour les eleves et passant mais aussi elle vend divers articles, elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son activite et faire davantage de benefice pour qu'elle puisse se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Sales

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio por la falta de trabajo y por que nadie le ayudaba en los gasto de sus hijos y de la casa, ante la necesidad de solventar los gastos del hogar y de sus pequeños ella busco una actividad que le generara ingresos y en su casa empezó a vender refrescos y frituras, poco a poco fue creciendo hasta tener una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas y estantes ya que le esta yendo muy bien y quiere tener buena imagen en su tienda.
texts.en:
Martha started her business for lack of a job and because no one was helping her with the costs of raising her kids and paying for her house. Confronted with the necessity of resolving the expenses associated with her home and her small children, she sought an activity that would generate income. From her house, she began to sell refreshments and fried finger foods. The business grew little by little to the point of having a small grocery store.

Martha needs a loan of $950 to be repaid within six months in order to buy display cabinets and shelves; her business is going well and she wants her store to have a good image.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cabinets and shelves.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Elizabeth from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 19. She also supports another dependant because his parents cannot take care of him. Elizabeth runs a genge or a grocery business. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, where general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish are sold. It is the kind of place that local people send their children to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Elizabeth's business is doing good. She works at the business 13 hours day, 7 days week, and she has two employees to assist her. Elizabeth currently earns about $350 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $425 USD so she can purchase additional stock. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 26 años, convive con su pareja y sus dos hijos que ya están estudiando. Es agricultor desde muy pequeño, tiene campos de cultivo en zonas donde se siembra por temporada, según las lluvias, entonces tiene que alquilarse campos que tienen zonas de regadío. Cuando le toca regar su chacra lo hace a 4 de la madrugada para aprovechar el caudal del agua. Después regresa a desayunar y eso de las 9 nuevamente regresa a su chacra hasta las 5 de la tarde. Edwin está muy contento con la agricultura, porque tiene temporadas que su producción es muy buena. Considera que sus productos son rentables porque son de consumo cotidiano. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que pide comprará abono, tales como el fosfato de nitrato y potasio, para sus chacras ya sembradas.
texts.en:
Edwin is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two student-age children. He has been a farmer since he was young and he has land where he plants various crops each season depending on the rains but occasionally he has to rent irrigated land. When it is his turn to irrigate his land, he has to do it at 4 in the morning to take advantage of the water flow. Afterwards, he returns home to eat breakfast then works on his land from 9 to 5. Edwin is very happy as a farmer because he has seasons when his production is very good. His crops are profitable because they are things that are consumed by most people every day. This is his first loan from Prisma Microfinance and he will use the money to buy fertilizers such as phosphates, nitrates, and potassium for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his land

loans.name: Ermelinda Olívia

texts.pt:
Ermelinda T. e natural de Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, e casada maritalmente e mãe de 05 filhos, o primeiro tem 17 anos e frequenta 7ª classe, o segundo com13 anos frequenta 7ª classe, o terceiro com 9 anos frequenta 5ª classe, o quarto tem 6 anos e frequenta 2ª classe e o ultimo tem apenas 3 anos. Basicamente sustenta seu marido e seus filhos.

Ermelinda estudou ate 7ª classe, parou de estudar por falta de condições, casou-se quando tinha 20 anos de idade e o casamento dura ate hoje, vive na casa própria no bairro onde nasceu e passou toda a sua infância, o seu trabalho e de venda de frangos o qual faz com ajuda dos seus filhos, foi com a mãe que ela aprendeu a fazer o negocio a 7 anos atrás sendo esta também comerciante na mesma área. Adquire o frango por 85,00Mt e vende por 95,00 a 100,00Mt, consegue ter como lucro 5.000,00Mt e poupa 2.000,00Mt 

Para Ermelinda este e o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, conheceu a Hluvuku através da dona Elisa que também é nossa cliente. Com o empréstimo pretende aumentar os seus produtos para responder a procura e consequentemente os rendimentos, seu grande desafio e de mais postos de venda do seu produto e realizar o seu sonho de abrir uma boutique.
texts.en:
Ermelinda T., a native of Maputo, is 36 years old and is married with five children. Her oldest is 17 and attends seventh-grade. Her 13-year-old also attends seventh-grade, her nine-year-old attends fifth grade, her six-year-old attends second-grade, and her youngest is three. Essentially, she alone supports her husband and children. Ermelinda studied until seventh-grade, but conditions did not permit her to continue her education. She married at the age of 20 and her marriage continues until today. She owns her home, which is located in the neighborhood where she spent her childhood. Her business is selling live chickens, which she does with the help of her children. She learned the business at the age of seven from her mother, who is also a merchant in the same field. She purchases chickens for 85 MT and sells them for 95 to100 MT. She is able to earn 5000 MT, of which she saves 2000 MT. This is the first loan for Ermelinda from Hluvuku and Kiva. She learned about Hluvuku from dona Elisa, who is also a Hluvuku client. With the loan, she intends to increase her inventory to meet the demand, and thus her profits. Her great challenge is to sell her product in more locations and to realize her dream of opening a boutique.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing live chickens for resale

loans.name: Chadudu H Group

texts.en:
Witness has owned a small pharmacy in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more medicine for her shop and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes the loan will also lead to increased profit.

Witness is 38 years old and married. She has two children who are ages 20 and 14.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Colaboradores Group

texts.en:
Maely C. is the group coordinator for the Colaboradores Bank of Hope in San Pedro de Macoris. The loan amount will be shared among the nine members of the group, who run various businesses.  

Maely has six children.  She runs a catering business and needs to replenish her supplies to keep serving meals.  She hopes to keep running her own business and to provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for catering business

loans.name: Ichinhorloo

texts.en: Ichinhorloo D. is a 38-year-old married woman who has 2 children. Unfortunately, her husband has been in prison since 2007. She has been working as a taxi driver since 2004 in Baganuur, a province of Mongolia. The town where she lives is a very small and most of the residents know each other. This works to her advantage as her clients find her to be very flexible about payment, and she has built up a good reputation this way. For instance, if someone has no money for cab, she says that "You can pay tomorrow." She also doesn't smoke; therefore, her cab is cleaner than other cabs. One year ago she sold her old car which was made in Korea and bought a second-hand but better Nissan "Sunny" Japanese car. Ichinhorloo is one of Kiva partner XacBank's best clients and repeat borrowers. She keeps working hard for her children's future. Her dream is for her two children to finish their high school successfully and graduate from university. She wants a Kiva loan to buy car tires and fuel injector for her car.

loans.use: To buy car tires and fuel injector

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en: Kheoun L. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers and, combined, they typically make about USD $5 a day. This couple has three children, one of whom is in school and the other two are too young to attend. To have another source of income to help raise her standard of living, Kheoun L. is asking for a loan to raise cows.

loans.use: To raise cows

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda Fuscabio is a farmer. She grows rice and helps her husband manage their small farm to support their entire family’s needs. She has eight children and all of them help much to increase the yield. Aside from rice, she also owns a small shop where she buys and sells junk/scrap materials. She earns almost the same income from both her businesses. She wants to increase her farm size and needs a loan of PHP 4,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy four bags of urea fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will definitely give her better yield.

CEVI helps farmers sustain their livelihood. Now, Erlinda has access to CEVI’s credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase four bags of urea fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni has been a clothes (khanga and dira) seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She belongs to the Jambo nia loan group (group code 2044). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Each day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes (dira and khanga) for her business. She also wants to open a shop. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mgeni is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 11 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business and open a shop.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester P. is a 50 year old woman from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter with one child who just graduated in a computer course. Due to financial insufficiency she decided to engage in snack vending to be of assistance in finances, specifically in their basic daily needs and school allowances.

Mrs. P. is in her 7th loan cycle, requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00. Her loan is intended for additional capital for snack vending. Her regular customers are her friends, neighbors, and relatives.

She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs, and having money for their old age.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her snack vending business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Сатторова Гульбахор - женщина 47-ми лет, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Продаёт метражные ткани на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района. Два раза в неделю Гулбахор вместе с дочкой ездит в город Истаравшан за товаром.  На полученный кредит она хочет расширить свой ассортимент за счет летних тканей, и тем самым поднять свой товарооборот. Её товары пользуются большим спросом среди покупателей,  так как она привозит качественные и красочные ткани по доступным  для населения  ценам. Гульбахор рада сотрудничеству с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
Gulbahor S. is 47 years old, married and has three children. She sells textiles at a clothing market of the Spitamen district. Together with her daughter, Gulbahor travels to the city Istaravshan twice per week for her goods. She wants to use this loan to expand her goods assortment by adding summer fabrics and, thus, increasing her goods turnover. Gulbahor’s textiles are in high demand among customers because she sells quality and colorful fabrics at affordable prices. Gulbahor is happy to be collaborating with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto T. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de San Pedro de ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Ernesto es empleado jubilado del sector comercial. 
Su vivienda se encuentra deteriorada por la antigüedad de la construcción y requiere reparaciones principalmente en las paredes interiores.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los muros interiores de su vivienda.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ernesto T. lives in his own house in the San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. Ernesto is a retired worker from the commercial sector. His home is in poor conditions due to the old construction and requires repairs mainly in the interior walls. The loan that he is requesting to refurbish the interior walls of his home. This is the third time that he has requested a loan, and because he has favorably met the financial analysis criteria he has been approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay to refurbish the interior walls of his home.

loans.name: Tanith

texts.es:
La señora Tanith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo, 01 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando.

Emprendió su negocio de Venta de Frutas, con un capital de S/. 50.00. Nos cuenta que no le fue fácil implementar su negocio, esta ubicada en el Mercado Nº 02, un puesto que ocupo con mucho esfuerzo, ya que no le fue fácil obtenerlo, porque ahí es un poco peleado, hoy en día esta muy contenta por lo logrado.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donde sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad y amigos que ya conocen el trabajo que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, lo invertirá comprando bananas, mandarinas, naranjas y racimos de plátanos.

Tanith,  a aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones,  tanto en lo personal como en su negocio. Nos manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Tanith belongs to the Mujeres para el Futuro II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is 26, and she has a dependent son who goes to school. She started her fruit selling business with 50 PEN. It was not easy to start her business, which is in the Market Number Two. It took a lot of effort, and it was not easy getting her hard-fought place in the market. Now she is very happy that she did it. She currently has the same business. Her main customers are community members and friends who know the work she does. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy bananas, mandarins, oranges, and bunches of bananas. Tanith has learned to make her own decisions in her personal life and in her business. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit to increase her products

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old, single, and a mother with one child who is in school. Alice is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She has been getting cow meat from the northern region of Ghana for five years now.

Sometimes she spends weeks in the northern region so that she can buy more meat to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling to buy only a little at a time. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of smoked meat

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Julia del Carmen M. Cáceres tiene la edad de 45 años. Ella es una mujer muy alegre, a pesar de las dificultades que ha atravesado siempre ha mantenido su espíritu de entusiasmo  y esto es lo le ha ayudado con su actividad económica  es su pequeña pulpería. Hace más de 11 años que tiene de dedicarse a este negocio. A Julia siempre le ha gustado su actividad económica ya que le gusta interactuar con la gente. Por lo que es una persona que le gusta el progreso. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en su pulpería y así comprar golosinas, galletas, pan, refrescos naturales y jugos. En un futuro desea ampliar su pequeña pulpería en una distribuidora que de abastecimiento a sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen M. Cáceres is 45. She is a very happy woman. In spite of the difficulties she has gone through, she has always maintained her enthusiastic spirit. This has helped her with her business, a small mini market. She has had the business for over 11 years. Julia has always liked this business because she likes to interact with people. She likes to make progress. That is why she is asking for a loan to invest in her mini market. She will buy candy, crackers, bread, natural soft drinks, and juice. In the future she wishes to expand her small market and become a distributor who supplies her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P. sells gari, sugar and groundnuts at Elmina, which she has done since 2007. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has received schooling through junior high school. Mary uses her income for the upkeep of her home. She will use this loan to purchase more food supplies to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save toward building a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies to resell

loans.name: Clémence

texts.fr: Clémence M. est une femme de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait du commerce d’arachide, de mil, d’oseille et de haricot. Ce prêt lui servira de développer son activité et les revenus générés à participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Commerce d'arachide, de mil, d'oseille et de haricot

loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus N. is 33 years old and married to Irene Mbete who is a businesslady in Changamwe. The couple has been blest with three children Angela, Michael and Flora who are all students. 

Cosmus runs a hotel in Changamwe that has been in operation for six years where he has been able to satisfy many customers many who are residents who work near his hotel.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and is now accessing his first borrowing. He plans to purchase different foodstuffs and to also do some renovations in his hotel in order to retain and even attract more customers.

Cosmus hopes to start selling cereals and also intends to start selling water in the area. By doing so he says he will be able to offer more service to the locals while maximizing on his income.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs and to do some renovations in his hotel.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera, 22 years old and the married mother of three children, all currently in school except for her youngest, started her dried and smoked fish business seven years ago at a community market in the town where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people purchase from her stand in the market due to her business ethics and manners, and the proceeds pay for her children's food, school costs and sometimes their medical bills. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of assorted fishes in order to improve her profits, thereby enabling her to better support her children's education and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes and dried fish.

loans.name: Savaandorj

texts.en:
Savaandorj A. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in the Arkhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three of his sons - ages 19, 15 and 13 - attend a local secondary school. A. currently operates a business making wooden products. He designs and produces many different styles and sizes of furniture that he sells throughout his community. 

A. started his business in 2002 with capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD) and has found success in his trade. Today, his business is well established in the local area, and his working capital exceeds 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1,750 USD). Regarding the future, A. says, "My main business goal is to continue to produce quality products for my customers." He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1,750 USD) loan to purchase more wood to make furniture.

loans.use: purchasing more wood to make furniture

loans.name: Samwuel

texts.en:
Samwuel is 46 years old and married with five children. He sells charcoal in the Mathare slums and employs one person. He's been in business for 13 years and has successfully completed several previous loans. He also runs a photography business and has his own studio. He is now requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy charcoal worth Kes. 40,000 and film and batteries for his photography studio.

In the future, Samuel hopes to set up a distribution centre for charcoal in the area and invest in a car to transport charcoal from the source. He would also like to own a home. He describes himself as persevering, hardworking, and goal-oriented and says that loans from Faulu have kept his business productive enough to feed his family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, film and batteries

loans.name: Salami

texts.en: Salami sells computer accessories. He also photocopies documents for his customers. The demand for his services is high in his community. He has been in this business for a long time. He is married with 4 children and he is 47 years old. He hopes to own a computer centre in the future. He is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase a photocopier and computer accessories. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier and computer accessories

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios D. is from the village of Caputol. She is 54 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Remedios owns and operates a fruit-vending business, selling a variety of fruits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Bisoboka Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en: Nusula N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working lady with a business of selling yellow bananas, commonly known as "bogoya", from Lugalambo. She has been selling these alongside the Lugazi-Jinja road for over 19 years. She says that she is also a farmer growing passion fruit, beans and maize, which she also sells. Nusula is married, with nine children all in school and five other dependants who she cares for. She needs a loan to be able to buy more yellow bananas for resale so that she can make money to educate her children and improve their general welfare.

loans.use: Buying more bogoya for resale

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mr. Cheng T., 50, has been operating various enterprises to earn a living. He is a local farmer and also a taxi driver. In addition, he also takes time to fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake for extra profit. His wife assists him in planting crops. 

From his businesses, he can generate around $7 each day, which he uses to feed his family. Cheng T. has four school-aged children. Due to the growing season coming, Cheng T. is looking for a loan as capital to buy fertilizers as well as rice and vegetable seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice and vegetable seeds, to grow

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Mr. Diep M., age 47, is married to Vanny, age 46. They are parents of four children who go to school. Diep M. works as a policeman for a ministry. His wife sells a few grocery items from their home. 

This family has been facing difficulties with transportation for a long time because they do not have a vehicle for traveling needs. Diep M. is happy to apply for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. With the money ($500), he will buy an old motorbike that he will use to commute to his workplace or anywhere else. 

Note: Mr. Diep M. was not available for a photograph, so his wife appears in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike.

loans.name: Olivia's Group

texts.en:
Olivia M. is 35 years old and from the village of Flores, Naguillan, Isabela. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Olivia M..
Olivia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetable products in the local community. Olivia is just starting this business.
In 2010, Olivia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nasuuti Women's Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Juliet (shown fourth from the left) is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a smart, strong and hardworking woman who manages two businesses – she is a tailor and also has a retail shop. Both businesses are close to each other and this enables her to manage them well. Juliet makes 150,000 UGX weekly profits from both businesses. As a result, she is able to take good care of her family as well as develop her businesses.
Juliet hopes to open a tailoring school where she will teach people her trade as well as taking on some students as her employees. She believes that this will enable her to continue to pay school fees for her children and her dependants. She is requesting a loan to help restock her shop and buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop and buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario Ramírez S.  tiene 38 años, es casada, y  tiene un hijo.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, trigo y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como gallinas, chanchos, cuyes y borregos  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria  le gusta lavar cocinar en los tiempos libres. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old. She is married and has a son. She lives on the edge of the town of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province. She is a part of the "Rural Window Group Enmanuel," which is an enclave located 45 minutes from Guaranda, the capital of the Bolivár province. There are a total of 17 members in this farming and agricultural community. They are indigenous people and speak Quechua. Maria farms in order to improve the economic status of her family. The crops that she mainly grows are corn, barley, wheat, and potatoes. She also raises livestock such as chickens, hogs, Guinea pigs, and sheep. She sells the livestock from her home, but she takes her harvests to the main marketplace in Guaranda every six months. The principle cultural activity is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Maria also likes to cook and do the washing in her spare time. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her farm work, particularly fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good income for her family. Her biggest challenges are the problems with the weather and the plant diseases that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Marcia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Marcia Guadalupe C. B., es trabajadora de  la escuela Marcos Dessys, es maestra de primaria y habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega.

La señora Marcia Guadalupe es casada con tres hijos y  todos dependen de ella y habitan en la misma casa , ella solicito el crédito para realizar mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Marcia Guadalupe C. B. lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood and is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys School. Marcia Guadalupe is married and has three dependent children who all live with her. She is requesting a loan to make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, wood, nails, and cement.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is forty-four years old and married with four children. She has been running a salon at Kawangware in Nairobi to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and has three employees. Her husband, who is employed, has given her much support in the business. She appreciates Faulu Kenya for the training they offered her because she acquired business-management skills. She has high hopes of expanding her business since she can access loans, and this will be her first loan. She dreams of opening outlets and improving her standard of living in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy hair chemicals and synthetic hair for use in her salon.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and synthetic hair for use in her salon

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: El Sr. Armando nacio en Padilla Tomina Chuquisaca Sucre Capital de Bolivia el 22 de enerode 1979. concubino( que viven como pareja pero no se casaron) con la Sra. Paulina,  ellos tienen 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Hace 20 años que el Señor compro su parcela en Santo Corazon de  5 hectareas. El señor actualmente esta sembrando maiz, yuca, papa, los productos que el cosecha lo vende en el mercado central de el torno. es una persona trabajadora y responsable su esposa y sus hijos le ayudan en la siembra y cosecha de sus productos, con el dinero del credito comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa.  el cliente esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo que le han brindado ademas que es su primer credito y se siente bastante contento. sus sueños del señor armando es que comprarse un camioncito	para poder trasladar sus productos a los diferentes mercados de la zona.
texts.en:
Armando was born in 1979 in Padilla Tomina Chuquisaca Sucre, capital of Bolivia. He lives with Paulina and they have four school-aged children. 20 years ago he bought a five hectare parcel of land in Santo Corazon. He currently raises corn, yucca, and potatoes, which he harvests and sells in the central marketplace in El Torno. He is a hard working and responsible person and his wife and children help with the planting and harvest. He will use the money from this loan to buy potato seed. He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given him. This is his first loan and he is very happy. He hopes to be able to buy a small truck with which to deliver his products to different markets within the zone.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Potato seed

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is a wife of M. S. and lives in the city of Borewala (famous for its shrines), in Pakistan. She is 41 years old and married, with four children: two daughters and two sons. Her elder daughter completed her education till 12th grade and then started teaching in a school for a monthly wage. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

Amina is a very caring lady. She takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores efficiently. She is always ready to help others. She is famous for her hospitality in her neighborhood. Ladies of the community come to her house to share their problems and to get good advice from her.

Her husband operates a medicine selling business. He completes the orders of medical shops and earns income. He has been in this profession for the last twenty years. Now he has developed a good image and built trust with his customers, and the result is that they give him the orders to get the quality items.

Amina is applying for the second time for a loan to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase more medicines and expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase medicines to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Alice T. nasceu no distrito de Namaacha na Fronteira da Swazilândia é viúva e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 9 aos 26 anos de idade, os três mais novos é que vão a escola. Vive na casa propria e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Alice após concluir o Ensino Primário é transferida para Sede do Distrito de Namaacha que dista 25km da localidade de Goba onde ela nasceu. Continua com os seus estudos e faz 7ª classe, fica gravida e passa a viver com seu marido que era um grande comerciante abandonando assim a escola. Anos depois o seu marido perde a vida por motivo de doênça e a vida fica dificil, então ela consegue aranjar um emprego na cidade capital Maputo como empregada doméstica e trabalha durante 2 anos onde recebia 2.300.00mt. 
Mas teve que abandonar pois vivia longe dos seus filhos e regressa novamente a Namaacha onde inicia seu próprio negócio de venda de pães e rebuçados no quintal da sua casa. 

Na tentativa de aumentar o volume do seu negócio aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo para reforçar a actividade da criaçao de pintos que já iniciara com os lucrus obtidos no emprestimo passado.Tem criado uma média de 2 caixas em sua casa gastando 15.000.00mt em cada fase tendo de lucro 6.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e ainda consegue poupar cerca de 1.000.00mt por mês.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Alice na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende usar para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação, o anterior empréstimo foi no valor de 10.000.00mt e foi usado para dar início de venda de rebuçados. 
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema pois ela conta também com receita de aluguer da sua casa cituada em Boane. Futuramente pretende pedir um novo empréstimo para construir o seu próprio estabelecimento de venda e deixar de vender somente no quintal da sua casa.
texts.en:
Alice T. was born in the district of Namaacha, close to the border with Swaziland. She is a widow and has 4 children who range in age from 9 to 26 years old. The three youngest children are in school. She lives in her own home and is not financially responsible for anyone except her children. After finishing her primary education, Alice was transferred to the district seat of Namaacha, which is 25 kilometers from the town of Goba where she was born. She continued with her studies and finished 7th grade. Then she got pregnant and went to live with her husband, who was an important businessman. This is why she left school. Years later, her husband died after an illness and life became difficult. It was then that she managed to get a job in the capital, Maputo, as a household servant. She held this job for 2 years, receiving a salary of 2300 meticais per month. She had to leave this job because she was living far from her children, and so she returned to Namaacha. There she began her own business selling bread and candy from the yard of her house. In an effort to increase the scope of her business, she has approached Hluvuku to ask for a loan to help her to raise baby chicks. She had already started with this enterprise using the profit she made after getting her previous loan. She has raised on average 2 cartons full during each cycle, costing 15,000 meticais and making a profit of 6000 meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some 1000 meticais each month. This is Alice’s 2nd loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, for the amount of 12000 Meticales. She plans to use the loan to increase the number of chicks she raises. Her previous loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticais, was used to start her sales of candy. Alice is confident that she will have no problems repaying this loan because she also has income from the rental of a house she owns in Boane. In the future she would like to get another loan to build her own store, so that she no longer has to sell from her own yard.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baby chicks for raising

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married with a 7-year-old son, Vladislav. She is an enterprising venture owner from Novomoskovsk who sells sportswear, footwear and jeans in the central city market. Yana has been in this trade for three years. She has 90,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Monthly income is about 30,000 Grivnyas. 

Yana is very communicative. She has many acquaintances in the market. Her enterprising and adventurous spirit has helped her start this venture and stimulate its growth. Yana is an active hard-worker who usually works long hours. All her customers give her positive references. We believe her constant desire to see her business expand and grow is her best motivation which guarantees prompt loan repayment. She is seeking a loan of 8,200 Grivnyas.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Yvonne Giselle

texts.en:
Yvonne Giselle S., photographed with her husband, is from the town of Trinidad. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Yvonne is involved in fishing. Her husband operates their fishing boat, catching assorted fish, while she sells all of his catch at the market. She also dries fish sometimes that she also sells to the market. She has been engaged in fishing for more than six years now. One of her wishes in life is to have all her children finish college and be professionals, someday.

Yvonne Giselle joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Yvonne Giselle is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Yvonne Giselle from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 51 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 10 and 30. Two of the children are currently attending school. She has been farming for over 10 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, tea, bananas, vegetables, milk and nappier grass which she sells locally. Her primary challenges have been lack of enough animal feed, poor weather patterns and poor prices for her commodities.

Agnes has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.50,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to educate her children and expand her business. She will also be able to provide enough food for her family.

In  the future, Agnes would like to expand her dairy farming by acquiring 5 more dairy cows. She appeals for more help from Juhudi and appreciates the support rendered so far.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La Sra. Karina V. F. tiene 34 años, se encuentra casada y su esposo se dedica a la construcción, ambos esposos tienen 2 hijos pequeños. Ellos viven por la zona de Puntiti Sud, ubicado en la localidad de Sacaba, en la periferie de la ciudad.

La Sra. Karina se dedica al servicio de limpieza a domicilio, lleva el sustento diario a su hogar realizando trabajos de limpieza, lavando ropa, oficinas condominios, y todo aquel servicio de limpieza que ella pueda desempeñarlo. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción de obras, pequeñas y todas aquellas que requieran de sus servicios. Ambos personas son muy dedicados a su trabajo, pues cuentan con 2 pequeños hijos los cuales aun están estudiando primaria. Las condiciones de vida que ellos tienen son muy precarias, si bien cuentan ya con un pequeño lote (terreno) no tienen murallas ni las condiciones para poderlo habitar, pues soportan las inclemencias de los malos tiempos y lluvias. Karina prepara todos los días todo el alimento necesario para sus hijos y esposo, y se va caminando en los lugares donde realiza su trabajo. La zona donde vive con su familia, es una zona no muy segura para sus hijos. 

La señora Karina se apersono solicitando un crédito, para poder comprar los materiales necesarios para poder construir una muralla en su casa y tener más seguridad, y sobre todo tranquilidad para ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Karina V. F. is 34 years old and married. Her husband works in construction. They have two small children. They live in the Puntiti Sud area, which is in Sacaba on the outskirts of the city. Karina cleans houses. She brings home the daily bread by cleaning, washing clothes, cleaning condominium offices, and all of the cleaning services that she can do. Her husband does construction work. He does small jobs, and he does all the jobs that need his services. Both of them are very devoted to their work. They have two small children who are still in elementary school. Their living conditions are very precarious. They have a small piece of land. It does not have walls, nor is it in condition for them to be able to live there. They endure inclement weather and the rains. Everyday Karina prepares all of the food for her children and her husband. He walks to the places where he works. The area where the family lives is not a very safe place for their children. Karina requested a loan to be able to buy the materials needed to be able to build a wall in her house. That way they will be safer, and above all, she and her family will have peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Litara

texts.en:
Litara W. is 49 and married with two children.  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Litara has 5 years of experience in this business.  Litara needs a loan of WST 2400 to maintain her vehicle.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Litara joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Litara's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to maintain vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock her business.

loans.name: César Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Agustín F. Zárate vive en San Roque González de Santacruz, tiene 37 años y se dedica al comercio con una antigüedad de 5 años.
El señor Cesar Agustín F. es casado con 3 hijos, vive actualmente con su cónyuge quien  también firma como codeudora.
Ambos se dedican a la venta de ropas, zapatos y calzados deportivos; cuentan con casa propia y poseen su negocio en la misma.
El crédito se destinará a adquisición de mercaderías al por mayor como calzados,ropas como vestidos, blusas, shorts, para así obtener un mayor ingreso y mayor ganancia con las ventas.
Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado ya que será de gran utilidad para el progreso de su negocio con miras al futuro.
texts.en:
Cesar Agustín F. Zárate lives in San Roque González de Santacruz. He is 37 and has 5 years of experience in business. Cesar Agustín F. is married with 3 children. He currently lives with his partner who is also signing as a co-debtor. Together they sell clothing, shoes and sporting shoes; they have their own home and have their business in it. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise wholesale, such as shoes, and clothing, such as dresses, blouses and shorts in order to obtain a better income and better profits with their sales. He thanks Fundacion Paraguaya for this loan, since it will be very useful for the progress of his business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of seasonal clothing for the beginning of spring, and sports shoes and dress shoes for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth Nana Ama

texts.en: Elizabeth Nana Ama A. K. operates a food joint at Elmina. Elizabeth has no educational background.  She is married and been in this food business for five years. She helps her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to put up a better place where she can sell.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en: Jenty R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions. She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. Jenty is 47 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 7 children and only 1 of her children goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man and has five children who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He makes his living as an experienced driver; he has been working with his van taxi for over 20 years. His main route is between his town and its surrounding areas. And he also takes private transportation requests. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to perform much needed maintenance on his van taxi, including changing the tires and repairing the engine. His business income is vital to support the heavy expenses of his big family.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his van taxi, including changing the tires and repairing the engine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 yrs old. She is married and the mother of four, aged between 6 and 23 years, all attending school. She has been practising mixed farming  for the last ten years.  She sells vegetables, maize, beans and tomatoes in the local market. She has two casual employees.

She has requested this loan of Kshs. 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her tomato farming and cereal produces. This will earn her income to support her family.  In five years she hopes to have at least four dairy cows for milk production.

Her two main challenges are lack of a ready market for the products and poor the transport network.

loans.use: Expand tomato farming & cereal products

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Duch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Kampong Luong village in Takeo province, 10 people make up a village bank loan. They have selected Mrs. Srey D. as village bank president and will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in which it can improve their families' living conditions.   

Mrs. Srey D. and her husband, Mr. Saren Sok, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land in which to grow rice to sell to support their family. They also sell mangoes that they grow. She has a problem because her in her field, it is time to grow but she does not have money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. Srey D. is applying for a loan to do farming this current year.

She is a mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita N. is from the village of Canibungan Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years-old. Carmelita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Carmelita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 21st loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La Sra. Sofía se dedica a la elaboración de prendas originarias para flete o alquiler para danzas, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven de este modo genera ingresos para ayudar a su familia y también para sus estudios su domicilio se encuentra en una zona muy alejada en Quillacollo Zona Saja Pampa cuenta con una maquina industrial de costura una Over lock, vive en casa de sus padres que no cuentan con recursos para hacerle estudiar por esta razón ella trabaja, en esta temporada no existe mucha demanda de sus artículos pero ella quiere abastecerse de materia prima comprando telas e hilos con el dinero del crédito para cuando llegue la época alta y ya cuente con productos elaborados, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Mrs. Sofía makes traditional clothing articles on order or to rent for dances. She has done this work since she was very young and this is how she generates income to help her family, and also for her studies. Her home is in a very remote zone in Quillacollo Zona Saja Pampa. She has an Over lock industrial sewing machine. She lives in her parents' home, and they do not have the resources to let her study. For this reason, she works. At the moment there is not a great demand for her clothing, but she wants to stock up on materials, buying fabric and threads with the money from this loan so that when the season of high demand comes she will already have products made. She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of fabric and thread for making uniforms for the beginning of classes

loans.name: Turana

texts.ru:
Turana I. 24 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Turana yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjara i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Turana zokonchila universitet i teper uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet uchitelnicey. Turana ochen lubit svoyu robotu i detey, lubit ix uchit obyasnyat im vse. 
Turana seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit knigi i testi kotoriye stoyat ochen doroqo, i mnoqiye deti ne imeyut vozmojnosti ix pokupat.
texts.en:
Turana I. is 24 years old. She is single, without children. Turana is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from Kalbajar now living in the Absheron Region together with her family. Turana has graduated fromt eh university and  it is now two years since she has been working as a school teacher. Turana really loves her work. She loves children and enjoys teaching them and explaining things to them. 

At present Turana needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase books and tests, which are very expensive and unaffordable for many children.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary books and tests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Eustequia

texts.en:
Eustequia is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  food vending (native delicacies) and ready to wear clothes/pants. Her husband Ereneo, who is 47 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 11 and 19 years old. Eustequia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eustequia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,300, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to buy ingredients for her native delicacies so that she can continue to save up for future education and improvement of business. Eustequia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her native delicacies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business and buy important business items

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: For the past 5 years, Elchin A. has put much effort into his agricultural activities. Despite the difficult economic situation that he has gone through, he has managed to support his family and provide his three daughters with everything they need. To develop his business, Elchin  applied for a loan from AqroInvest Credit Unions which he will use for  technical assistance for his crops. He will invest his loan to grow his crops, later raise his harvest, and survive along with his family. With your help, Elchin will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a mother to 7 children. She is 41 years old and married. Her oldest child is 18 years old.

Shirley is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice that she sells to the market. Shirley also makes chorizo that she sells to the people in her community. Shirley works hard to make ends meet.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan Q., a 60-year-old proactive woman, has been helping her family by selling all types of blankets and bedroom covers for 11 years now. 

Hanan applied for this loan in order to add more variety to her products by including clothes, and she want to have her own retail store in the future so she can be able to display her products more easily.

loans.use: To add more variety to her product line by including clothes.

loans.name: Salam

texts.ar: سلام عمرها 43 سنة وهي عزباء تعمل في محل ميني ماركت لها تاريخ من العمل جيد 10 سنوات تعتمد على نفسها وتريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد تسعى الى تطوير العمل وزيادة المدخول وخاصة انها تعاني من منافسة في محيطها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتقوية المحل لها زبائن من جيرانها والسواح تسعى الى تطور عملها هي امراة محبة للحياة تعمل منذ صغرها وهي تساعد اهلها في تحسين وضعهم الامادي وتأمين الادوية اللازمة تسعى الى ضم العائلة والالتزام بهم ومساعدتهم
texts.en: Salam is 43 years old and unmarried. She works in a mini-mart, has done so for ten years, and has a good history in her work. She is self-reliant and wants to secure a good future for herself. She is trying to develop her business and increase her income, especially in light of the fact that she is having difficulties with the competition in her community. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods to improve her store. She has customers from among her neighbors as well as from among tourists, and she strives to improve her business. She is a woman who loves life and who has worked ever since she was young, and she is currently helping her family improve their material situation as well as obtain their needed medicines. She strives to help support her family and bring them together as she is very committed to her family.

loans.use: buy new goods for her mini-mart.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: El señor Elvis se dedica a la cría de ganado y producción de leche. El crédito lo requiere para comprar 2 vacas lecheras para producir mayor cantidad de leche, venderla y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma esta ubicada en la localidad de Tihuanacu en el departamento de La Paz;  es soltero y no tiene  hijos. Elvis es nuestro cliente desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Elvis raises livestock and produces milk.  He needs a loan to purchase 2 dairy cows so that he can produce a greater quantity of milk to sell, which will increase his income.  He lives in his parent's house, located in Tihuanacu in the department of La Paz.  He is single and has no children.  Elvis has been our client since 2008.

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows to increase his production of milk

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is 37 years old and married with three children.  He runs a boutique to earn a living.  He started the business four years ago.  He has sustained his business because he learned how to manage his business by keeping business records. He thanks Faulu Kenya for training him on business record keeping.  He hopes that someday he will build an apartment.  He needs 50,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina es socia del banco comunal Las Gemas, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Durante los tres años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha podido poner su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral y cerveza, su negocio está ubicado en un ambiente de su propia casa, su esposo le ayuda con la atención a los clientes cuando se encuentra en casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cajas de gaseosas, 3 paquetes de agua mineral y 20 cajas de cervezas. 
Su trabajo empieza por las tardes hasta las noche según cuantos clientes tenga, necesariamente tiene que desvelarse para poder tener mayor ganancia, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que necesitaba para poder trabajar y sentirse útil en la vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the 'Las Gemas' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 38 years old, married, and has one child.

During the three years that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Josefina has been able to establish her business selling soda, mineral water and beer.  Her business is located in her own home.  Her husband helps her to serve her customers when he is at home.

Josefina will use this new loan for 2,300 Peruvian soles to buy 10 crates of soda, 3 packets of mineral water and 20 crates of beer.  Josefina starts work in the afternoon and works until night-time, according to how many customers she has.  She has to stay awake late in order to be able to make more profits.

Josefina has a great desire to continue working and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity that she needed to be able to work and feel useful in life.

loans.use: to buy soda, mineral water and beer

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor de 35 años de edad, casado con Marcelina de 33 años, con quien lleva una relación de 16 años juntos y fruto de este amor tienen 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Cuando Nicanor se inició en la actividad agrícola, se dedicó a cultivar y comercializar café, pero con al inicio no le daba las rentas que esperaba, pero aún así continua esforzándose. Hoy tiene una buena cantidad de café que es expendido a sus asiduos clientes de manera oportuna y eficaz, por el cual se siente muy contento por lo que viene atravesando; incluso sus ventas aumentaron paulatinamente con respecto a otros tiempos. Por lo general trabaja con su esposa, y juntos laboran de manera colectiva, pero en  temporada de cultivo y cosecha, tiene que contratar peones para este trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tal espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda desarrollar su negocio. Con los 2.000 mil nuevos soles desea comprar  una nueva parcela agrícola.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 35 years old and married to Marcelina, age 33. They have been together for 16 years and have two children. They live in their own home in the District of Pichari. When Nicanor started farming, he decided to grow and sell coffee. At first, he did not generate the level of income that he had hoped but he decided to continue nonetheless. Today he grows a good amount of coffee that he is able to distribute to his customers in a timely and efficient manner. He is very pleased that he was able to persevere because his sales have gradually increased when compared to other seasons. Nicanor and his wife usually work together, but he must hire workers during the planting and harvesting seasons because the additional effort is needed to complete tasks.

This will be his first loan with MFP. Nicanor hopes to receive everyone’s support so that he can develop his business. This loan of 2000 PEN will be used to buy a new plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Mwanamusi

texts.en:
Mwanamusi is a married woman with two children; one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly costs are food and medical expenses.

For the past year she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During holiday season and weddings, she experiences a large number of customers. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers demands.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business and sacks of green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business and sacks of green vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 29 years old and married with 4 children, aged 9 to 3 years old, living in a permanent residential house in Karuguuza, Uganda. For 3 years, John has been operating a retail shop business, and from it he has been able to buy land. He faces the challenge of the high rate of inflation, but he hopes to expand his business to a wholesale status. John intends to use the loan to buy sugar, kerosene and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, kerosene and soap for resale.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, tiene muchos años de estar vendiendo la semilla de marañón, es un negocio de familia y hasta el momento le ha proveído lo necesario para su hogar.
Ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de semillas, que le ayuden para crecer en la mercadería y poder vender por un buen tiempo este producto, pues sus ingresos dependen únicamente de él.
Ella quiere crecer en el mercado, asistir a otros lugares a vender para conocer nuevos cliente y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Maria sells cashew nuts. She lives with her three children and her husband. She has been selling cashew nuts for many years in this family business, which up to now has provided sufficiently for household expenses. She will use her loan to buy nuts, which will help her to increase the quantity of her merchandise and enable her to sell the nuts for a while, since her income depends solely upon them. She wants to expand in the marketplace and go to other localities where she can sell her product, thereby attracting new customers and increasing her earnings.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts.

loans.name: Tehmina's Group

texts.en:
Tehmina is a working lady and supports her husband financially by doing clothes stitching for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. 

She is the mother of four children. All of them are studying in a local school except the youngest one who is only 5 years old and hasn’t started his education yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is an electrician by trade. He operates his shop in the market from where he offers electrical item repair services to his customers. He is very good in his work and has kept good knowledge of his work. With the loan, he will buy electrical repair tools that will allow him to offer better quality repairing services to his customers. Tehmina hopes that an investment will bring more profits to him and will improve the living standard of his family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Tehmina.

loans.use: To buy electrical item repair tools.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 49 years old, married and has three children. Her business is well-organized and well known. She sells drinks such as local drinks and soft drinks.
