Macia C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God We Trust. She is 37 years old, single and has three children who range from 6 to 14 years old.  She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to a lack of financial support. 

For 8 years, she has been selling sugar, flour, palm oil and rice in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 26,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more sugar, flour, palm oil and rice. She describes herself as a devoted mother.

Her goal is to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, palm oil and rice.

loans.name: Maria Amable

texts.es:
María de 29 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene un hijo de 11 años. 

Ella comenzó la tienda hace 6 años atrás para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares, comenzó a vender legumbres y vegetales poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su tienda mas surtida hasta que con sus ahorros compro vitrinas, y pudo vender enlatados. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres y arroz para su tienda, en el futuro quiere que su tienda sea una de las mas reconocidas en Guayaquil.
texts.en:
María, 29, has a grocery store in Paraíso de Guayaquil, a hilly periurban area with unpaved streets. She has an 11-year-old son. She opened her store 6 years ago in order to help with family expenses. She started out selling a few vegetables and gradually her efforts led to a better stocked store. She used savings to buy display cases and was able to sell canned goods. This good decision on her part has led to her being open daily from 8am until 10pm. She will use the funds to buy vegetables and rice for her store. In the future she’d like her store to be one of the better-known ones in Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Eudalia

texts.es:
La señora Eudalia M. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de ella y su hija quien actual mente esta estudiando. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así tendrá más mercancía que vender. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Eudalia M. has for already more than two years been selling second-hand clothing. This business is the source of income for her and her daughter who is currently studying. Her business needs a greater variety of stock but at the moment she does not have the money needed for this investment. This is why she is asking for a loan so that she will have more stock to sell. She plans to pay the loan from part of the business profits.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock for the business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. is from the village of Tu-od, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Lucia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she raises chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell in the future. 

Lucia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; ella tiene 43  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como habas, maíz, moraya, frijoles y trigo y su esposo trabaja como maestro de construcción y juntos sacan adelante a sus pequeños hijos, la socia quiere tener un lugar donde vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos  al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clotilde, 43, is married and has four children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with the sale of dry grains like lima beans, corn, dehydrated potato, beans and wheat. Her husband is a master builder and together they support their young children. She would like to have a place to sell the vegetables. She is asking for funds to buy grains at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry grains at wholesale.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Augusto asume el cargo D. presidente,D. la alcancia comunal “PRIMAVERA” conformada por  13 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 5 años.
Augusto tiene 53 años, casado, y tiene 2 hijos. DesD. hace 20 años se dedica a la venta D. pescado en el terminal pesquero, se inicio en este negocio porque inicialmente era ayudante D. una persona que vendía pescado, luego decidió independizarse, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado la construcción D. su vivienda, con el ingreso D. su negocio cubre los gastos D. alimentos y pago D. servicios, nos cuenta que su gran meta es ampliar mas su negocio.
El reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra D. mercadería, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
The “Primavera” (Springtime) Communal Bank is comprised of 13 enthusiastic and enterprising members.  They work at  different activities like production, commerce, and service.  They have been working with EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad for five years.

Augosto is the president.  He is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  He has been selling fish at the fishing terminal for 20 years.  He started this business because he used to be a helper to a person who sold fish, and Agosto decided to become independent.  Through his work efforts he has managed to build his house.  The income from his business covers the food expenses and pays for services.  He tells us that his big goal is to expand his business more.

The loan he is requesting is to buy merchandise.

All of the members are grateful for the support, and they pledge to make their payments on time.

loans.use: compra de mercadería

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, six and three years old.  She also supports two other dependents, and is paying for their education. In 2003, she established a business selling soft drinks and other beverages, soap and water. She began her business because she wanted to contribute to her family's income, and now works seven days a week, 11 hours a day. She has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell to her customers, and hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay for her children's schooling and open a savings account. She expresses her sincerest thanks to Kiva lenders who choose to support her by funding this loan.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to sell to her customers

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd D., age 39, operates a retail food business. She cooks the food in the family’s "ger" (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in which the family lives) and delivers it all over town to markets and office buildings. She started her business earlier this year based on her experience working in a cafe as an assistant worker. She tells us, "All I want is to provide a good education for my three children." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy food supplies for her business and to pay her children's tuition fees of 250,000 MNT.
 
Altansuvd lives with her husband and three children, ages 12, 17, and 20, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. During the winter months, she and her family live in a "ger," and during the summer months, they live in a government house. Her husband works as a road repairer.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her business and to pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 40 years old, married, and father of four, aged between 6 and 16 years, with three attending school.  He has been a mixed farmer for fifteen years.  He sells millet, maize, beans, tea, coffee and milk locally.

He has requested this loan of Kshs. 45,000 to buy a dairy cow. Proceeds from this loan will be used to feed the family. In five years he hopes to start a retail shop in Kenyenya market and have five good dairy cows.

The challenge he faces is lack of enough capital to enable him to run his farming business.  He is however thankful to Juhudi for the loan.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Kurmanbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kurmanbubu A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a small town in Isykul region. Kurmanbubu is 56 and married. She has four sons and a daughter. All of them are married and live separately with their families. The sons work in construction and the daughter works at the airport. Twenty years ago, with the initial investment of 3,000 soms, Kurmanbubu started to take orders and sew Kyrgyz national blankets, cloth and dressmaking supplies. In this way, she earns 10,000 soms per month. Kurmanbubu applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase wool and paint for sewing. In the future, she wants to expand her business and start building a house for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase paint and wool

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren D. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment Tuv province in central Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school. Her husband operates an international cargo service between Korea and Mongolia. Myagmarsuren used to work as a programmer in the health agency between 2000-2006 after graduating from agriculture university in 1998. In 2009, she and her husband both went to Korea to work there in order to make more money. After returning to Mongolia in 2010, her savings earnings have enabled her to purchase an apartment and a new car for her family. She currently operates a clothes and cellphone trading business in her town. She started her clothing business in August, 2010 by selling a variety of clothing items and cellphones and its parts in the local trade center. Myagmarsuren plans to expand her business by offering computer related services to her customers. In order to operate this business, she needs to purchase and place a computer, camera and printer next to her stall at the local market. For the future, she hopes to continue to grow her business and open her own trade center with her business profits. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase computer, canon and printer in order to start providing new services.

loans.use: To purchase a computer, a camera and printer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 46 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de menestras como lentejas, frejoles entre otros, la socia luego lo distribuye a sus clientes de forma ambulatoria y personas que también le solicitan a la vez también tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche siendo esta la forma de sacar a su familia adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the Chikon Community Bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Victoria. She is 46, married and has 3 children. She buys and sells mixed vegetables such as lentils and beans, among others. She later distributes to her customers on foot. She also has a grocery store business where she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar and milk. This is how she gets her family ahead. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of products for her businesses. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan for the purchase of products for her businesses.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Bless” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu B.. Isatu is thirty-six years old.  She was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  Currently, she resides in Makeni city with her husband and three children. Her husband is a soldier.  Two of her children are attending primary school and the youngest is not yet of school-going age. 

For the past three years, Isatu has been selling palm oil in gallons and pints. With her share of this loan, she will buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys palm oil at wholesale

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, es propietaria de una librería en el centro mismo de la ciudad, es viuda y tiene dos hijas mayores que ya no viven con ella y son profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para compra de útiles escolares ya que se aproximan las clases y debe comprar este mes; y si realiza la compra al por mayor consigue mejores descuentos y aumenta su margen de ganancia.
La cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2005 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito.
texts.en:
Estela lives in the city of Carapeguá.  She is the proprietor of a bookstore in the center of the city.  She is a widow, and she has two adult daughters.  They do not live with her now; they are professionals.

She is requesting the loan to buy school supplies.  Class will start soon, and she needs to buy the supplies this month.  If she makes the purchase wholesale, she will get better discounts and increase her profit margin.

She has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2005, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth Y. is from the village of Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old. Bernadeth is married and has three children. To make a living, Bernadeth owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Bernadeth has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bernadeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Bernadeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam J. is a 55-year-old lady. She is married to Washington and they are both farmers. Miriam practices poultry farming and has been in this business for the last year. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. The anticipated profits will be used to buy a cow. Miriam hopes to grow her business and eventually to own a large poultry farm.

loans.use: purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Doña Ofelia, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en San Jorge departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera, pero vive sola porque sus hijos están en sus propios hogares, ella se dedica a vender agua y jugos, este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años, aprendió por iniciativa propia, sus clientes son personas que llegan al pueblo y amistades que circulan por la zona, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas para preparar los jugos y también agua en bolsas para vender, esto contribuirá a mantener el negocio y a contar con lo suficiente en productos para la elaboración de jugos, obteniendo siempre ganancias que cubran los gastos diarios de doña Ofelia.
Su objetivo es mantenerse y continuar con el negocio, para un día poder ahorrar lo suficiente para tener su terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
43 year-old Ofelia lives in San Jorge, in San Miguel department.  She is a single mother but lives alone because her children all live in their own homes.  Ofelia's business is selling water and juice.  She started her business, which she learned through her own initiative, 10 years ago.  Her customers are people who come to the village and friends who are in the area.  She works every day from 7.00am to 4.00pm.

Ofelia is requesting a loan to buy fruit which she will use to prepare her juices.  She will also buy bags of water to sell.  This will help her to keep her business running and ensure she has enough products to make her juices, making enough profits to cover her daily expenses.

Ofelia's goal is to support herself and keep going in her business so that one day she will have saved up enough to buy a plot of land and build her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make juice and also bags of water to sell

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with six children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a hotel business for three years, which she started with the capital of 800,000 UGX and now she has 1,500,000 UGX as working capital. Her hardship is high labor turnover and her vision is running a big hotel and educating her children. Hanifa needs the credit facility to buy furniture and a television set.

loans.use: to buy furniture and television set

loans.name: Mujeres Activas De Candia Loma Group

texts.es:
Dicho comité es de la compañía Candia Loma de la ciudad de Caacupe, que dista a aproximadamente 10 km de la oficina. Está compuesto por 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas.
La presidenta, la Sra. Petrona G. vive con su marido e hijos, posee una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, también gracias a el programa de microfranquicias de la Fundacion Paraguaya pudo acceder al kit de anteojos sin receta para la reventa y así generar más ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
Todas ellas están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya porque gracias al crédito que percibieron en etapas anteriores y a las constantes capacitaciones pueden generar sus propios ingresos y así ayudar y dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familiares.
La sra. Petrona desea poder adquirir este crédito para poder comprar ropas de invierno y vender a sus exigentes clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su canasta familiar.
texts.en:
This microfinance group is from the Candia Loma rural area of the city of Caacupe, which is approximately 10 km from the regional office. This group is comprised of 16 very hardworking and united women.

The group president, Ms. Petrona G., lives with her husband and children. She owns a small in-home general store. Also, thanks to Fundación Paraguaya's microfinance program, she has been able to obtain non-prescription reading glasses so that she can resell them, thus generating more income for the household expenses.

These women are all very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because thanks to their previous loans and to the constant training sessions, they are able to generate their own income and help provide a better quality of life for their families.

Ms. Petrona wishes to obtain this loan to purchase winter clothing to sell to her demanding customers, thus generating more money for the household.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for winter.

loans.name: Jessika

texts.en: Jessika is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 41 years old and married with one child who does not go to school. Jessika requested a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha nació en Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú), tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Isaac y su único hijo, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Chichubamba, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive,  han sido en la vida de Martha un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran flores como por ejemplo rosas, crisantemos, claveles y otras flores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Urubamba y Cusco. Martha solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es extender la siembra de flores, por ser una de sus plantas que mayor precio tiene en el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para abrir una maderera. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,200 nuevos soles, comprará semillas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Martha was born in Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 40 years old and she is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a house which she owns together with her partner Isaac and their only son. He is the motivation for all of their efforts. The green fields of the community of Chichubamba, located in Valle Sagrado de los Incas, is where Martha currently lives and in life it has been a most pleasant place for her to work. 

When she was very young her parents taught her this business and today she has her own fields where she works together with her partner. With a great deal of care they cultivate flowers, such as roses, chrysanthemums, carnations, and other flowers. what she most enjoys about her work is to harvest the fields because this is when she feels that her arduous work has been a great investment. She has been in the business for several years and she considers the most difficult part to be the transportation of the harvest to the collection centers in the cities of Urubamba and Cusco. Martha requests a loan to carry out one of her plans, which is to extend her flower plantation because her plants obtain the best price in the market. With time she hopes to save enough money to start a lumber yard. She has the obligation to make her payments on time and she is ready to do so if she wants to have another loan. She is thankful to the organization for granting her this loan. With the 1200 nuevos soles she will purchase seeds to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah is 30 years old, married, and the father of two.  He is able to provide for his family with the income from his electronics repair shop.  He repairs electronics such as TVs, radios and computers.  

He was previously employed and decided to go into business for himself because he needed to earn enough income to raise his family.  His desire is to expand his business.  

He has requested 30,000 KES to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TV kits.

loans.use: to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TV kits.

loans.name: Miguel Abdon

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Miguel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que llegan a su crecimiento ideal los ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o los vende en el mercado de Tambogrande, con los ingresos que obtenga solventará sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para tenerlos bien alimentados y así podrá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Miguel es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Miguel, 36, lives with his wife and children in his own house which has electricity only.  It is located in the rural area of the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is active in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

For several years Miguel has been raising and selling sheep and chickens.  His farmyard is situated behind his house.  He gives the animals balanced feed and natural grains and once they are fully developed he sells them to other people living in the area or he takes them to market in Tambogrande.  He uses the earnings to take care of family expenses.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his animals' development so he can offer them at a better price to customers.  This will enable him to pay back the loan and improve his family's lifestyle.  Miguel is a hard-working, responsible person who only wants the best for his children and for them to get an education.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 28 y 22 años de edad, los dos hijos aun son dependientes, pero el mayor le ayuda en el taller, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00am a 4:00pm. Este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia y su desventaja es que tiene épocas donde no se trabaja, ya que depende de la demanda de los clientes.
Actualmente necesita invertir en materiales para la elaboración de puertas y para la reparación de algunas herramientas, para elaborar puertas necesita lámina, hierro, las herramientas que utiliza son el compresor, el soldador y algunas llaves, este préstamo le permitirá una mayor rapidez para la entrega de los pedidos.
Para Luis su propósito es mantener en el taller todo lo necesario en materiales y herramientas en buen estado, pues estos son los medios para la ejecución de su trabajo, lo cual le permite tener los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, who has a metal-working workshop, lives with his wife and two sons who are 28 and 22 years old.  The two children are still dependent on him, but the eldest helps in the workshop.  His work schedule is from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. This business grew from his own initiative, and its disadvantage is that he has times where he doesn't work because it all depends on customer demand.

Currently, he needs to invest in materials for the manufacturing of doors and for the repair of some tools.  To manufacture the doors, he needs metal sheets and iron.  The tools used are the compressor, welder and some keys.  This loan will allow for faster delivery of orders.

For Luis, his intent is to keep all the necessary materials and tools in the shop in good condition, because these are the means to carry out his work, which in turn gives him income for his family.

loans.use: to buy iron and metal sheets, repair the welder and compressor.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 44-year-old woman and a mother of six children. She owns a grocery store. She wants a loan of $3,000 to have a better income by increasing the variety of items she sells as grocery stores are in big numbers in the area where she lives. Laila's store is on a big shopping street and has a good chance of increasing the number of customers. Laila came to FATEN to take out the needed loan.

Laila is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in the store.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in the store

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mr. Mey, 47, is the head of family, and lives in Dongkor Commune of Phnom Penh. Being responsible for a big family, he always decides how to earn more money in his family. He and his wife are interested in making a business as a chicken meat seller in one of the markets near the house. 

In helping the family in improvement, his wife works as hard as her husband everyday. As they both work harder, they can earn $6 per day. Additionally, they have four children, two of whom are working as sewing factory workers and another one is working as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a lot of chickens for selling.  He wishes to enlarge his current house, and to support his kids to finish their highest degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of chickens for selling

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis, es carpintero, vive con su familia, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la fabricación de muebles, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00am a 5:00pm, el trabajo lo aprendió cuando trabajaba como empleado de una carpintería.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo que cubra el gasto de madera y pintura, los cuales son materiales necesarios para la fabricación,  esta compra le ayudara para fortalecer el taller y poder realizar los trabajos.
La aspiración de él es que su negocio se vuelva más fuerte, contar con más clientela, apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Fredis is a carpenter and lives with his family. He has been making furniture for seven years. His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. He learned his trade when he worked as an employee at a carpentry shop.

At the moment, he needs a loan to cover the expenses of wood and paint, which are necessary materials for his projects. This purchase will help Fredis to strengthen his workshop and to be able to complete his work.

His dreams are for his business to become stronger, to have more customers, and to support his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood from different trees and various paint colors

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, single and lives with five family members who all work.

Bahaa has been an owner of a store since 2008, selling and making pastries, sweets and juices. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls and to make a showcase and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls and to make a showcase and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and has been engaged in the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables for five years.  She usually earns P700 within two market days which is not enough to provide for the needs of her family.  For additional income, she also entertains field work such as the harvesting of rice every harvesting season.

She wishes to improve her business by asking for a loan in the amount of P8,000 to buy bananas, eggplants, and string beans as additional goods to sell.  She hopes to gain more profit by prioritizing her buying and selling business so that she does not need to find another occupation.  Jocelyn wants to earn a higher income for the future of her three children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplants, and string beans as additional goods to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Letcia is 52 years old and married to a farmer named Rolando. They are helping each other in earning income to provide a better living. She has no children but  she is helping her siblings in sending their children to school.


Because of this, she is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. She wants to expand her business and overcome her poor living situation to help more people especially her nephews. She hopes this loan will be a big factor in helping her to achieve her desired living condition.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria Guadalupe tiene 24 años  su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 2 años en este negocio, ella tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo por lo que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable la mayoría de sus clientes saben que siempre busca la forma de complacerlos. Ella sale todo los días a ofrecer sus productos, es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de perfumes, tratamientos, ropa interior, cremas, ropa en general.
texts.en: Maria Guadalupe is 24 years old. Her activity is selling general merchandise. She has been in the business for more than 2 years. She is raising one child and is always looking for a way to get her family ahead. She has always been a very responsible woman and most of her customers know that she always tries to make them happy. She goes out every day to sell her products and that is why she is asking for this loan to buy perfume, treatment, underwear, creams, and general clothing.

loans.use: to buy perfume, treatments, underwear, creams, and general clothing.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en: Pelagia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fish-selling business in the Philippines for six years. She earns additional income from a variety store. Pelagia, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF, is requesting a new loan of  PHP 20,000 to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 27, is a humble villager in Siem Reap province. She has lived there since she was with her parents. She is a local farmer cultivating vegetable crops. She is married and has three children, all of them are single and living together with her and her husband. 

Through her farming business, Mao is able to earn an average of US$2 each day.  She is concerned that her low income cannot covers all the household expenses. She said that she needs her own farmland for growing rice crops. If she can grow rice herself, the whole family will not need to buy rice from the local market for daily food. 

Thus,  Mao has requested some funds from HKL and Kiva in the sum of $1,100 to buy farmland to grow rice. She hopes that this loan will help her family increase their income and get a comfortable living. For the future, she will send and support her three children to finish high school at minimum.

loans.use: buy farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya is a 31-year-old widow who lives with her son and parents in a local dormitory, located in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her son attends secondary school, while both of Enkhtuya’s parents work at a cashmere company. 

In 2009 Enkhtuya began a business selling jeans and trousers. She started with one million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Since then, her business has grown, and today she has approximately 3.7 million MNT in working capital. She is requesting a 1.5 million MNT loan to purchase additional jeans for the upcoming season. In the future, she wants to expand her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase jeans for upcoming season

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari sari (variety) store. Gloria is borrowing 22,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help to her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. Emelia is married and has a business selling curtains in the Philippines.

Emelia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of curtain to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of curtain to sell

loans.name: Gezardo

texts.en: Gezardo is a 42-year-old married man with one child. He is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. Aside from fishing, Gezardo also is a seaweed farmer. He works hard to support his family and save for his child's future education. Gezardo has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and seaweed farming materials. He also plans to register his wife to be an Avon dealer. Gezardo hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and seaweed farming materials.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Âgée de 47 ans, Awa est veuve qui est mère de 2 enfants résidant avec ses enfants dans la maison de son défunt époux à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Awa n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école,  s’est initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente de poissons frais et d’oignons en provenance de Dakar (République du Sénégal). 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre ans. Elle est actuellement à son huitième prêt  individuel dont les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce huitième prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 40 cartons de poissons frais et 20 sacs d’Oignons avant de les revendre en détail et en gros aux commerçantes de Sikasso.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 290 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Awa is a 47-year-old widow and mother of two, living with her children in the house that belonged to her now deceased husband in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Since Awa didn’t have the chance to progress far in school, she started this business over ten years ago, selling fresh fish and onions from Dakar (Republic of Senegal).
About four years ago she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, in the hope of better satisfying her growing customer base.  She is currently on her eighth individual loan cycle; all of her previous loans have been fully paid back.
This eighth loan will enable her to purchase 40 boxes of fresh fish and 20 bags of onions for retail sale and wholesale to the vendors in Sikasso.
She plans on using this loan to general a monthly profit of 290,000 CFA francs, which will mainly be used to increase her business capital, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and onions

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Marivic has a retail shop that sells firewood. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of firewood for resale.
Marivic is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Zeyla

texts.es:
La Sra Zeyla Espinales, se dedica junto con su esposo al trabajo en el campo, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales están estuadiando. Actualmente se dedican a la Agricultura y Ganaderia en la Comarca La Tigra.  Con el presente financiamiento pretende aumentar mas la produccion de Yuca ya que anteriormente ha obtenido buenos resultados.

La clienta junto con su familia pretende mejorar su calidad de vida por eso trabaja en equipo, desea que se le continue apoyando con financiamientos, agradece mucho la oportunidad que le dan de trabajar en la Inversion para la siembra de Yuca.

loans.use: Siembra de yuca

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía es una mujer de 38 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre seis y diecisiete años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de san José Chacayá.
Lucia para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, con este negocio lleva ella 10 años de realizarlo, este negocio se encuentra ubicando en una de las principales calles de su comunidad. Lucia con el afán de hacer crecer su negocio ha decidido invertir un poco más en su  negocio por esa razón solicita un préstamo para comprar productos como: arena blanca, arena de rio y piedrín.
Su gran sueño es que su negocio crezca y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra y venta de materiales de construcción como: arena blanca, arena de rio y piedrín.

loans.name: Djahid

texts.en:
Djahid has not his own shop. It is a problem for him. Komak Credit Union help to him to start his business. He borrowed the loans 2 time. For the first time he borrowed the loan of $400 to buy the lorry, 1 accumulator, 4 wheels. For the second time he borrowed $600 to paint and repair his lorry.
Now he needs $1200 to built his own shop in order to sell the building materials. He started this business 12 years ago.
Djahid is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region Seyidli village. He and his family settled in the building of Sevindj kindergarten in Khirdalan settlement. 
He is 39, married, has 3 children. 
Djahid is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To build the shop

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Mrs Ha is 52 years old. Her husband died a long time ago. She has 3 children, 18, 16, and 12. The older two have been working in Ho Chi Minh City but only enough money for living there. They don’t have money to support their family.

Mrs. Ha doesn’t have any land for cultivation. The only way she has to earn a living is to sell sweet soup in the market. She has to support her youngest child, 12 years old, to go to school. She wants to expand this business but she doesn’t have enough money so she needs a loan of $50.

loans.use: To sell sweet soup at the market

loans.name: Emmerencia

texts.en:
She was born in 1964. She is the only wife to Mr. Ngwa Michael and has five children. The most difficult trial she has faced is paying her children’s school fees and managing her house since her husband is not financially viable. The most painful things are that, there were times she could not afford just $10 to help her husband pay school fees for her child and when her mother was very sick and she had no money to take care of her treatment. 

She is a borrower in GHAPE. She believes that she will succeed because there are not many provision stores in her quarter nor women selling vegetable at the local square. Her community will be buying from her. Secondly, people will no longer have to pay taxis to the main market  for these small items. the profit will be used to expand her business and sponsor her children’s education. 
Her repayment will begin on the fourth month from the day her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Buying and selling of Vegetables and other provision

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
ANTONIA is 33 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her husband works in the fields, planting corn, and she works selling fruits and vegetables from door to door, and she also makes corn tostadas and sells them from her home to people in the community. She is part of the group Sausal 3, along with Ms. EMILIA GOMEZ MENDEZ and Ms. CARMELA SANCHEZ L. (both of whom work making and selling tostadas. With this loan, they will buy large quantities of corn and wholesale firewood, which they will distribute amongst themselves to increase their production and their sales.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

ANTONIA, tiene 33 años, casada tiene 7 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maíz, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de casa en casa y además prepara tostadas de maíz y las vende en su casa a las gentes de su comunidad. Forma parte del grupo Sausal 3 junto con doña EMILIA GOMEZ MENDEZ y doña CARMELA SANCHEZ L. ( ambas se dedican a hacer y vender tostadas ).Con El préstamo comprar quintales de maíz , leña al por mayor y repartirse para aumentar la producción y sus ventas.

loans.use: the sale of fruits, vegetables, and tostadas

loans.name: Rayda Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is the humble mother of a family with four children and she works hard to educate them. She also works in agriculture, along with her husband, to generate the family’s income. They work hard at farming peas, which they sell in the market. This year had been very good, and after much effort, they had achieved a big harvest. Her husband went the market to the sell the fruits of their labor. When he was returning, happy because he knew their sacrifice had been well compensated, a group of thieves robbed him of the money he was carrying.

A little while after this regrettable incident, Claudia began to have frequent pain in her legs with no discernable explanation. She decided to undergo a series of treatments, however her condition worsened and eventually she was unable to move her legs. Reality seems bleak for this family, however, they maintain the hope that they will be able to get ahead. To do this, they will need the help of all of us. The family’s desire is to continue planting peas and increase their capital to be able to invest more in seed. For this purpose, they are requesting a loan of $325.00, with which they would be able to improve their quality of life and the health of their beloved Claudia. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una humilde madre de familia que con mucho empeño educa a sus cuatro menores hijos y también se dedica a las actividades agrícolas junto a su esposo para generar el ingreso económico familiar se esfuerzan al máximo para producir, arvejas, que luego comercializarán llevándolas al mercado.Este año había sido muy provechoso y después de mucho esfuerzo habían logrado una gran cosecha, su esposo llevó al mercado para comercializar los frutos de su trabajo y cuando se disponía a retornar muy contento porque sabia que el sacrificio había sido bien recompensado una turba de desadaptados ladrones le quitaron el poco dinero que llevaba. Poco tiempo después de este penoso incidente Claudia empezó a tener dolores muy frecuentes en las piernas y la causa era incomprensible a razón de este hecho es que decide someterse a una serie de tratamientos clínicos sin embargo las dificultades se incrementaron y la dejaron sin poder mover las extremidades inferiores. La realidad parece muy sombría en esta familia, sin embargo mantienen la esperanza de poder salir adelante y para llevar a cabo sus propósitos requieren el apoyo de todos nosotros. El anhelo familiar es continuar con la siembra de arvejas y aumentar su capital para invertir una suma más alta en la compra de semillas por ello solicitan un préstamo de 325 dólares, con el cual podrán mejorar su calidad de vida y la salud de su querida Claudia .Hagamos que esta familia se siga manteniendo fuerte y unida.

loans.use: To buy an increased amount of seed for planting peas

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German Flores rents and lives with his wife and children in La Paz, the capital city of Bolivia. He has a car with which he works as a taxi driver and with this job he supports his family. His car needs some repair, and German is applying for a loan to buy auto parts so he can continue working as normal. His taxi job is the family´s one source of income.

German was previously approved two loans with IMPRO, all the scheduled payments paid back in full. Because of this good history, German is approved to receive this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

El señor German Flores vive en alquiler en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijos; tiene un auto que él mismo trabaja como taxi con cuyos ingresos mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar repuestos que el auto necesita y poder seguir trabajando con normalidad ya que es su única fuente de ingreso. Por su antecedente Histórico el puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Dos créditos anteriores fueron concedidos a German, los cuales fueron pagados completamente en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: To buy new parts for his taxi

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat H., 45, and her husband, Mr. Leang Lonh, 49, have been married since 1980. They live in a small village along National Road Two, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have six children, three sons and three daughters. Three of their children are studying in the local school, two are working in a garment factory, and the other one is helping them to farm. Yat and her husband are farmers. Currently, they are planting cucumbers and squash on a farm in the village. They started their farming business in 1986.

Yat is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to buy a water pumping machine and to dig a well for the farming business.

loans.use: To buy a water pumping machine and dig a well

loans.name: Kabowa 2(C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for nine months. Rose is 35 years old and married with three children.She runs a retail shop and needs new inventory to sell to her customers. Rose will use the money she earns from selling this inventory to start a new business raising poultry. Juliet and Sarah sell clothes. Jolic offers laundry services and wants to increase her income so she can buy a generator.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique owns a car he uses to work as a taxi driver. His home is in the area called Cristo Rey Ladera Oeste in La Paz. He has two children and his wife cannot work because when she gave birth to their youngest son, the doctors did not do carry out a proper procedure, leaving her handicapped. This is the second time Enrique has applied for a loan through Impro and his credit record qualifies him as a client type 1, which means he pays his loans on time.

Because his car is not in good shape and because of the requirements stipulated by the taxi company he works for, Enrique is in need of a better vehicle. He will use this loan to buy a car that complies with the requirements of his taxi company. Enrique's old car is about to be sold and the money he will receive from the sale will be put into purchasing the new car. Enrique's good credit record allows him to apply for this loan because he is an experienced driver.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Enrrique tiene una movilidad que trabaja como Radio Taxi. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Cristo Rey Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene dos hijos y su esposa no puede trabajar ya que cuando ella tuvo su ultimo hijo le realizaron una mala operación donde quedo minusválida. Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. Por el mal estado de su vehiculo y las exigencias de la empresa de Radio taxis que representa se ve obligado a cambiar de vehiculo por uno mas moderno. El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de un vehiculo acorde a las exigencias de la Empresa de Radio Taxis donde él trabaja. Su actual vehiculo está en proceso de ser vendido y el dinero que recibirá por dicha venta será usado para completar el valor total del nuevo taxi. Su antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Budumbuli West F A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rebecca K.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal. Rebecca is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 3 months to 12 years old and most of her children go to school. Each week, Rebecca makes approximately UGX 160000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Rebecca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Beat N., Justine N. and Afuwa W.. Beat N. has a business selling raw food and wants to add more stock. Justine N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more commodities. Afuwa W. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To increase charcoal purchases

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Terresa belongs to the communal bank Indo America, located at Jr TARAPACA, Number 899, in the district of Calleria and in the department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and has two children. Her husband is also a merchant. With the first loan that Teresa received from Manuel Ramos for 300 Soles she invested in her business of selling cellular devices.

Presently she depends on the income from this business. Everyday, she wakes up at 6 in the morning so that she can prepare breakfast for her two kids and her husband. From there she goes to her business and works until 8:00 pm

With the loan of 1,400 Soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will use the money to buy cell phones, chargers, cases, etc.

Teresa is very happy because with her hard-work and perseverance she is achieving all of her goals. As a mother and a woman she is source of pride for her family. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos has given to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Tarapacá No 899, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Teresa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de celulares.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de celulares, se levanta a las 6 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la venta de sus celulares hasta las 8 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: celulares, cargadores, envolturas para celulares, etc.

Teresa esta muy contenta, ya que con decisión y perseverancia esta logrando objetivos muy importantes como madre y como mujer es un orgullo para su familia, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cell phones to sell.

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria R. is a 27-year-old married mother who lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood and has 2 children ages 8 and 13. Her husband is a taxi cab driver who helps her with the household expenses. Mrs. R., who now has 8 years of experience in this business, sells cheese and curd for a living.

She started the business with her own money. She needs this loan in order to build an additional room in her house. She would like to one day open a general store that will help her grow both as a person and as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos niños de 8 y 13 años de edad. Su esposo es taxista y ayuda con los gasto del hogar, la venta de doña Maria es el queso y cuajada y tiene ocho años de experiencia.

Ella comenzó con dinero propio. El préstamo lo quiere para empezar ha construir un cuarto en su casa de habitación. Ella desea algún día poder llegar a poner una pulpería que le permita desarrollarse mejor como persona y como comerciante.

loans.use: Start construction of an additional room in her house

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim K. was born in 1968 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 6 children. Though he also works on a collective farm, his primary business is raising and selling livestock. Mr. K. has been in the livestock business for the last 30 years. He has 6 rams and one cow.

Mr. K. dreams of having the large flock so he is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months so he can buy a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Chhoet

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoet C. is a rice farmer and his wife cooks and sells Cambodian cakes. Their combined income is $3 per day. The couple has three children, one of whom is married. They all live in Toul Vihear Village, Kampong Cham Province.

Mr. C. wants to increase his rice crop and is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to use on his farm. The fertilizer will increase his crop yield, and thereby enable him to sell more crops in the market. The loan will enable him to increase his family income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on his farm

loans.name: Yoak

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoak Y. is a farmer in Sarekakeo Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Sem Seng, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. In addition, he also assists his wife on the farm when he has free time. They have eight children; one is employed in a garment factory; four are enrolled in school; three stay at home because they are too young to work or study.

The plantation field is far from an irrigation system and by purchasing a pump, Mrs. Yoak Y. can water her rice field and she can water a neighbor's field for additional income. Mrs. Yoak Y. had obtained a loan to buy palm juice collecting equipment and she has fully paid off that loan. She is now requesting another loan to purchase the water pump. Her husband also appears in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water rice fields for additional income

loans.name: Marina Florentina

texts.es:
Marina, de 45 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Asunción de Carhuaz”, junto a su esposo, el cual es chofer y radica en la ciudad de Lima por motivos de trabajo, busca hacer crecer a sus dos únicas hijas, que ambas sean profesionales y puedan enfrentar a la vida con éxito. Vive en malecón norte, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Marina es nombrada en el hospital de Carhuaz en el área de contabilidad. En las tardes se dedica a tejer los pedidos de los clientes desde hace 23 años en su casa donde vive con sus hijas.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, implementará su pequeño negocio comprando lanas al por mayor y otra parte será destinada para pagar la academia preuniversitaria de su hija.
texts.en:
Marina, 45 years old, is a member of the Virgen of Asunción de Carhuaz village bank with her husband. He is a taxi driver and lives in Lima for work purposes. She hopes to raise both of her daughters to be professionals who can be successful in life. She lives in the northern district of Independence, in the province of Huaraz, Ancash, Peru. Marina works in the Carhuaz hospital in the accounting department. For the past 23 years, she has spent the afternoons weaving the orders of her customers in the house where she lives with her daughters. With this $350 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will grow her business by purchasing wholesale wool, while the rest will go towards paying for her daughter’s pre-university tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale wool

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort S. sells plastics and rubber products at Kwabinajyan near Elmina. Comfort has received a Junior High education. She is a single parent and has 3 children. Comfort has been selling plastic products since 1998. She is responsible for paying pay her children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy an ice chest, plastic bowls, cooking utensils and other items for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to started buying building blocks for the family house she wants to put up for her children.

loans.use: To buy an ice chest, plastic bowls, cooking utensils and other items for resale

loans.name: Los Claveles De Morenita Group

texts.es: El Bancomunal Los Claveles D. Morenita esta ubicado en Huancavelica distrito D. Yauli, comunidad D. Ambato, entre arboles y pastizales se encuentran chozas que son casas D. adobes hechos con paja, es hermoso el paisaje, en L. zona vemos bastantes aves D. corral, gallinas y pollos.nLas actividades principales D. L. comunidad son L. elaboracion D. mantas Pullas- fajas coloridas con hilos sinteticos, tambien con lanas D. Alpaca. Maximiliana D. L. C., es casada, tiene 12 hijos, entre ellos 2 pares D. gemelos D. 3 años y D. 8 años, el mayor tiene 25 años. Maximiliana se dedica a tejer, tiene  telares D. pullas y mantos coloridos con hilos sinteticos, todos sus hijos trabajan en los telares unos ovillan, otros seleccionan, otros colorean hasta que vayan al colegios o L. universidad. Con los prestamos que ha recibido a podido crecer por que antes no tenia capital, tejia D. 5 a 10 mantas, ahora tejo D. 30 a 40 mantas y llevo a las ferias grandes. Maximiliana en su bancomunal ha recibido charlas las cuales le han ayudado  mucho, pertenece a L. Junta Directiva, es fiscal y se considera muy  puntual, ha aprendido ahorrar. Maximiliana necesita un prestamo para comprar un telar mas, su sueño es tener una empresa granD. con 30 telares y esta ahorrando para comprarse una maquinas remalladora. Isabel A., esta casada con 5 hijos D. entre 4 y 14 anos, Isabel empezo a vender golosinas en L. escueL. gracias al prestamo inicial que obtuvo D. Finca, abrio un cafetin en al escueL. donD. da pension a los profesores y enfermeros, aprendio a cocinar, Isabel considera que se le abrio una oportunidad granD.. Las dificultades que paso, es que L. operaron D. un quiste en los ovarios  y estuvo en reposo, su esposo L. ayudaba pero no era igual L. clienteL. bajo. Isabel es presidenta D. club D. madres D. su comunidad, agradece a FINCA porque aprendio muchas cosas, entre ellas a dirigirse a las personas, tratar con ellas y ver las necesidades D. su grupo, Isabel nos dice que cambio mucho su forma D. ser. Su prestamo lo va a invertir en comprar granos D. menestras y llevarlos a L. capital D.  Lima. Su sueno es que sus hijos tengan estudios superiores, y va ahorrar para que sus cinco hijos estudien.nnTeresa C., es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Empezo con L. venta D. los quesos  en un baldecito, por las calles  gracias a L. llegada D. Finca Peru a  a su pueblo pudo obtener un prestamo y comprar mas queso, otras entidades le pedian mucha cosas, titulos y elL. manifiesta que apenas tiene su chozita D. abobe y algunos ganados. Las dificultades que ha pasado es que se murio su hijo D. 27 anos y dejo solo a sus nietos y tiene que trabajar duro para mantenerlos. Teresa recibe charlas D. como ahorrar, antes era muy callada, ahora sabe expresarse.  Su sueno es comprar un carro, con el credito que obtuvo D. FINCA va a comprar mas quesos, tambien huevos D. corral para vender.
texts.en:
El Bancomunal Los Claveles D. Morenita is located in the Huancavelica district of Yauli, Ambato. Amidst the trees and pastures, lie the chozas, adobe houses maD. with straw. The countrysiD. is beautiful and there are plenty of domesticated fowl in the area, hens and chickens. The principal activity of the community is the production of mantas pullas - colorful belts maD. of synthetic fiber and also with Alpaca wool.

Maximiliana D. L. C. is married and has 12 children, including two sets of twins who are 3 and 8 years old and her oldest who is 25. Maximiliana is a weaver and has pulL. looms and colorful vestments with synthetic fibers. All of her children work with the textiles. Some roll the threads into a ball, others separate and others dye until they go to high school or the university. With the loans she has received, she has been able to expand the business. Before she had capital, she could only weave from 5 to 10 mantas. Now she weaves 30 to 40 mantas and brings them to the large markets. At the Bancomunal, Maximiliana has received workshops that have helped her greatly. She serves on the executive board as the finance officer. She considers herself to be very punctual and has learned how to save money. Maximiliana needs a loan to buy an additional loom. Her dream is to own a big business with 30 looms. She is saving to buy a mending machine.

Isabel A. is married with 5 children between the ages of 4 and 14. Isabel began her business selling sweets in the school. Thanks to an inicial loan she received from FINCA, she opened a cafeteria in the school where the teachers and nurses take their meals. Isabel learned to cook and believes this opened her up to a big opportunity. She has had difficulties in her life. She was operated on for an ovarian cyst and spent time in recovery. Her husband helped her, but it wasn't the same and the clientele decreased. Isabel is president of the mothers' club in her community. She thanks FINCA because she has learned many things such as how to direct people, do business with them and see the necessities of her group. Isabel tells us that she has changed as a person. She is going to invest her loan by purchasing dried vegetables and bringing them to Lima, the capital. Her dream is that her children receive a higher education. She is going to save so that her five children can study.

Teresa C. is married and has 7 children. She began her business selling cheese from a pail in the streets. Thanks to the arrival of FINCA Peru to her town, she was able to receive a loan and buy more cheese. Other groups asked for many things and certifications while all she had was her small adobe house and some cattle. She has faced difficulties in her life, such as the death of her 27-year-old son. Her grandchildren were left alone and she has to work hard to take care of them. Teresa received workshops on how to save money. Before she was very quiet, now she knows how to express herself. Her dream is to buy a car. With the credit she received from FINCA she will buy more cheese and also eggs to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El Bancomunal Los Claveles de Morenita requests a loan of $4775 so the 21 partners can invest in their businesses

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda, socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, vive en el Departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. el Dorado, distrito D. San José D. Sisa. Se dedica a la venta D. ladrillo y abarrotes, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Santiago Pérez s/n cdra 04 – caserío san isidro, sus clientes son personas que viven alrededor D. su barrio y D. la localidad.

Con este crédito D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará   leña en gran cantidad, combustible para la elaboración D. los ladrillos, además comprará productos para surtir su negocio como aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergentes, leche D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, para poder tener surtido el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.

Hermelinda tiene 36 años D. edad, tiene 03 hijos quienes están estudiando. Junto con su esposo comparten la atención en el negocio. Ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su negocio y a sus hijos. En un futuro cercano quiere comprar un carro para poder entregar sus productos y mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, a member of the "Corazón D. Jesús" Community Bank, lives in the San José D. Sisa district, El Dorado province, Department of San Martín. She sells bricks and groceries from a shop located in her house at Jr. Santiago Pérez s/n cdra 04 in the village of San Isidro. Her customers are her neighbours in the area and the town.

With this loan of $325, which she will repay in four months, she will buy a large amount of firewood, fuel for making bricks, as well as merchandise for her store such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent and milk of various brands and sizes, to stock the shop and meet her customers' demands.

Hermelinda is 36; her 3 children are studying. She runs the business with her husband. Both work to make the business a success and raise their kids. In the near future, she wants to buy a car in order to make deliveries and improve customer service.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy firewood, oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent and milk.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Rafiqan Noor Muhammad Group

texts.en:
My name is Rafiqan, and I am a 52 year old married lady.  I have resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 30 years.  I have no children.  My husband doesn’t criticize me about children.  He is a carpenter by profession, with 20 years of experience.  

He has a shop in Vehari where he displays his furniture.  Mostly, people of Vehari come to his shop and give orders for furniture.  I am a seamstress and sew clothes for my neighbors.  We have a good reputation in the community, and in the market as well.  

I have successfully repaid my two loans, which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now, I am applying for a loan to buy materials (wood, glue and nails) to make more furniture to resell.

I have some more members in my group.  Zaitoon Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.  Alveena Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.  Rukhsana Baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for making furniture

loans.name: Thab

texts.en: Mrs. Thab S. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder whose business is doing well, so she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions through this loan. Her husband, Mr. Choek Sruon, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, he uses rice to make wine to sell. Mrs. Thab S. is a 34-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en:
Since 2005 Muhammadjon G. has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has a daughter of 17 whom he needs to support and properly educate. Muhammadjon has improved his financial situation because he has been able to wisely use the loans he has received from IMON International to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivates (as dairy products) in the surroundings of his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
M. Sharif first applied to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2009. Sharif works in the local bazaar where he sells potatoes, onions and carrots that he grows himself. He has sold self-grown vegetables for 15 years and it provides the family's income.

Sharif asks Kiva for the business-support loan of 800 TJS for eight months to implement the seasonal works.

loans.use: to implement the seasonal works

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata has been a bites and charcoal seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for eight years. She belongs to Mwenge West group loan (Group code: 2020). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for nine hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more charcoal for sale and wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for bites preparation to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and help her grow her business.

Donatha is married and has four children,ages 19, 14, 11 and 7. She also cares for four additional defendants.

loans.use: Buy more charcoal, wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gilberte

texts.fr:
A.Gilberte est née vers l’année 1975; elle est célibataire et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Gilberte vend des pâtes alimentaires, des boîtes de conserve de tomates, de sardines, de petit pois, etc. Gilberte vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin.
