Le lieu de vente de Gilberte, c'est le marché de Gbégamey, un quartier populaire de Cotonou. Gilberte s’approvisionne en ces différents produits à Tokpa au grand marché international du Bénin. Gilberte veut renforcer son fonds de commerce et développer son activité afin de mieux servir ses clients et aussi de faire plus de profit. C'est pourquoi Gilberte sollicite l'appui de ALIDé en crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Gilberte Allagbe was born in about 1975. She is a single mother of two children who are both at school. Gilberte sells pasta, canned tomatoes, sardines, peas, etc. She lives with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Gilberte sells her wares in the market at Gbégamey, a working-class neighborhood of Cotonou. She stocks up on the various products at Benin's large international market in Tokpa. She wants to increase her working capital and develop her business to better serve her customers and to make a larger profit. That’s why Gilberte is requesting the support of Kiva Field Partner, Alidé for a loan. The meaning of Alidé in the local Fon language of Benin is, "there is always a path for the poorest of people." Benin is a small country in Western Africa, bordering with Nigeria, where GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cases of pasta, canned tomatoes, peas and cans of oil

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира Очилова  замужем, имеет сына и дочь, ей 32 года. 10 лет как Мунира выходит на рынок только по пятницам в городе и воскресенье на  большой базар в Кайраккуме. Она торговала мелочами: заколки и прочие бижутерии, и небольшой товар с детскими одеждами. Теперь получив кредит от кива в микроинвесте она приобрела постоянную точку в большом рынке не далеко от  города, где многие оптовики оптом закупают товар. Её товар  мужская  одежда, в настоящее время  летняя одежда. Зимой она продаёт зимнюю мужскую одежду(джемпер, брюки). Она своевременно погашает кредит и получала новые займы.
texts.en:
Munira O. is married and has a son and a daughter. She is 32 years old. For ten years, Munira went to the city market only on Fridays, and on Sundays to the big bazaar in Kayrakkum. She sold small items: hair accessories and other jewelry, small goods and children's clothing. Having taken out a loan with Kiva at MicroInvest, she has now acquired a permanent sales outlet at the large market not far from her town, where many wholesalers purchase goods in bulk. She now sells men's clothing, and at the present time, summer clothing. Over the winter she sold men's winter clothing (sweaters and slacks). She makes her loan payments in a timely fashion and has received new loans.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Modo

texts.en:
Modo P. sells green vegetables at the market and requests a loan to open up a shop. She is a 42-year-old woman who lost her husband during the two-decades-long power struggle in South Sudan between the government of Omar and the Southern Sudanese People's Liberation Army which ended as a result of the Naivasa Comprehensive Peace Agreement, signed in early 2003. Modo has four children who do not go to school. In the future, she hopes to be able to build a rental house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Omama

texts.en:
Omama B., age 32, is married and the father of two children. His children attend a good school in the community where the family lives. Omama works very hard to provide food for his wife and children. His wife is very supportive to him.

He sells poultry, such as egg-laying hens, broilers, and particularly roosters. He is been in business for six years now. He has a big cage in the marketplace of Suhum where he keeps and sells his birds. He mostly sells the egg-layers and roosters because he says the broilers are very expensive to rear. Nevertheless, he manages to sell some.

He requests your loan support to buy more birds to increase his profit margin. With the loan, he believes his dream of selling more can be achieved.

He belongs to the village bank called "Asomdwe Mma," which translates as "Peaceful Children."

loans.use: To buy a supply of poultry birds, such broilers and layers, in bulk

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 52 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business selling seafood such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Lorna earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her 13th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the immediate financial needs of her family. -------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old; she is divorced and the mother of four children. Three are currently in school whilst the eldest is learning a trade. She sells smoked fish and started her fish selling eight years ago at a community market where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand.

Beatrice buys stocks of fishes from the fish mongers sometimes when demand is high. She has a broad customer base and they travel from the other surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children who are schooling a better education through the proceeds from the business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Eteldita

texts.en:
Eteldita is 34 years old and has a business doing manicures and pedicures. She also helps her husband in his business selling construction materials, such as sand and crushed stone. Eteldita and her husband have four children.

Eteldita has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four years and belongs to the communal bank "Las Doncellas."  Eteldita hopes to use this loan of 1,500 soles to purchase construction supplies together with her husband and also to purchase products to continue implementing her manicure/pedicure business.

Eteldita is grateful for the financial support she has received from Manuela Ramos. Thanks to this support she has not only been able to expand her business, but has also been able to purchase things for her home and send her son to a good school. Eteldita's goals are to eventually construct her own home and to continue helping her son complete his studies.

loans.use: construction materials; supplies for nail salon

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “21 D. Febrero”, en el distrito D. D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y es madre D. 7 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la educación primaria solo hasta el 2do grado, vive en el Barrio D. Lacaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar una vaca y un toro.  Ella también trabaja con artesanías elaborando colchas para bebes, etc.

Su deseo es  poner una tienda para vender artesanías.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Señora Julia is a member of the February 21st Community Bank in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 49 years old, married, and has seven children. She was only able to study up to second graD. and lives in the neighbourhood of Lacaya. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organisation for two years. Her first loan of 500 soles was used for her business of buying and selling clothes. Julia now needs a loan of 1500 soles which she will use to buy a cow and a bull. She also makes handcrafted bedcovers for babies. Her wish is to open a store selling crafts. She enjoys the savings and meetings associated with the local community banks.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow and a bull

loans.name: Alozouhoin

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère d’un enfant. C’est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de qualité de toute sorte. Elle vend ses pagnes dans le quartier très vaste de Gbégnédji à Lomé. Elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Son commerce porte sur les pagnes Vlisco, Wax Hollandais et Hitarget. Elle reçoit ses commandes des femmes revendeuses de pagnes de qualité au Grand Marché de Lomé appelées les « Nanas Benz ». Pour renouveler son stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Vlisco, 10 pagnes Hitarget et 05 pagnes Wax Hollandais.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child. She's a traveling saleswoman, who sells quality pagnes (colorful African cloth) of all sorts. She sells her pagnes in Gbégnédji, a vast neighborhood in Lomé. She's well known to many people. Her business concentrates on Vlisco, Wax Hollandais, and Hitarget pagnes. She gets her orders from women, called "Nanas Benz", who resell quality pagnes at the grand market in Lomé. To renew her stock, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim P., 39, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She works as a farmer and typically makes US $5 every day, while her husband earns US $3 a day as a carpenter. They are also supported by their children, who are farm workers. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these times of economic difficulty, Lim P. is asking CREDIT for a loan of US $1,000 to aid her husband’s business. He currently works as a carpenter, and could make a lot more money if he opened up his own shop. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To open a carpenter shop

loans.name: G.s. Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: Mayra Ernestina Téllez B., Ana Cecilia R. Q. y Escarleth José Q. B. ambas conforman el grupo solidario Dios es Amor. La actividad económica de Ana Cecilia es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ella es una mujer muy responsable y abnegada y disfruta mucho su trabajo ya que todos en su comarca reconocen sus ricas tortillas, anteriormente Ana se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de domestica pero lamentablemente no le daba mucho tiempo para cuidar a su hija, por lo que decide iniciar un negocio que sea en su vivienda, para proporcionarle a su hija el tiempo disponible. Ahora se han unido las 3 para solicitar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la materia prima necesaria. El deseo de las 3 es salir adelante con sus negocios.
texts.en:
Mayra Ernestina Téllez B., Ana Cecilia R. Q. and Escarleth José Q. B. make up the communal group Dios es Amor. Ana Cecilia's business is the production and sale of tortillas. She is a very responsible and self-sacrificing woman, who greatly enjoys her work. Everyone in her region recognizes how delicious her tortillas are. Previously, Ana worked in domestic services, but unfortunately it did not leave her a lot of time to take care of her daughter, so she decided to start her own business out of her home in order to spend more time with her daughter. The three women have come together to solicit a loan for working capital used to purchase necessary primary materials. All three hope their businesses prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina P. is from Iligan City. She is 60 years old. Avelina is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector by making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Avelina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Avelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Avelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
Hilarión  vive en la calle  No 20 de la zona  Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en alquiler, tiene cinco hijos los cuales cuida su esposa. 

 Se dedica a la reparación de autos chocados, tiene su propio taller su esposa es la que le colabora en el trabajo. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materiales, como ser lijas, pinturas, masillas por cantidad, así le sale más económico.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Hilarión lives on #20 Street in the Huayna Potosi district of the city of El Alto. He lives in a rental property. His wife looks after their five children.

Hilarión operates an auto collision repair shop. He and his wife manage the business together. His loan will be used to buy materials in bulk such as sandpaper, paints, and putty because it turns out to be more economical. This is Hilarión’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials used for auto body repairs

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam V., 54, is a farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. He tills a 2-hectare rice field as the source of income for his family. He's a father of 2 children. The eldest is 24 years old. He needs additional capital to finance his farm. He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. He will use the loan to purchase farm supplies and improve his rice field.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is from the village of Santa Rosa. She is 39 years old. Marites is married and has 2 school-aged children. Marites raises livestock to make a living. She raises pigs for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for several years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the third loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Samith

texts.en: Samith S. is a 65 year old rice farmer who lives in Ank Prasat village in Takeo province.  She needs some money to buy a second cow for plowing.  Samith is a widow with four children; three are employed in a garment factory and the other attends a local school.

loans.use: Buy a cow for plowing.

loans.name: Jimailyn

texts.en: Jimailyn L. is from the village of Bato. She is 30 years old. Jimailyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jimailyn owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees & harvesting the fruit for sale. Jimailyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Jimailyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jimailyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jimailyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ayaba Georgette

texts.fr: H. Ayaba Georgette est née le 09 Mars 1972 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique. Depuis près de 7 ans, Ayaba Georgette vit dans le quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à NOUGBODE DJEDJE Toussaint, Ayaba Georgette est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. C’est avec ses enfants et son mari que Ayaba Georgette vit. Le conjoint assure la plupart des charges familiales. Mais Ayaba Georgette vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne l’entretien et l’éducation des enfants, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Ayaba Georgette a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Ayaba Georgette a un atelier de coiffure à son domicile et exerce cette activité depuis environs 12 ans. A côté de cela, Ayaba Georgette vend des mèches et d’autres produits de cheveux et de beauté à son atelier. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Ayaba Georgette s’approvisionne. Auparavant, Ayaba Georgette n’avait jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Ayaba Georgette sollicite ce premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
H. Ayaba Georgette was born on March 9, 1972 in Allada in the 'Atlantique' region. For nearly 7 years, Ayaba Georgette has been living in the Yénawa district in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to NOUGBODE DJEDJE Toussaint, she is the mother of two children, both enrolled in school. She lives with her husband and children. Her husband is the chief breadwinner for the family, but Ayaba Georgette helps him with the responsibility of taking care of and educating the children, thanks to the income from her little business.

Ayaba Georgette left off her studies in secondary school and learned to do hairdressing. She has a hairdressing salon in her home and has been in this business for about 12 years. Moreover, Ayaba Georgette sells hair extensions and other hair products and cosmetics in her salon. She gets her merchandise in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Ayaba Georgette has never before received a loan from ALIDé. She is requesting this first loan from ALIDé, in order to add to her stock of products and better satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions, cosmetics, and hair care products

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
la señora Alba Lidia I. tiene 32 años de edad, es madre de un hermoso varon de 11 años de edad, vive sola con el ya que su esposo se fue para estados unidos a trabajar, el tiene 10 años de haberse ido para ese pais en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo y de un mejor porvenir para su familia.
 
Albita como es conocida en su comunidad se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de vestir desde hace 8 años, tambien hace cortinas y ropa de cama, vestidos para quinceañeras y uniformes de colegio.
 
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de una maquina sorgeteadora para mejorar las condiciones del taller y dar unos finos acabados a sus prendas que fabrica.
texts.en:
Alba Lidia I., 32, has a beautiful, 11-year-old, son. She lives alone because her husband went to the United States 10 years ago to seek work and a better future for his family. Albita, as she is affectionately known in her community, has been a seamstress for 8 years; she also makes drapes, bedding, party dresses for quinceañeras (15th birthday party for girls) and school uniforms. She is requesting funding to buy a serger (a special sewing machine to do finishes on garments) to better equip her workshop and to produce fine finishes on the garments she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a serger (sewing machine useful for making fine finishes)

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie S. is from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Tessie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Tessie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca Ramírez Ramírez tiene 26 años, es soltera, y  tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son papas, maíz, cebada y arveja además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como borregos, gallinas, cuyes y chanchos los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria cocinar y caminar.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca Ramírez Ramírez is 26 years old, is single and has 3 children. She lives in the region of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.

The member is part of a small rural Group Enmanuel; it is in an area some 45 minutes from, Cantón Guaranda, capital of the province of Bolívar. There are 17 members in total, it is in a farming and cattle community, they are indigenous and all speak Quechua.

Maria works in agriculture to increase the household earnings. The crops that she grows most are potatoes, corn, barley, and green peas. Moreover, she breeds animals in her home like lambs, chickens, cuyes (a hamster-like animal) and pigs. The products she sells at home and what she grows she sells in the wholesaler market of Guaranda.

The main culture is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Maria also enjoys cooking and walking.

The member needs the loan to invest in her field work, mostly to buy fertilizers and manure. Her goal is to have a good source of income for her family. The problems that she has to face are climate related and the diseases that hurt her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Mayela es una mujer de 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene una bella hija en edad escolar. Vive en zona de la selva cuzqueña en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tienen una casa alquilada.

Mayela sabe lo difícil que es para una familia de pocos recursos económicos el progreso. Luego de trabajar durante casi 10 años en diversos oficios encontró algo que le apasionaba: la compra y venta de terrenos. Ahora no se arrepiente de haber incursionado en esta actividad, ya que le brinda buenas ganancias y siente más ganas de seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su familia. Trabaja junto a su esposo, y constantemente están en busca de nuevos terrenos en valle para lotizarlos y venderlos a un buen precio, ellos hacen un buen equipo. A mediano plazo piensa adquirir un terreno para luego construir su casa propia que tanto ansía.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, también agradece la oportunidad que le están dando para progresar y cumplir sus metas. Con el dinero solicitado comprara terrenos en lugares estratégicos, para venderlos a al mejor postor.
texts.en:
Mayela is a woman of 28. She is married and has a beautiful daughter of school age. She lives in wooded area around Cusco in the locallity of Quimbiri, where they have a rented house.

Mayela knows how difficult progress is for a family of few economic resources. After working for almost 10 years in various jobs, she found something that she is passionate about: buying and selling pieces of land. Now she does not regret having gone into this activity, since it offers good earnings, and she has a greater desire to continue working for the well-being of her family. She works with her husband, and they are constantly looking for new land in the valley to divide into lots and sell at a good price. They make a good team. In the not-too-distant future, she is thinking of acquiring a piece of land to build their own house, which she so much wants.

This is her third loan with MFP. Therefore she promises to make her payments on time. She is also grateful for the opportunity which they offer her to make progress and reach her goals. With the money that she is seeking, she will buy pieces of land in strategic locations, to sell them to the highest bidder.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 32 years old and is married to Purity Wanjiku. They have no children yet.
 
Kenneth has a computer services business where he does printing and photocopying and he offers internet services. He has been doing this for the past  year. His business is located near Kenyatta University and his customers are mainly students.

He had no previous credit history before joining KADET and this is his second loan from KADET. He plans to use the loan to buy another computer so that he is able to serve his customers well.

Kenneth hopes to venture into a real estate business in the future.

loans.use: He plans to purchase a computer worth Kshs 30,000

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: Franz tiene 20 años, vive con su madre en una casa alquilada. Desde su niñez aprendió el arte de la artesanía, como hacer mates burilados, convirtiéndose en un experto diseñando bellos adornos, en el que luego serán llevados a la ciudad para su comercialización a los vendedores de ferias artesanales. El trabajo que realiza lo hace en las instalaciones de su casa, quien en compañía de su madre la ayuda en la elaboración de este arte. Este negocio es rentable y ventajoso para Franz porque le permite disponer de su tiempo y a la vez cubrir sus estudios. Ahora anhela tener un taller más grande en donde pueda contratar mano de obra para seguir elaborando su artesanía. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, además se siente contento por ser invitado a formar parte del grupo comunal, por ser una persona muy responsable. Asimismo considera que el aporte que recibirá le ayudará en el desarrollo de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mates al por mayor por ello tendrá que viajar a Chiclayo para adquirir este producto al por mayor, en el que luego serán diseñados y trabajados de forma artesanal.
texts.en:
Franz, 20, lives with his mother in a rented house. As a child he learned crafts, specifically carved gourds, becoming an expert at designing beautiful decorations which will later be taken to the city to sell at crafts markets. He works at home and his mother helps him. It is quite a profitable business and is very advantageous for Franz because it leaves him with time to pursue his studies. He would like to have a larger workshop so that he can hire employees to help him continue making his crafts. This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to have been invited to be part of a communal bank because he is a very responsible person. He also feels that the funds he’ll get will help him develop his business. He will use the requested funds to buy gourds at wholesale to decorate. To do that he must travel to Chiclayo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gourds and pay for transportation costs to acquire them.

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es:
William es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi, palabra en quechua que significa Nueva Piedra. William es soltero, tiene 25 años y vive con sus padres.
William tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García de Huamanga en donde vende carne, ella compra los animales para la venta de las ferias, actividad que realiza todos los días.
William necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en al compra de ganado. Los sueños de William son comprar una casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
William is a member of the “Musuq Rumi” (a word that means “new rock” in the Quechua language) communal bank. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has a stall in the “Nery García de Huamanga” market, where he sells meat. He buys the animals daily at fairs. William needs a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) in order to invest in livestock. He would someday like to buy a house and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Mame Diarra compte à son actif 5 femmes comme seules membres. Il est dirigé par Madame Saye Sy B. âgée de 42 ans. Cette dame très dynamique s'active dans la restauration depuis plus de 10 ans. C'est un métier qu'elle a hérité de sa mère qui était une très grande restauratrice. Avec sa part du prêt, erlle souhaitait renforcer son stock riz et huile afin de mieux se préparer par rapports à la marche du marché. Elle compte également se lancer dans la vente de diner et ne plus se limiter aux petits déjeuners et déjeuners. Elle partage ce groupe avec 4 autres femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce de légumes. Elles sont Madame Fatou N. la trésorière, Madme Khady S., Madame Moussé Djiguène S. et Madame Khoudia N..
texts.en:
The group 'Mame Diarra' is made up of exactly five women. It is led by Mrs. Saye Sy B., 42. This very dynamic lady has been working in the cooked food business for more than 10 years. She inherited this business from her mother who was a well-known seller of cooked food. With her share of the loan, she hopes to bolster her stock of rice and oil, so that she can prepare as much as is needed on any given day. She hopes to be able to sell dinners, and not be limited to serving only breakfast and lunch. She shares the group with four other women who sell vegetables. They are Mrs. Fatou N., treasurer, Mrs. Khady S., Mrs. Moussé Djiguène S., and Mrs. Khoudia N..

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying rice and oil for her cooked food business

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun C. (pictured in her grocery store), 62 years old, is a widow with one son and four daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home and the other three work in a factory. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yoeun has been selling groceries for 10 years. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale at her home. She hopes to purchase more grocery items to better respond to her customer’s needs, so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
A. S. is married and blessed with two children. She resides in Ntamulung where she operates her business.

Due to problems involving her husband and a consequent lack of funds to care for her children, a friend advised her to join GHAPE, which she did in 2008. Her first loan of 40,000 FCFA was paid to her and a second loan of 150,000 FCFA in 2009. These loans have significantly improved her wellbeing and the business which she is running. A. want to invest her profits and this loan in medicines to sell.
The loan will help her community because drugs will be accessible to the sick and the health of the community will improve. Also, money circulation will increase in her community. She believes the business will succeed because she does not have many competitors and her capital has increased.

A. will use the profit to increase her capital, pay fees for the children, and buy food for her home.
She prefers GHAPE loans because they are simple to pay off, and she appreciates the management techniques that GHAPE teaches their clients.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Gladyz

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 26años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Casablanca, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, zona caractrizada por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales desde hace seis años. Ella compra animales de poca edad para criarlos y luego venderlos en el mercado de Lambayeque y ocasionalmente a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. Usualmente cría ovejas y aves de corral. Este negocio es la fuente más estable de ingreso con la que cuenta ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero agrícola. 

Rosa se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su esposo y darle a su familia la oportunidad de superarse, por ello desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar su nivel de ventas. Para lograr su meta se ha propuesto solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa yn crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Rosa ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, ella se encuentra muy agredcida con las personas que le ayudaron a crecer como empresaria, por el momento sigue trabajando arduamente para lograr su más grande anhelo: brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de progresar en el futuro. Rosa es una madre responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 2 children in the sector of Casablanca, a rural zone of Mórrope district. It's characterized as a rural, sparsely populated zone that belongs to Lambayeque province, located an hour from Chiclayo city. Rosa buys, raises and sells small livestock. She has done this for the past 6 years. After raising the animals she sells them in the Lambayeque market and sometims to visiting dealers. She usually raises sheep and poultry. This work is her most stable source of income, since her husband is a seasonal farm worker. She will keep working to help her husband and to provide her family with the opportunity to improve itself. It is for her family's sake that she hopes to expand her business by purchasing more animals and enriched feed, thus increasing sales. To reach her goal, Rosa has applied for a 1,500 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa has previously worked with Kiva and she is very grateful to the people who helped her grow as an entrepreneur. Rosa continues to work hard towards her biggest dream: to provide her children with the opportunity to advance in the future. She is a responsible mother who always watches over the wellbeing of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock and enriched animal feed to expand livestock business.

loans.name: Sayda Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señorita Sayda Mercedes T. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive en el sector de la Floresta que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe,  la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la cría de animales en especial ganado obteniendo la leche para vender y para realizar quesos, también se dedican a la agricultura y mucha de su población joven ha migrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años de edad es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres que es propia, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también es negociante de ganado, su padre es chofer.

La Señorita. Sayda Mercedes está estudiando en la universidad, sigue la carrera de Informática y cursa el cuarto año, en su tiempo libre trabaja en una agencia de envíos de paquetes y también se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal, lleva 3 años en este negocio.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en la fundación, fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, su crédito lo va  a invertir en productos Yanbal.

Su meta es obtener su Titulo profesional y comenzar la carrera de diseño textil.
texts.en:
Miss Sayda Mercedes T. is a member of the Barrio Sucre Communal Bank. She lives in La Floresta, a sector of the Cumbe parish, whose population mainly engages in breeding animals, particularly milk cows whose milk is sold and used in the cheese production. They also engage in agriculture, but many young people have migrated searching for a better future for their families. Sayda is 23 years old, she is single and lives in her parents' house (they own it). Her mother is a housewife and she is a livestock trader as well; her father is a driver. Sayda Mercedes is studying Informatics at the university: she is now attending the fourth year, and in her free time she works for a parcel services agency; on top of it, she has also been engaged in the selling of Yamabal products for three years (Yambal is a South American cosmetics company similar to Avon) . This is her third loan cycle with our institution. She was invited by her mother to be a member of this group of striving and resourceful women. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy Yanbal products. She aims to get her professional college degree and to begin studying for a degree in Textile Design.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Reymunda Juliana

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de telica se dedica a la actividad de comercio venta de ropa, de manera ambulante, en la zona de mina el limón, donde tiene 12 años de estar viajando y donde su mercado ya lo tiene cautivo, es casada pero vive separada de su marido, bajo su cargo tiene 1 hija de 32 años y un nieto de 14 años, también convina otra actividad comercial en su casa como venta de pan y sopa los día domingo, y venta de ropa en su casa y el mismo poblado
texts.en:
This client is from the town of Telica. She sells clothes in an itinerant manner in the Mina El Limón area. She has been traveling there, where she has a captive market, for 12 years. She is married, but she lives separated from her husband. She has a 32 year old daughter and a 14 year old grandson under her care. She also has another commercial activity in her house. She sells bread and soup on Sundays, and she sells clothes in her house and her town.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants for men, women, and children, blouses, sport shirts, skirts, men's t-shirts, sandals, boxers for men and women

loans.name: Renante

texts.en: Renante Q. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. He is 24 years old and is married with one infant child. Renante owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily making and selling roasted pig (litson) in kilograms in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Renante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Renante plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Avelina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, ella los compra pequeños y los alimenta y los hace crecer y los vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, este negocio lo realiza junto con su esposo que también tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio de crianza de chanchos y ampliar el lugar donde viven los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y también para comprar alimento para los animales. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yucaypata community bank; the bank is located in the Yuncaypata community, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Avelina; she is 49, married and has 1 child. She alternates her daily activities with her business where she raises animals such as hogs. She buys them small and feeds them, growing them and then selling them in the markets of Cusco city. She does this business with her husband who also has a small plot of land for farming. She wants to improve her hog-raising business and expand the area in which the animals live. She is requesting this loan to purchase hogs and also to purchase food for the animals. She thanks those who will be part of this dream through this loan and promises to repay the quotas as established.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing hogs, and also to purchase food for the animals.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi R. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Levi is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling school supplies like notebooks, school paper and so on in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Levi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional school supplies to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional school supplies to sell

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: El alquiler D. lavadoras es el negocio que Elsy D. L. SaL. inició hace más D. 5 años y que en el en   2007, se propuso fortalecerlo con los créditos D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque ya no alcanzaba a cubrir la demanda con solo 2 lavadoras que su esposo le había comprado para ese propósito.  Su negocio inició para satisfacer L. necesidades D. L. amas D. casa respecto a la disminución del esfuerzo y ahorro D. tiempo que requerían diariamente por este oficio que se torna agotador, sobre todo por el aguerrido sol D. la Costa Caribe, lugar donD. vieve Elsy. Ella cuenta con un triciclo en el que transporta sus màquinas,  tarea en la que le ayuda su hija mayor. Con el dinero generado por esta actividad Elsy ha logrado estudiar auxiliar D. enfermería y perfeccionarse mediante diplomados y estudios D. actualización, como el D. neonatal y muchos más. Su familia la conforman su esposo, empleado D. una empresa,  y sus 2 hijas en L. edades D. 15 y 10 años que aun estudian y sueña con verL. exitosas en sus profesiones futuras. Este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización D. la que siente un gran apoyo, porque impulsó su negocio con capital D. trabajo y con su crecimiento ha constribuìdo con Elsy en su desarrollo personal. Ahora con su credikiva comprará dos lavadoras más para reponer L. primeras que compró,  que ya tienen un deterioro notorio y no aguantan el trajin diario. A sus 33 años Elsy con su familia caminan en la misma dirección para progresar, porque mientras su esposo y ella trabajan, sus hijas estudian y apoyan la gestión empresarial y del hogar, para algún día tener muchas más oportunidades D. éxito en su vida. Su principal desafío es el poco capital D. trabajo con el que cuenta y que es requerimiento para que su negocio continúe saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
More than five years ago Elsy D. L. SaL. started a business renting laundry machines. In 2007 she sought to strengthen her business with a loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, as she was unable to meet customer demand with the two washing machines her husband had bought for that purpose.

She began her business to satisfy the needs of housewives regarding the reduction in effort and time savings of this tiring daily chore, particularly given the unrelenting sun of the Caribbean Coast where Elsy lives.

She has a tricycle she uses to transport her machines, a task in which she is assisted by her eldest daughter. With the income generated by this activity Elsy has been pursuing studies as a nursing assistant, perfected through graduate studies and updates, such as neonatal care and many other subjects.

Her family consists of her husband, employed by a company, and their two daughters aged 15 and 10 years who are still in school. She dreams of seeing them become successful in their future careers.

This is the second loan granted by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organisation that provided strong support, as it bolstered her working capital which contributed to Elsy’s personal development as the business grew.

Using her Kiva loan she will buy two more washing machines to replace the ones bought previously, which have deteriorated to the point where they can no longer withstand the daily grind. 

At 33 years of age, Elsy and her family are progressing in the same direction. While she and her husband work, their daughters study and help with the business and household tasks, so that one day they can have more opportunities for a successful life.

Her main challenge is the limited working capital she depends on and that is needed for her business to continue moving forward.

loans.use: buy two more washing machines

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther G., age 35, sells a variety of different items in her general store. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more bags of sugar, boxes, soap, and other items to offer for sale. Her husband is an NGO staff member. They have eight children, all of whom attend school. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to serve as a residence for the family.

loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar, boxes, soap, and other items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S., 51, is married with three children living at home in the Takeo province. She is a good housewife doing housework and cooking food for her family members. Her husband is a security guard, typically making US$3 every day. This family is also supported by two of the children working in construction.

Tep S. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 39 years old and a father of three. Despite issues of  limited working capital,  Amer was able to open a small grocery store which brings in a meager income for the family.

He  is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy goods for his shop and increase his working capital. He is looking  to expand his small grocery shop into a supermarket and buy his own house.

loans.use: to buy goods for his shop and increase his working capital

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter W., 37 years old, runs a cosmetics shop in Njiru. His Njiru market is on the outskirts of Nairobi so many people buy from Peter rather than making the trip to the city. He is married to Margaret and together they have a daughter, Joy, 10 years old. Peter was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Peter has been running this business for 10 years and his monthly profit is 16,000 KSH. This loan of 40,000 KSH is his second with KADET and he intends to use 10,000 KSH to buy hair relaxers, 20,000 KSH to buy hair bands, and 10,000 KSH to buy perfumes for sale. If the loan increases the business, Peter will be able to expand his inventory and increase his profits. This will enable him improve the living standards of his family and educate his daughter.

Peter dreams of opening a cosmetics wholesale shop in the future. He describes himself as aggressive.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, hair bands and perfumes for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros.

Her name is Irene, and she is 43 years old.  Irene is married and has four children, the oldest of which is 23 years old.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her restaurant.  She runs a restaurant out of her home in Cachimayo and sells all types of food, beer, and soda.  Her favorite dish to make is chicken with rice. Irene commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To Invest in a restaurant

loans.name: Kulola

texts.en:
Kulola is married with four children, three of whom attend school and one who is still too young. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Kulola’s greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, Kulola has operated a grocery shop, selling goods both door-to-door and from his house. His major business challenge is the high cost of transportation and he hopes to purchase a van for distributing goods. 

Kulola decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of  40,000 KES to purchase supplies of maize, sugar, cabbage and tomatoes.

loans.use: to purchase maize, sugar, cabbage, and tomatoes

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
Marcella is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Marcella operates a phone accessories shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  She hopes to establish another business in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase phone covers and batteries for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase phone covers and batteries to resell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester B. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Ester is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling animal feed & farm-related products like pig & chicken feed in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of feed. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional  feeds

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao was born in 1959 and is a widow  with four children.  Two of her children are drivers who earn a low salary, and the others are studying in the local public school.   Mao owns a general store in the local village where she earns some profit to support her family.   She is also a pig breeder.   
Her problem is that her children are doing work far away from her home.  Mrs. Mao is seeking a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her children's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Saul Humberto

texts.es:
Don Saúl, reside en San Miguel, tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su familia, posee una llantería, negocio que atiende de 7:00am a 5:00pm, la ubicación del  negocio le permite tener clientes ya que está instalado en la calle única que conectan a dos departamentos, esto le ayuda para tener un mayor movimiento de ventas.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de llantas, fortaleciendo el negocio para que los clientes encuentren de los diferentes tipos de llantas y tamaños, adecuados para las diferentes marcas de automóviles.
La aspiración de él es poseer en un futuro un nuevo local, administrando los dos paralelamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Saúl is 45 years old and lives with his family in San Miguel.  He runs a tire business which is open from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  The location of his business is good for customer access and sales since it is on the only street that connects two departments.

In order to strengthen his business he is requesting a loan to buy tires in a variety of types and sizes for different kinds of automobiles to meet customer demand. 

His goal for the future is to open another sales outlet and be able to manage both businesses at the same time.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Jusan

texts.en:
Jusan is a 38-year-old woman from Akko. She owns a toy and sweets shop which caters to locals and tourists in the old city. Jusan is expanding the shop to include popcorn, ice cream and cold drinks. Her shop is popular and in a good location with strong potential. Jusan is a serious woman who has taken her economic future in her own hands.

She needs this loan to help her purchase an ice cream machine and popcorn maker and for small renovations in her store. 

In the future Jusan wants to expand her shop into selling hot drinks and fresh fruit juice and smoothies. She also hopes to be able to hire staff after further expansion.

loans.use: to purchase an ice cream machine and popcorn maker and to make small renovations for her store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B., 54, is a married woman with three children, one who is in school. She makes food which she sells.

Rosita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy the ingredients she uses to make her food to sell. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosita has been in this business for twelve years. Rosita would like to save enough money to renovate her home and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients she uses to make her food to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto E. is 62 years old and lives in Talibon, Bohol, where he has been a fisherman for five years. He is asking for a loan to buy fishnets and bait, which will help him continue his livelihood.

Ernesto works hard to support his family. In the future, he hopes to venture into another business to supplement his income.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and bait.

loans.name: Pamela Lizet

texts.es:
Pamela es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad, viven en su casa propia con su menor hijo de 4 años, la cual cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Patapo a 30 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Pamela se dedica hace 2 años a la venta de artículos de piñatería (globos, piñatas, platos, cucharas y vasos de plástico,etc.), el negocio que tiene lo ha colocado en su casa para comodidad y seguridad de Pamela, la venta de todos estos artículos le ayuda a incrementar los ingresos , ya que es una actividad que pocas personas la tienen. Lo que le va a permitir tener un mejor nivelde vida  en su hogar.

Al ver que su negocio va creciendo a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para implementar su negocio con mercadería innovadora y así su clientela aumente, ya que su objetivo final es tener un negocio que se encargue desde la decoración hasta la comida para  todo tipo de eventos,lo que le va a permitir cubrir el crédito y brindarle una mejor oportunidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Pamela is a 22-year-old mother who lives in her own house with her 4-year-old son. Her house, equipped with running water, is located in the Patapo district, 30 minutes from the Chiclayo province, an area whose inhabitants engage in agriculture and animal breeding activities.

For 2 years Pamela has been engaging in selling party supplies (balloons, piñatas, plastic dishes, spoons and glasses among other things). For her own safety and convenience, she has established her shop in her own house. Selling these products helps her increasing her income and it will help herself and her family achieving a better standard of living, as this is an activity very few people engage in.

As her activity continues growing, she has asked Edyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 PEN to supply her shop with innovative products to increase the number of her customers. Her final goal is to succeed in taking care of every aspect of events organization (from decoration to catering), because in this way she will be able to pay for her loan and to offer better opportunities to her son.

loans.use: To buy innovative products for her shop.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells clothes. She is 32 years old, married, with five children. Four of her children go to school. Vivian requested a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.es:
La señora Melba Argentina de 66 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien inicio con la venta de comida y con las ganancias puso una modesta pulpería. Sus negocios según comento gracias a los préstamos y su labor han ido creciendo poco a poco  ahora tiene un mejor inventario y vende más.

Ella tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad quienes en sus tiempos libres le ayudan en el negocio. Melba con el crédito comprará mercadería y tiene la meta de  ser independiente y auto sostenible con su negocio y no prestar.
texts.en:
Melba Argentina, 66, is a hard working, dedicated entrepreneur who started out selling prepared food and then used the profits to set up a small grocery store.  Her businesses, according to her comments, have been growing gradually thanks to the loans and to her efforts; now she has better inventory and she sells more.

She has two adult children who help her in the store in their free time.  Melba will use the loan to buy merchandise.   Her goal is to be independent and self sufficient in her business to not have to borrow any more.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla de 39 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija que también se llama Karla de 5 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro, para poderle brindar una buena educación. La tienda de Karla esta ubicada en su propia casa, en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Ella se dedica en la venta de calzados, mercadería que trae desde la ciudad de Lima. Su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que los modelos que trae son novedosos y baratos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, pues ya lleva 4 años en este trabajo y manifiesta que continuará y por ello desea implementarse de más mercadería. Espera con el tiempo tener una tienda más grande de calzados donde pueda vender atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar sus planes. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos de la ciudad de Lima, para incrementar el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Karla is 39 years old. She is a humble and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her beloved five-year-old daughter, who is also named Karla. What she desires most is to work extremely hard so that she can provide her daughter with a good education. Karla has a store in her home, which is located in the central part of the city of Pucallpa. She sells shoes and acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima. Her business is very busy because she strives to bring back the latest models of shoes at low prices. What she enjoys most about her job is being able to sell. Karla has been in this business for four years and says she hopes to continue and acquire more merchandise. Over time, she hopes to have a larger shoe store where she can comfortably attend to her customers.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP. Karla hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can follow through with her plans. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more shoes in Lima so that she can increase the inventory in her store.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a hard working 34 year old business man.  He is married and blessed with three children ages: 9, 6 and 3.  He has been buying and re-selling scrap metal for the last 4 years.  He supplements his income by rearing bulls for sale.  Previously he used to cultivate crops. 

He wants in the next 5 years to own 5 dairy cows so that he is able to realize his dream of being a dairy farmer.  He wants a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy scrap metal for resale.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learned how to save.  On his bicycle, Jeremiah is carrying a sack of scrap metals.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en:
Oyundelger is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband is a plumber who owns his business. Her older son is a programmer in a private company while her younger one is a student. 

Oyundelger manages a handicraft-making business which started this year.  Before that, she worked as a dressmaker for private companies. Now she rents a stall where she sells her goods. Her business is operating quite successfully which allowed her to employ 3 more workers. She is planning to expand her business and wants to make a greater variety of goods in the future. She is a responsible and kind woman who is doing her best in order to manage both her business and private life properly. 

She says, "I am having more freedom by running my own business. I love doing it."  Oyundelger is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa vive en la ciudad de Managua.Trabaja  en el área de limpieza es madre soltera tiene cuatro persona a su cargo.

La señora Teresa acudió a nuestras oficina para solicitar un crédito por necesita pagar deudas que tiene pendiente con una institución bancaria de una tarjeta de crédito.
Agradece a ceprodel por es apoyo que se le brindo.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa lives in the city of Managua. She works in the janitorial field. She is a single mother and she has four individuals in her care.

Teresa approached our offices to request a loan because she needs to pay of loans debts that she has incurred with a financial institution through a credit card.

She is thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for the support provided.

loans.use: to cancel a debt.

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Ravy (in the photo) is 27 years old, while her husband is 36 years old. They have been married since 1992 and have two children--one S. and one daughter. They live in a village fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Ravy is a garment worker, while her husband is a farmer. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Siengneang

texts.en:
Siengneang, 45 years old, sells groceries, with $4 per day as her income. Her husband is a motor taxi driver whose income is $5 per day.  Siengneang has 5 children, two of whom are studying.  Two others are working in the factory and one more is a hairdresser at home. Every month, she has to spend $90 on food, $12 on electricity, $100 on rent house fee, $45 on school fees, and $5 on other expenses. 

Siengneang is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter's business.  In the future, she hopes to have more money to extend her grocery store to sell more goods. She wants to support her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 57-years-old and married with 2 children. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, noodles, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future Thelma would like to save money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maria; la socia tiene 42 años d edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 22, 13, 12, 5 años de edad, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista de frutas, ella compra al por mayor frutas de los terminales que llegan con sus cargamentos del norte del país y compra las diferentes frutas luego ella en sus domicilio ya los distribuye y en una carretilla acomoda la fruta y con sus bolsas y sus pequeña balanza de mano se va por todas las calles de mucho movimiento y se instala unos minutos en las esquinas  mientras las personas que pasan se detienen a comprarle por kilos y unidades, la socia trabaja diario y espera poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de fruta al por mayor .

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y asi mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “TRES DE MAYO”. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Maria. She is 42 years old and lives with a partner. The member has 4 children of 22, 13, 12 and 5 years of age. The member works in the retail sale of fruit. She buys fruit wholesale at the terminals where the trucks arrive with their cargoes of fruit from the north. She buys different fruit and then from her house she sets off with her wheelbarrow full of fruit, bags and a small hand scale. She makes her way along busy streets and sets up business for a few minutes at the corners whilst the passersby stop to buy her produce by the kilo and by the unit. The member works every day and hopes to give her children a good education. The member wants the loan to invest in the purchase of fruit wholesale.

The member is grateful for the support given her and agrees to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. Her youngest son is only 2 years old, while others are getting their education by going to a nearby school. Nasira sews clothes. She started this work when her children started their education. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. Her earnings allow her to pay off the school fees of her children. 

Nasira's husband operates a grocery store in the market. He sells different daily use items from his store like sugar, spices, rice, lentils, snacks, etc.. He is very good in his customer dealings and his rates are also very fair, therefore he attracts good customers at his store. 

Nasira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will put larger quantities of groceries in his store which will allow him to fulfill the demand of his customers and increase his sales and profits. She is very hopeful that her husband, who has been operating his business for the past 5 years, will successfully be able to improve his business condition after investing a loan into it.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim is 26 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is the leader of this group, which consists of four members.  Lim, Sin and Uch are fishery workers in the same work place, and (the other) Sin is a seller of mixed products. In order to ask for some funds from Kiva, they have joined together for a group loan, with different purposes in using this fund.
 
Lim is a previous client of HKL and Kiva and is an active borrower who made her repayments. Lim has two children who depend on her income and care. From her business, she usually earns around US$3 each day to apply toward the family’s needs. However, the main income is from her husband,  who works for a company and offers motor-taxi services in his free time. 

Lim has noticed that her husband’s motorcycle is too old and often breaks down, so it will not be comfortable for his customers. Therefore, she decided to ask for some funds from Kiva to add to her saved money in order to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband. In the future, she wishes to expand her existing business and make a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mère de sept enfants.Elle vit avec son mari et ses deux soeurs.Elle tient une boutique alimentaire(riz, huile,sucre, mil, arachide...) devant son domicile.Elle parvient à obtenir des bénéfices qui lui permettent d'améliorer la nourriture quotidienne de la famille et de satisfaire à ses propres besoins.Elle sollicite un pret de 300 000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires et renforcer ainsi son fonds de commerce.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The woman taking the loan is a mother of seven children. She lives with her husband and two sisters. She runs a business selling basic food items (rice, oil, sugar, millet, peanuts...) from her home. She hopes to have enough profits to improve the daily meals she provides her family and to satisfy other needs. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 cfa francs to purchase basic food stuffs and to strengthen the business' capital. Her goal is to increase the business' scope.

loans.use: to purchase basic food items

loans.name: Lodina

texts.en:
Lodina is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lodina is 60 years old.

Lodina has souvenir business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her business.

Lodina  has been in this business for 39 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her souvenir shop.

loans.name: Elvira Group

texts.en:
Elvira is 46 years old and married with six children. She lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Elvira is a farmer who grows watermelons. She has been doing this for 6 months. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her watermelon plantation. 

Elvira has been a member of PMPC for 4 months. She is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her watermelon plantation.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eseta owns and operates an agriculture business, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Eseta has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.
