In 2011, Eseta  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to continue her business activities. Eseta is requesting a first-time loan from SPBD of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, such as a new fence. Eseta  plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, such as a new fence.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 38 years old and married with five children. Four of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 43-year-old woman from Liposong, Ozamiz city. Norma is married and has five school-age children.

To earn a living, Norma operates a general store, where she sells everyday products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, to her local community members. Norma has been in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's living conditions. Norma is now requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to resell to her customers. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell to customers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 48 years old, she is married to David and they are blessed with four children.  She has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Judith will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for her stock.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old and is married with two children. She resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. For the past three years, Anita has owned and operated a business weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials. She earns 2,000 PHP each month. Anita joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Anita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. In the future, she wants to improve her house and expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Siguidia 1 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées, les membres du groupe   SIGUIDIA 1, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  avec en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  de Kèlèkèlè, dans le cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles mènent toutes une activité hivernale. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs productions, les membres de groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 8 ème prêt de campagne.
Nana, la seule assise, compte  utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences d’arachide et de sésame, des engrais et des herbicides, des pioches et payer les frais de labour et sarclage des champs ayant une superficie de 1,7 hectare. 
Sa production qui sera destinée à la vente à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs, lui permettra d’obtenir un montant de 270.000FA. Le bénéfice ainsi obtenu permettra de rembourser le prêt, constituer les trousseaux des jeunes filles pour leur mariage  et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SIGUIDIA 1" are all married women living in traditional families and averaging 36 years of age and four children each. The women all live in Kèlèkèlè, in Cercle de Kolondièba, and they know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They all have the same rainy season work. With the goal of increasing their production, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth loan. 

Nana, the only one sitting in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy peanut and sesame seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and picks and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding fields, which have an area of 1.7 hectares. 

The produce will be sold to a customer base composed of consumers and retailers. This will enable Nana to obtain the amount of 270,000 francs CFA. The profit thus obtained will enable her to repay the loan, establish hope chests for the girls' weddings, and to meet certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Benson is applying for a loan of 19,676 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, and he looks forward to establishing more farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children. 

She has had a dairy farming business for 8 years. She will be using the loan to purchase more dairy feeds and acquire high breed services and hopes this will help her to expand her dairy farming.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children well through University.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy feeds and acquire high breed AI services.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is 32 years old, married with three school age children from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is enagaged in hog raising business for ten years already and is making good sales from it. She is happy because she had received financial support from Paglaum MPC. Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 6,000.00 to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: María Barbarita

texts.en:
Maria Barbarita is mother of two little ones of 6 and 8 years and lives with her husband in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Facing the lack of financial resources to satisfy the basic necessities of her family, she searched for 3 years for something that would permit her to help her husband and bring her children a dignified quality of life. This is how she began to sell cosmetics by catalogue.

Now she needs a loan of $250 to keep supporting her family and give her kids an education. She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a 3-6 month term. Help Maria Barbarita and her fmaily. They need your support now - they will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Barbarita es madre de 2 pequeñitos de 6 y 8 años y vive con su esposo en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Ante la falta de recursos económicos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, ella buscó desde hace 3 años una actividad que le permitiera poder ayudar a su esposo y brindarles a sus hijos una calidad de vida digna. Es así como comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de 250 DLLS para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y darles educación a sus hijos. Ella planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Ayuda a María Barbarita y su familia, ellos ahora necesitan de tu apoyo, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Miss Ha and her husband have 2 children of 11 and 8. They have 2000 m2 where they built a hut and planted vegetable. Her husband plants vegetables in the dry season and in addition he works as a daily laborer but he can not easily find work. Selling vegetables is thus important for them for increasing their very small income: about $5/person/month.

Ha is a member of a credit group and has already borrowed twice, repaying every week $1- $2 for 45 weeks. This time she wants to borrow $75 to expand her small business and plant vegetables.

loans.use: plant vegetable

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang M. is 45 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 5 children.  She and her husband run a small auto repair shop--mostly fixing motorbikes.  They will use this loan to purchase tools for their shop so they can service more complex problems.  In the future, Tang M. and her husband hope to open a second shop that sells rice and soup.  They hope to earn enough money to give their children a higher quality education.

loans.use: To purchase tools for auto repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve his workshop and continue buying raw materials

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is married and has a little boy. He was unemployed and facing economic difficulties, which was a critical situation for him because he is the only provider for his household and for his mother as well. So two years ago he recognized the necessity of beginning his own business by selling refreshments and chicharrones (crispy pork rinds). Upon seeing that sales were going well, he decided to sell tacos and hamburgers too, which gave him a profit and enabled him to provide for his family and for his mother. He is very happy with his business and hopes to continue moving it forward and improving his personal growth.

Antonio is requesting a loan of $550 to be able to stock the ingredients for his business and buy a stove, fixing the room where they prepare everything, and enabling him to continue providing for his little son. Thanks for all your support, because this is how Antonio can improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Antonio está casado y tiene un pequeño hijo, al verse en situación critica de desempleado y estar en una situación difícil económicamente ya que es el único sostén de su casa y su madre, se vio en la necesidad hace dos años de iniciar su negocio de venta refrescos y chicharrones, y al ver que le funcionaba la venta decidió vender también tacos y hamburguesas, lo cual le dio resultado, y puede mantener a su familia y a su madre, él esta muy contento con su negocio y desea seguir progresando y continuar con el crecimiento del mismo.

Antonio solicita un préstamo de USD $ 550 para poder surtir lo elemental del negocio y comprar una estufa, arreglar el cuarto donde preparan todo lo necesario y seguir manteniendo a su hijo pequeño, agradece toda tu ayuda porque así puede seguir adelante.

loans.use: Remodel and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Elumwenma

texts.en: Mrs. Elumwenma O. sells fried bush meat to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 2001.  She is 32 years old, married with 4 children, lives in Benin City and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to enable her to buy more bush meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bush meat to sell

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha P., 57, is a widow with three children: one son and two daughters. Her only son does farming at a farm not far from home, and both of her daughters weave silk at home. Pha and her children live on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since she was young. It's a skill she learned from her mother.

Pha is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.ru:
Narzullo J. is 30 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 1 child. Narzullo sells winter men’s clothing at the central market of Kurgan-Tube. His main products are men’s sweaters and he will use his loan to purchase male winter jackets. As a result, residents of Kurgan-Tube and nearby areas will be able to purchase winter clothing as the other market is 100KM away. Narzullo plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Джайлобов Нарзулло, возраст – 30 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 1 ребёнка. Нарзулло занимается продажей зимней мужской одежды на центральном рынкем в городе Курган-Тюбе. Так как основной его товар это мужские зимние свитера, на полученный кредит он планиует приобрести теплые мужские зиминие куртки. Так как в зимний сезон они пользуются спросом, жители города Курган-Тюбе и близлежащих районов будут иметь возможность приобрести зимную одежду, так как другой рынок находится в 100 км от города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase winter jackets

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria G. is a woman who, for many years, worked in a small school in León, El Sauce teaching preschool and primary level students.

As an only child, she works diligently to support her elderly parents who need her so much. One of the family’s most pressing needs is to invest in the infrastructure of their home. She began construction work in a small part of their home, but she needs to purchase more materials in order to continue the project and not leave it only half done.

Ceprodel has been helping her with loans that she directly invested in the construction of the living room, the first part of her home. However, she still has to work on the patio, bathroom and bedrooms, which she would like to finish before summer when prices are higher. Her credit record includes 3 Ceprodel loans, each of them paid back on time and under the terms agreed to by both parties.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Maria G. es una dama que por muchos años se ha dedicado a la docencia desempeñándose como maestra de niños atendiendo preescolar y primaria en un pequeño colegio en la ciudad de León en el municipio El Sauce.

Por ser hija única, se esfuerza grandemente para llevar el sustento a sus ancianos padres que tanto necesitan de ella. Un a de las grandes necesidades que atraviesa esta pequeña familia es la urgencia de invertir en la infraestructura de su local. Actualmente ha iniciado con la construcción en una pequeña parte de su casa pero le urge la compra de los materiales para continuar con dicha construcción y no dejar a medias la obra que ha iniciado.

Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que los invirtió directamente en la construcción de la primera parte de su casa como lo es la sala pero aun le hace falta el patio, baño y cuartos que pretende terminar lo mas pronto posible antes de que llegue el verano y se den lugar a grandes perdidas materiales y económicas. Actualmente su record es de 3 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por ambas partes.

loans.use:
Purchase of construction materials

Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is married with 3 children. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She is into tailoring and spent 3 years learning her trade. She has been in business for 9 years and needs the loan amount of $450 to buy cloth for sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sale

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Silverio is a 54 year old man. He sells grains, travelling throughout different parts of the country in order to buy his products cheaper, which he then sells back home to the clients that requested his products. His wife helps him with the daily expenses. She sells tortillas in her neighborhood. Silverio has been in this business for 15 years, and he is a very hardworking man. He wants to have his own store where he can sell his products and in that way formalize his business. He will use the loan to buy grains for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Silverio es casado, tiene 54 años, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, viaja a los diferentes departamentos de nuestro país para buscar sus productos y de esa manera comprarlos más baratos, para luego venderlos a los clientes que le encargaron sus productos. Su esposa lo apoya con los gastos de la casa, la señora se dedica a la venta de tortillas las cuales las ofrece en su barrio. Don Silverio tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio, es un hombre negociante y muy trabajador, espera en un futuro tener un puesto de venta fijo donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y de esa manera establecerse de forma más formal. El préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos

loans.use: To buy  grains  for his business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina has her own home. She lives on Los Rios Street in the San Jose de Yunguyo zone located in the city of El Alto. She is the mother of 6 children, ages 22, 18, 16, 13, 8 and 6 years respectively.

She is dedicated to the sale of different types of construction gloves. Said sales are carried out in the various markets of the city and nearby provinces.

The loan is destined for the wholesale purchase of merchandise, in order to reduce her expenses.

This is the second loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina tiene casa propia, vive en la calle los rios de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es madre de 6 hijos, de 22, 18, 16, 13, 8 y 6 años respectivamente.

Se dedica a la venta de diferentes tipos de guantes para la construcción, dicha venta la realiza en las diferentes ferias de la cuidad y en provincias cercanas.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería al por mayor, así reducirá sus gastos.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To purchase construction gloves wholesale.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly L., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sophat Mao, 43, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three daughters, one of whom is in school, and the other two are still young, so they stay at home.

Mrs. Somaly has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sophat has been a silk weaver since 2000 as well. He learned his skill form his wife.

Now Somaly is requesting a loan of US$100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en: Rubaba was born in 1961. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Khaodjali in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the Absheron region. Rubaba is a mother of three children. She has been in this business for seven years. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 30-year-old, single man who lives in a small village situated in the West Bekaa, on Lebanon's border with Syria. Mohamad owns a "take a break" restaurant in the same area where he lives. The location is perfect for this type of business. His amazing hospitality and generosity attract clients of both nationalities to Mohamad's restaurant.

Mohamad needs a loan of $US1,200 to conduct maintenance for his restaurant and thereby expand his business. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Proceed with maintenance for a restaurant

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi Y. is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Esi sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then send them to the market for sale at Elmina.  She has been in this business since 2004. Her husband is a salt producer. Esi uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and other utility bills. Esi will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish. With the profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to help her husband build a house for their family.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Maria España

texts.es: La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el Jr. Mariano Melgar Nº  596, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Ttiene 52 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de fréjol cocido. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, venta de fréjol regional y canario. Se levanta a las 3 a.m. a cocinar sus fréjoles para luego salir a venderlos a las 6 a.m. en el mercado Micaela Bastidas. nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 15 kilos de fréjol regional y canario. nnGracias al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos sus ventas han crecido y en estas últimas semanas sus clientes han aumentado con la bendición de Dios.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria belongs to the "Mujeres Perseverantes" Communal Bank, located at 596 Jr. Mariano Melgar, in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo Province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has three grown children. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 2 years. She invested the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, of $100, into the sale of cooked beans. Today, she continues to sell a variety of regional bean dishes. She gets up at 3 a.m. to cook so that her dishes will be ready for sale in the Micaela Bastidas market by 6 a.m. With this new loan of $400, which will be payed back over 4 months, she will buy 15 kilos of beans. Thanks to the Manuela Ramos, her sales have increased and she has been blessed with an ever expanding number of clients. .

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of various beans

loans.name: Magali Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Magaly es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de jorge Chávez II”, vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su casa ubicado en el jr José Saavedra  C-3 MZ B L8, lugar donde acuden sus clientes todos los días desde muy temprano.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como jabón en caja de diferentes marcas (marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.) papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergentes, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, para ofertar a sus clientes.

La señora Magali tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus 03 hijos quienes están estudiando. Junto con su esposo comparten la atención en el negocio. Está agradecida por el apoyo brindado que le permite crecer en su negocio. Desea surtir su negocio para asegurar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magali is part of the communal bank, The Little Stars of Jorge Chavez II. She lives in the province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She sells groceries out of her home, which is located at Jr. Jose Saavedra C-3 MZ B L8, where her customers come every day beginning early in the morning. With this loan of $375, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy various groceries such as different brands of soap (Marsella, Bolivar, Jumbo, etc.), packs of toilet paper, canned fish, cooking oil, rice, sugar, bleach, laundry detergent, and different brands and carton sizes of milk, which she will offer her customers. Mrs. Magali is 32 years old, and she lives with her three children, who are in school. She and her husband run the business together. She is grateful for this support that will help her grow her business. She hopes to stock up her business to ensure sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Tonnere Group

texts.en:
André B. operates a drugstore in Bumbu (an Eastern suburban area of Kinshasa). He is 61 years old, and a father of six children who are between the ages of 2 and 30. Three of them are already married, and two are students and live with him.

He began his business in 2004, after the company where he used to work closed due to political and economic instability. He started his business with a capital of $100. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, Andre’s business has prospered and has permanent customers to keep it up. André’s wife is a nurse and has been helping him by promoting the business. As a nurse, she has been helping André make the best choices about purchasing appropriate drugs in the area. She works with him in developing the drugstore. They both like their business and they also like talking to their customers about their health. André has been in one of Hope’s loan groups since last July. He is planning to expand his business with the new loan, by opening another drugstore.

loans.use: To expand the business by opening another drugstore

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Sreang Thorng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people in Srae Spey village in Kampong Cham province have taken a village bank loan and Mrs. Kim Sreang T. is the village bank president. She sells vegetables in the local market. She buys them from the other villagers to resell. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Ek Sokhea, is a construction worker. Mrs. Kim Sreang T. is a 26-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Muborak and her husband can give to their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of sheep. Muborak and her family are waiting for your quick response.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Sang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Pech Entrea village in Takeo province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Vanny S. was selected by the members to be village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Since her  chicken-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens and chicken feed to earn more income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mak Thy, is a construction worker. Mrs. Vanny S. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom stay at home to do housework and help the parents work while the others are enrolled in the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Shitu

texts.en: Shitu produces and sells nylon in her shop located at Agege. She goes to Idumota (within Lagos) to buy raw materials for the production of nylon. Shitu learned her business in 6 months and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. Shitu is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She wants the loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase raw material for the production and sale of nylon. She is happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for nylon production

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. sells provisions and drinks. She is a LAPO client.  She is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Mr. Tom T., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Vanna Nheak, 41, live on National Road No. 1 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have eight children, seven sons and one daughter. One of their sons is married and lives away from the family home. Four of their children help them farm, and their three youngest sons are still in school.

Tom and his wife have been famers for 25 years, growing mostly rice and cucumbers. In addition to farming, Tom is also a fisherman. He has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel oil for his farm, and also to pay various fees for plowing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and other items, and to pay fees for plowing.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan S. is 25 years old.  She lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she owns a plot of farmland for growing crops. Her husband works with her on the farm. The couple now lives with two children, both of whom are still young and enrolled in school. Kan S. noticed that the business of raising pigs is very profitable because pork is now commanding high prices. Therefore, she would like a loan through Kiva to provide capital to buy piglets and also to fund the growing of crops.

loans.use: To buy piglets
